The Caelestis descends through the storm and finally drops into the long fissures which dominate the mostly frozen landscape, a welcome reprieve from the wind, which goes from deafening and attempting to spin the team like a children's toy to merely loud and buffeting. In the newly cleared visibility the blue ice around the fissure is more striking, a strange chemical compound with a much bluer hue than typical frozen water, frozen and shattered into sheer cliffs hundreds of meters high.

Suddenly a flash, bright enough to be seen even through the driving slush, lights the left front quadrant of the ship, a split second at then it's gone.

A crash on the fissure wall to your right and a massive crash of ice falls from the cliff face, an avalanche that could bury your ship if it had fallen in front of you instead of slightly behind.

""Incoming fire from the cliff walls."" Came the calm, manufactured voice of BiLi. ""Accelosphere blast, very inaccurate at this range, much less in these extreme conditions."" Is there a hint of... contempt in that voice? Hard to tell.

BiLi is right, there's not a change someone is hitting the Caelestis with an Accelosphere at this range, the guns are practically museum pieces. But Aran doesn't doubt that a decent gunner could bring down an avalanche that would stop the ship just as surely as any explosive blast.

This segment will be a Contest between Aran and the gunner. Aran will roll to try and keep the Caelestis moving through the valley to your destination while a gunner is trying to bring down the walls, neither of you is really able to bring your forces directly against the other so there will be no Stress inflicted or anything, just checking how we manage to get there. The Contest is to 3 Victories using the Gunners +3 (they have a spotter who's giving them a +1 to their standard +2) versus Aran. Our heroes are able to provide a passive +1 by just describing their help, or attempt a Create an Advantage every round to help in more drastic ways. A failed Create Advantage may create the Aspect with a free Invoke for our Gunner friend.
The crew can almost hear the whine of the Accelosphere as the flash repeats, a split second to react to the incoming fire.
dice roll

Aran exhales with a loud hiss, her heart rate slows, she is calm...combat, she was born to it.  ""BiLi, pinpoint that flash position.  Calculate a field of fire and time and distance until we are clear.""  She punches buttons on the control deck, increasing speed while pulling back on the yoke to gain altitude.  

She waits for the flash, as soon as the sphere lets go, she dives to avoid ice debris coming off the wall and punches up the Caelestis's thrusters for a burst of speed to get out from under the avalanche.

Krit felt the ship unexpectedly lurch beneath her, stumbling out of the alcove they'd generously dubbed a room and into the narrow hall beyond. They were under attack, a quick-fire instinct driving her to barrel headlong down the corridor before she'd come to fully process that. Taking the advice of a 'break glass in case of emergency' box as she gained on the junction just outside the ship's hold, heaving herself bodily against it to retrieve the signal gun within.

She still didn't have a plan. Not like Selena. Not like Aran. At this point reacting to stimulus as she secured herself to one of the seatbelt-style stevedore hooks they used for loading cargo and partially lowered the ramp. The sudden change in pressure and blast of arctic winds knocking the breathe from her like a league tackle as she squeezed the trigger.

The ship now trailing flares she hoped would play havoc with whatever was tracking them Krit only now considered if that was something she'd learned from Aran or an old action-vid.

They were the gunner's own thoughts, they just had to be pushed to the front. Going home was more important than the job, more important than anything.

The winds of Riskan IV howled over the dry clack her emptied signal gun coughed out, the last of its payload illuminating a pair of gunners Krit could see leering back at her from across the expanse. The accelosphere they helmed having played havoc on the Caelestis' flight path as it flayed the fragile fissure walls down around them. She couldn't imagine the pressure dodging under the erratic canopy of plunging crystal was putting on their pilot, a task she might have made all the harder thanks to her quickfired flares.

They could see the ship that much more clearly, better gauge where it was heading. Krit even suspected they could make her out through the icy mess filling the air. A thought that had her fast exhausting her extensive litany of obscene and goading gestures in an attempt to incense the pair to an act of less calculated violence, knowing full well their outmoded artillery would miss by a mile.

Treated to the disorienting shift in scenery Aran's aerial acrobatics brought about Krit looked 'up' from the massive drop below her and onto the jagged wall of ice scrawling by. They were gaining altitude--fast--her stomach was telling her that loud and clear. Even if it didn't take the ship out of firing range those gunners weren't about to bring the whole damn cliff down on themselves. That'd be crazy...

Just crazy enough to have Krit unbuckled for the second time in the same hour, swinging by the tightly gripped tether she unfastens. Both boots raised for the side of a container she hoped was empty near as much as she hoped this stunt of hers would work.

They weren't the only ones that could improvise an avalanche!

Aran's maneuver skims the Caelestis low above the ice rubble below, rough tumbles of rock and ice which would tear the ship apart at the speeds you're moving, despite the soft look of them covered in snow.

Still, Aran's reflexes win the day. The gunner clearly fires from as far out as the weapon could turn but only a small patter of ice falls over the ship, not even enough to dent the hull. As the ship clears the firing arc the blue navpoint of the original coordinates shines before you only a bit ahead, a large cave seemingly dug into the cliffs, large enough for the ship to land safely.

Selena's touch is light on the gunner's mind, garbled and tough to read at this familiarity. Still, she could feel the biggest and most obvious thoughts, most specifically those that formed speech. ""Shit! They're out of the arc. Moving toward the main entrance, looks like. Maybe we can catch them there."" The man processed his uncertainty and disquiet at the response, a sharp twist of anger with the thought Yeah, like you'd have shot better you drunk... and then ""No one can hit at that range with this junk. I told Ratigan the Guild would sniff around here. Let's get inside it's cold as hell. I hope we can even find him and the guys in this maze.""

The thoughts grew fainter as the wrapped up figures disappeared through the doors, becoming only a vague sense of consciousness before disappearing.

""It appears scavengers made it here before us, somebody called Ratigan is in charge. I didn't get an idea of how many are here, but the gunner thinks it's a maze in there so it may take a while for them to organize.""

She then reached out to activate the intercom. ""Krit, close the cargo bay door and then look for crate number..."" She read off the inventory number of the supplies she'd recently acquired. The military winter survival gear would be better than the civilian versions even if it was surplus, her former time serving with the 40th Recon Lance meant she knew how to shop smart when it came to this kind of stuff.

""Came loose when Aran pulled back on the stick. I told you these straps were a joke!"" </p><p>Klassic Kosmik.</p>

""We'll have to make do then. The gunner was complaining about the cold, so that should mean the inside is kept at a comfortable temperature.""

""That doesn't excuse you having the cargo bay door open though, the cost to replace everything should come from your cut. And make a note for the next time we do maintenance to replace any worn cargo straps.""

""Should but won't princess."" Krit returns, a firmness under her chuckle as she takes a friendly jab at the psychic's haughty imperial heritage. ""But we can cuddle up if it gets too nippy out there for ya!"" she jokes, much too loudly as always. Representative or not Ms. Kosmik had a habit of shirking Selena's 'orders' in her own way, even if the work itself usually got done. A competitive streak encouraging her to butt heads when presented the opportunity, if only lightly.

""Stellar moves as always Aran. Bet those dorks are staining their snowsuits right about now!""

""Great! Of course hostiles got in ahead of us.  No tellin' how many copies of that data chip that swindler has sold, and to whom!""  Aran listens to her crew mates go back and forth about the loss of their cold weather gear.  What else could go wrong on this expedition?  Whatever it is, she's sure it will.  She smirks at Krit's jab at Selena's royal personage.  She has no ill will for Selena but she just can't quite let go of the fact that the woman was an army grunt.  

Still high on the adrenaline rush in her system, when Krit blames inferior cargo straps for the loss of their gear, she jumps on the comm, ""Hey!  The Cae is a topflight boat!  She's fitted for optimal performance at all times, I see to that!  The Caelestis is ALWAYS a space worthy vessel!""  Realizing she came off a little too defensive, she stutters, ""Uh, well anyways, thanks Krit.""  She casts a sheepish glance towards Selena.   

Aran checks the monitors as she reduces speed.  The ship computer outlines the cave entrance.  ""Our destination is dead ahead, in that cave.  Are we landing?""

""Now that they expect us the front door is dangerous, but it will take them time to get organized. The only other immediate option is using the door on the weapon's platform. That would mean hovering, and either leaving you behind or using the autopilot to land later.""

""Or would could pick a spot and blast through the wall. That would give us the element of surprise back, but we don't know the layout and without proper equipment we shouldn't compromise the facility too much.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Now that they expect us the front door is dangerous, but it will take them time to get organized. The only other immediate option is using the door on the weapon's platform. That would mean hovering, and either leaving you behind or using the autopilot to land later.""</p><p>""Or would could pick a spot and blast through the wall. That would give us the element of surprise back, but we don't know the layout and without proper equipment we shouldn't compromise the facility too much.""</p>

""Listen to you two, what's the fuss? We just strut in like we own the place and score an easy payday. Probably just a bunch of low-g dopes that couldn't score a license hold up in there anyways, right?"" Krit goads from a comm situated along the shortest path to her quarters; after three-weeks cooped up in the Cae it was going to take allot more than some armed goons and a bit of cold air to curb her excitement. 

Funny thing was it always got the athlete in her a bit homesick to hear Selena spout off all their plans and options. Reminded her of how coach would lean into the huddle with the sort of sage advice that looked good on a tablet but didn't last long out on the court. ""Ditching Aran's a no go, obviously."" she concedes, working her way through the list their imperial chaperone presented. ""And I don't think we brought a shovel big enough if blasting in goes badly."" Krit chimes in from the panel just above her bed, transmitting the sound of her flipping the mattress to retrieve a few essentials. ""So, either we go ring the doorbell, sit around making snow martians or...""

Or. Or was a four-letter-word when Krit was tossing it around. All too often it meant she was about to try and rope the others into something crazy by dressing it up like a concession. ""We could try that door up on the cliff like you were saying, bet they didn't even lock it."" Then came the catch, leaving Aran with the ship was already off the table after all. ""I'm series 7 baby! The sportsgrav of performance athletes. I'd probably be winning the Pathfinder marathon right about now if the guild didn't scoop me up. Climb like that looks E-Z, I can probably even do it hauling you lightweights along too.""

Not exactly the sort of sentence one wanted to find a probably in, but it was an option.

""Are you two nuts?""  Aran snaps.  ""You want to go back? That gun crew is probably sitting by the door waitin'.  They scan us coming, step out and finish the job.  Buried under the wreckage of the Cae, frozen in snow isn't how I plan to go out!  What are we here for anyway?  This ""outside interest"" is putting up some serious competition! I'm gonna need a bigger slice of the pie.""  Aran gives Selena a hard stare, wanting more details of their mission.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Are you two nuts?""</strong>  Aran snaps.  <strong>""You want to go back? That gun crew is probably sitting by the door waitin'.  They scan us coming, step out and finish the job.  Buried under the wreckage of the <em>Cae,</em> frozen in snow isn't how I plan to go out!  What are we here for anyway?  This ""outside interest"" is putting up some serious competition! I'm gonna need a bigger slice of the pie.""  </strong>Aran gives Selena a hard stare, wanting more details of their mission.</p>

""I sensed them moving off, and they were thinking they'd meet us at the front door. At least for as long as I could keep the connection.""

As she thought back to what she'd overheard she remembered something. ""The gunner told Ratigan the Guild would be sniffing around, meaning these people aren't members. So that fixer obviously sold to others, he must have decided that later or I'd have detected something was up.""

Now really wasn't the time for contract negotiations, besides the Guild had professionals for that. ""If the standard hazard pay isn't enough you can talk it over with your Guild representative when we get back. Right now you need to decide how to get in, we need to hurry before they can get organized.""

""The gunner told Ratigan the Guild would be sniffing around, meaning these people aren't members. So that fixer obviously sold to others, he must have decided that later or I'd have detected something was up.""</p><p>Now really wasn't the time for contract negotiations, besides the Guild had professionals for that. ""If the standard hazard pay isn't enough you can talk it over with your Guild representative when we get back. Right now you need to decide how to get in, we need to hurry before they can get organized.""</p>

""Still don't know what we're here for."" she mutters.  Bringing the Caelestis about, she guides the ship back into the chasm.  ""Gear up!   Looks like we're going climbing.  You ready for some exercise Kosmik?""  She winks and flashes a toothy grin at Selena.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Still don't know what we're here for.""</strong> she mutters.  Bringing the <em>Caelestis</em> about, she guides the ship back into the chasm.  <strong>""Gear up!   Looks like we're going climbing.  You ready for some exercise Kosmik?""  </strong>She winks and flashes a toothy grin at Selena. </p>

""We're here for the same thing as always, salvaging alien information and technology.""

""So you vote for the climbing option?"" Their climbing gear hadn't fallen overboard, being useful in multiple environments it wasn't with the arctic supplies.

""Considering the welcome on arrival a profit sharing deal is probable already off the table, we need to go in prepared for combat."" That was always a waste, and often meant damage to the irreplaceable alien artifacts they'd been sent to recover.

That was always a waste, and often meant damage to the irreplaceable alien artifacts they'd been sent to recover.</p>

Kosmik's outfit spoke for itself and ready didn't even begin to describe what that tight enough to be painted on nanoprene was saying. It wasn't simple bulk responsible for sculpting the definition she so proudly displayed, there was 'more' of it in a literal sense. She had completely different muscle groups than either of the women with her, easily driving home her earlier comparison to a performance vehicle. 

The small pocketed vest she had buttoned over it had a statement as well, mainly that she didn't want to put anyone's eye out due to the cold.

With a bandoleer of wedge shaped capsules, a sturdy forked truncheon on her hip and no climbing gear to speak of rounding out her decidedly non-lethal armaments the woman signals her readiness with a raised thumb and toothy grin. ""I'd better be! Looks like you put on a few extra pounds lounging around the cockpit."" Krit teases approaching the bottom of their ascent and offering a shoulder to either ally. Going so far to take a knee and fake strain as Aran hopes aboard.

""Somebody time me!""

Going so far to take a knee and fake strain as Aran hopes aboard.</p><p>""Somebody time me!""</p>

Aran shakes her head.  Selena and her ""need to know"" way of disseminating information.  But Aran doesn't really care, she's being paid and paid well by the Guild.  Still, she'd feel better if their crew wasn't one member down.  Since Moiety disappeared on Drarvis 6 a few months back, they've never gotten around to finding a replacement.  ""Damn"" she whispers, remembering all their frustration at having to leave without learning what happened to him.  She snaps back to reality.

""BiLi take control of the ship.  Fix position until released, then ascend to a lower atmospheric holding pattern and activate a defensive initiative.  I'll signal for pick-up.""  Aran unbuckles her safety harness and leaps from her seat.  ""Understood Aran, I will make it so""   replies the ship's AI.  ""You ready Kiran?"" she pulls her sidearm from its holster and gives it a once over as they make their way to the Cargo Bay.  When they get close to the hatchway a blast of freezing air hits them.  She zips up her flight suit to help against the cold.  And there's Krit in a body suit  and wind vest.  ""What tha...""   she thinks.  

""Let's do this!"" she shouts over the buffeting gale ""Don't you drop me!""  She grabs hold of Krit.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Aran shakes her head.  Selena and her ""need to know"" way of disseminating information.  But Aran doesn't really care, she's being paid and paid well by the Guild.  Still, she'd feel better if their crew wasn't one member down.  Since Moiety disappeared on Drarvis 6 a few months back, they've never gotten around to finding a replacement.  <strong>""Damn""</strong> she whispers, remembering all their frustration at having to leave without learning what happened to him.  She snaps back to reality.</p><p><strong>""BiLi take control of the ship.  Fix position until released, then ascend to a lower atmospheric holding pattern and activate a defensive initiative.  I'll signal for pick-up."" </strong> Aran unbuckles her safety harness and leaps from her seat.  <strong><span style=""color: rgb(151, 72, 6);""><em><span style=""color: rgb(151, 72, 6);""><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);""><span style=""color: rgb(149, 55, 52);"">""Understood Aran, I will make it so""</span></span></span></em></span></strong>   replies the ship's AI.  <strong>""You ready Kiran?""</strong> she pulls her sidearm from its holster and gives it a once over as they make their way to the Cargo Bay.  When they get close to the hatchway a blast of freezing air hits them.  She zips up her flight suit to help against the cold.  And there's Krit in a body suit  and wind vest.  <em>""What tha..."" </em>  she thinks.  </p><p><strong>""Let's do this!""</strong> she shouts over the buffeting gale <strong>""Don't you drop me!""</strong>  She grabs hold of Krit.     </p>

On their way to the cargo bay Selena checked her own pistol, but once she arrived she decided she needed a little more.

She was the last one out, light body armor added over her bodysuit and carrying a rifle that was still familiar even if the iconic banana shaped magazine now held a power cell instead of bullets. She also wore a light pack, nothing like her military days but enough for some essentials. For her those essentials included a small case in which vials of psionic drugs carefully rested, in case her mental abilities needed a boost.

""That's how we're doing this?"" Selena vanished into the cargo hold once more, a few moments later she returned and tossed a climbing harness to Krit. ""Put that on, I need something to clip to.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>On their way to the cargo bay Selena checked her own pistol, but once she arrived she decided she needed a little more.</p><p>She was the last one out, light body armor added over her bodysuit and carrying a rifle that was still familiar even if the iconic banana shaped magazine now held a power cell instead of bullets. She also wore a light pack, nothing like her military days but enough for some essentials. For her those essentials included a small case in which vials of psionic drugs carefully rested, in case her mental abilities needed a boost.</p><p>""That's how we're doing this?"" Selena vanished into the cargo hold once more, a few moments later she returned and tossed a climbing harness to Krit. ""Put that on, I need something to clip to.""</p>

""Oh!""  Aran runs over to a locker in the bay area and pulls out her own mission bag.  Normally she would take a rifle and body armor as well but this time...naw.  She doesn't want to weigh down Krit anymore than she has to.  ""Almost forgot.""  she says slipping on her pack.  ""Gheez, its only, what, 30 meters down? You can hold on that long Selena.""  Aran laughs, grabbing hold of Krit again.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Oh!"" </strong> Aran runs over to a locker in the bay area and pulls out her own mission bag.  Normally she would take a rifle and body armor as well but this time...naw.  She doesn't want to weigh down Krit anymore than she has to.  <strong>""Almost forgot.""</strong>  she says slipping on her pack.  <strong>""Gheez, its only, what, 30 meters down? You can hold on that long Selena.""  </strong>Aran laughs, grabbing hold of Krit again.</p>

Krit complies with Selena's precautions all whilst yukking it up alongside their ace pilot. ""Doubt it Aran. I've seen thicker hands playing cards."" The harness given a parting tug after she secures it to make sure everything is firmly in place and offers a final word of warning towards the imperial. ""Just make sure you cut loose if the wall starts to give. I'm more likely to fall through you than on you."" That lovely little mental image exactly the sort of thing someone fastened to a Jovian needed to hear just before they'd jumped.

Kosmik had leapt for the crystalline surface that stretched above them, forcing new hand and footholds from it as she moved their combined weights. Divots, cracks and crumbling wounds left along the once pristine surface she scales leaving no possibility of a safe descent behind them as the sliding plastic hatchway shuttering off the interior approaches

In that critical moment her right arm fumbles its way for some sort of handle or traction as a sound like ice settling into a warm glass starts to catch up to the trio.
dice roll

""Just make sure you cut loose if the wall starts to give. I'm more likely to fall <em>through </em>you than on you."" That lovely little mental image exactly the sort of thing someone fastened to a Jovian needed to hear just before they'd jumped.</p><p>Kosmik had leapt for the crystalline surface that stretched above them, forcing new hand and footholds from it as she moved their combined weights. Divots, cracks and crumbling wounds left along the once pristine surface she scales leaving no possibility of a safe descent behind them as the sliding plastic hatchway shuttering off the interior approaches</p><p>In that critical moment her right arm fumbles its way for some sort of handle or traction as a sound like ice settling into a warm glass starts to catch up to the trio.</p>

Butterflies fill Aran's stomach as Krit struggles to gain a handhold on the ice wall.  ""Holy Schnikes!"" she yells.  Her reflexes cause her to make a desperate grab for the harness Krit is wearing.  She looks down gauging the distance to the weapons platform, trying to decide if she needs to make a jump for it.  She just thought she was cold, until her blood freezes in her veins at the sound of cracking ice moving along the wall.  This is one of a few times in Aran's life when she has known true fear.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Butterflies fill Aran's stomach as Krit struggles to gain a handhold on the ice wall.  <strong>""Holy Schnikes!""</strong> she yells.  Her reflexes cause her to make a desperate grab for the harness Krit is wearing.  She looks down gauging the distance to the weapons platform, trying to decide if she needs to make a jump for it.  She just thought she was cold, until her blood freezes in her veins at the sound of cracking ice moving along the wall.  This is one of a few times in Aran's life when she has known true fear.        </p>

Selena glanced at Aran's hand hold on the harness, but didn't say anything.

Though she'd been skeptical it was now obvious that riding on Krit was the only safe way to go, if they'd made individual ascents the damage Krit did to the ice would make it much harder for the other two to safely make progress.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Selena glanced at Aran's hand hold on the harness, but didn't say anything.</p><p>Though she'd been skeptical it was now obvious that riding on Krit was the only safe way to go, if they'd made individual ascents the damage Krit did to the ice would make it much harder for the other two to safely make progress.</p>

The crackling of the ice below sounds like a roar of the crowd as Krit manages to get a hand over the edge of the metal struts holding up the Accelosphere cannon and the small metal observation platform it's attached to. The edge bends just slightly, but holds the weight as Krit pushes herself up over the edge and deposits the three Guild Members onto the stingingly cold platform.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The crackling of the ice below sounds like a roar of the crowd as Krit manages to get a hand over the edge of the metal struts holding up the Accelosphere cannon and the small metal observation platform it's attached to. The edge bends just slightly, but holds the weight as Krit pushes herself up over the edge and deposits the three Guild Members onto the stingingly cold platform.</p>
After a moment to recover Selena unhooked herself from Krit, then spoke to her. ""Before we go in could you break that gun?""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>After a moment to recover Selena unhooked herself from Krit, then spoke to her. ""Before we go in could you break that gun?""</p>

column4: As the pilots of both Vanguard and Checker

column1: squadrons enter the briefing room, they were greeted by the sight of a tired
and dried out looking Mon Calamari, unusually nervous looking Bothan
intelligence officer and Commander Syrush. In the room were already Major Lomax
and his two lieutenants, a Zabrak girl and a Weequay male. The major himself
had his feet on the table and all three marines appeared somehow bored, but
ready to spring to action at a moment’s notice if needed.

Sitting at the back of the room near the wall and not yet wearing her armor but rather her hoody with the hood down, Jessa raised her hand. ""That plan sounds good and all but what if we jump in and they have a small fleet waiting? What are the orders then? Abort or try to punch through?"" the young girl said. 

She was still quite tired and did not feel like flying for another month or so but on the other hand she welcomed the chance to not think about too many things. ""Also uhm... I dont want to step on anyone toes... me being new here and all but... isnt the baron a little too uhm... important to risk? I'm sure checker leader would be up for the task."" 

After finishing the girl leaned back and waited for an answer.

Amara sits with the rest of her squadron, slumped in her chair and her signature cigar in the corner of her mouth. She glances at Jessa as the girl speaks up and shrugs. ""Certainly. But we're Rebels. As far as the Imps are concerned, we're terrorists. We don't have manpower to spare, and people don't sign up with us for afternoon tea and rosebush competitions. Nobility means fuck all, pardon my language."" 

She takes a puff from her smoke, and turns to address the Lieutenant. ""What's our MO regarding Imp personnel in the station? Obviously we don't have time to faff around guarding prisoners. Do we accept surrenders and take the risk of leaving them locked up somewhere, or do we play it safe?""

Take what we can and rig the reactor to go critical. Let the prisoners go to the escape pods if they wish or burn in an attempt to save the station...""

Jessa's eyes were fixed on the Mon Calamari

""Sir... you said it yourself... we are to become space pirates... I do not know who of the here present WAS one before but I have... And i can tell you this: It is as important to send a message to your victims as it is to get the booty. If we blow the station we show the Empire we are an actual threat... that they have to take us serious... that we are not just a small annoyance to them... force them to commit more forces in the attempt to hunt us. And while this will make life more dangerous for us.. isnt that the agenda of this splinter group?""

The mandalorian shook her head while continuing ""The rules of war are a good thing... it protects civilians... but that station is a military target... the people there made their choice to be there... the empire is the enemy and we have to show them that while we fight for the rebel ideals of peace and equality... we also are willing to fight the empire whatever the cost.""

After that, the girl sat in her chair, no longer slumped but determined, a fire burning in her eyes, the hatred against the empire clearly noticable to everyone present.

Borun sits in his chair, calmly, silent.

A new name, for let the imperial think they were other people. But with the same colour scheme as before or after.

He senses his tentacles tightening around his mouth.

Acting as space pirates, making it painful to let them live, maybe even personal.

Thinking of home; he is dead already, no one expects him to win the war, no one expects him to come back. He's dead already.

Bring in two squadrons together and a new commander; perhaps the best decision of the whole mission, as Kesal and Kariya would have tried to compensate differences. 

He lifts a hand, waits until there is silence in the room.

""Will we make a training swim before, Commander Syrush?""

Looking around the room, he adds:

""Is this all we have left as pilots?""

column3: DDEX2-01 - City of Danger - 1. Hatred Like Clawed Wind

column4:
The rumors you heard about the harshness of the city of Mulmaster may have seemed exaggerated at first, but having spent a few days in the City of Danger, those rumors were completely accurate. The citizenry of Mulmaster is openly hostile to outsiders, the City Watch little more than licensed bullies, and the merchants only as friendly as the coins you can offer.

When it looked like you might have to leave the city for lack of coin, lodging, or employment opportunities, Tymora’s  fortunate gaze fell upon you. A wealthy merchant named Astrid Saj, looking for a way to gain a noble title for her house, decided to hold a party at her estate. This celebration, open to all, is planned to last for a full ten-day, with all social classes of the city free to partake of the food, drink, and entertainment. A number of temporary servants have been hired to act as guards, servers, bouncers, entertainers, cooks, spies, or other positions. With little money and fewer prospects, you find yourself in Mistress Saj's employ. She has proven herself a generous employer and has provided you with food, lodging, and some coin for your efforts. More importantly, you are getting the opportunity to mingle with citizens of Mulmaster, from the wealthiest nobles to the lowliest beggars.

Certainly some adventuring work will come from this!

It is the second day of the festival, and today’s festivities at the Saj Estate have been quite peaceful, with only a disorderly drunk or an unskilled pickpocket occasionally causing a stir. That’s why it’s surprising that the loudest and most violent confrontation didn’t involve revelers, but was instead a melee between two servants.

One of Mistress Saj's seamstresses—a young woman called Binnacy—a seamstress for Mistress Saj, surprised everyone by brutally attacking a stable hand called Larch who was later escorted home by the City Watch, bruised in body and ego. As your shift ends, you are approached by a man whose crooked staff and brooch identify him as member of the Cloaks, the organization that any citizen practicing arcane magic in Mulmaster must join.

“I am told that you witnessed an attack on my brother earlier today,"" the man says pointedly, ""Perhaps you could explain why he hasn't made it home yet.""

Ryn had been working as a type of entertainer, that mistress Saj’s staff referred to as a person of interest, employed to use his knowledge and foreign experiences to provide interesting conversation for the guests. 

Since technically everyone was a guest , and surely mistress Saj wished to curry favor with the Cloaks as well, Ryn was still trying to employ his charm, 

“Good evening master mage. I did see a young man escorted out of the estate by the city watch, but I assumed he was the guilty party being taken to confinment. Perhaps the city intends to ransom him for release?”

Valornor, who had been hired as a guard of sorts.  He and a dozen other archers had been stationed on the catwalk, that ran along the edge and three times crossed the shorter span.  Near the top of the forty foot high great hall.  Just below the roof rafters.   They had been tasked above all, with the safety of Mistress Saj.  For rumors had reached her ears that their was a plot a foot.  Put forth by some rivals to attempt to assassinate her at her own party.  

The wood elf had been had been above the portion of the hall where Mistress Saj was seated in the place of honor at the high table at the head of the hall.  The incident concerning Mistress Saj's seamstress and the stable hand had taken place at the other end of the hall.  So he had only heard about what happen second or third hand.  For they had been told to be wary of being drawn away from the area where they had been assigned.  By possibly staged distractions.   Thus he had not seen the incident himself.

Having been relieved of his duties and slacked his hunger and thirst.  With food and drink that was provided for them.  Having been paid, Valornor was leaving, heading toward his usual nighttime accommodations.  When he overheard the crooked staff bearing man make his inquiry to the the short eared half-breed.  The only thing that came to mind was.

""Excuse me, I could not help but overhear. Another possibility was that he was injured.  Though I did not hear of such being the case.  Perhaps he was taken to a infirmary at one of the Temples here in the city. To be attended to there.  I wish you well in seeking out the whereabouts of your kin.""

Marenus looked back and forth between the magic man and the storyteller.  He was there to keep things from getting out of hand, and this Cloak did not seem to be causing any trouble.  As for the stablehand...he was in the hands of the authorities, and no longer Marenus' or Marenus' employer's concern.  The wizard's brusque attitude might make him a cause for concern, but the storyteller seemed to have things under control, for the moment.

Shift changes always offered opportunities for mischief, so the stocky barbarian returned to scanning the room.  He kept one eye on the magic man, however, ready to throw himself between him and the storyteller should the need arise.

Ume was squatting, digging through the items in her pack, when the Cloak approached. She'd been hired on as additional staff to work in the stables as the mounts and teams of the guests required consistent attention. When the man's voice was directed toward her, she closed her pack and slowly stood. She stretched her arms over her head and caught the edge of the hayloft as she stretched out her spine.

She stared down at the cloak and held his gaze for a long silent moment, before she said, ""I know not why Larch did not arrive at his home, while he was escorted by the City Watch. As you see, we have only now finished our tasks for Mistress Saj.""

Nori adjusted her cloak over her scales nervously but looked the man in the eye working to bluff her way through. ""Having been invited as a personal guest of Mistress Saj's I was embarrased for her at the spectacle that happend. Servants acting in such an indelicate manner. How inccorigble. I haven't the faintest idea where the young man went.""

The dragonborn, her white scales shining under the sturdy brown cloak when she moved was noticed too often to pretend to be something she was not. Here it was easier to fall into the intricacies of court and guide things to Mistress Saj's liking with a subtle hand and temparate air. Her former faimilarity with the court came in hand in time's such as this. She rarely enjoyed treading on the familar ground but the jewels she had received as payment earlier made it easier to swallow come the end of the day. She longed to remove the burden of the court and relax over a mug listening to the easy revelry from the entertainers in a near by high end Tavern.

Nelvon looks a little taken aback by Valornor's barrage of questions, but quickly recovers. ""Let me see, we grew up here, Larch still lives with our parents over towards the dockside.  This is hardly temporary, he's been a stable-boy too long, he wishes to dedicate his life to Tyr - though given the Seamstress apparantly bested him his training must still be lacking.  As to his friends and associates I try to keep my distance, in my work I gain many enemies - I had hoped that by distancing myself he would be less of a target.""

Valornor asks around, as far as witnesses are aware Binnacy's attack came from no-where, Larch was just minding his own business when Binnacy hit him with enough force to near knock him down. Sounds like she was angry and had to be pulled back before doing him more serious injury. He looked a bit daze so some nearby guardsmen offered to escort him home for a rest.

NB: The shrine to Talos is outside the city walls, the guard tower there isn't really where you'd expect a prisoner to be taken.

A short while later when Valornor again meets up with the others, including those that had questioned Mistress Saj's seamstress, Binnacy.  After exchanging what information they had all learned.  The Wood Elf Ranger said.

""If we don't handle this correctly.  The situation doesn't look very good for Larch.  An we could have the whole of the City Watch down on us.  Surely their actions can not be sanctioned by whomever is in charge of the City Watch.  Perhaps if we go to the commander of the City Watch and explain the situation.  That some of his Watchmen have unlawfully taken Larch prisoner.  He who is the brother of one of the members of the Brotherhood of the Cloak and is holding them in the guard tower outside the city.  Near the shrine of Talos.  They would have to act, just to assure discipline in their ranks.  Also, If they took no action.  News of it would reach the Brotherhood of the Cloak.  Which they would not want to get on the bad side of.  I think for now, this would be the wisest course of action to take.  What do the rest of you think?""

As an aside the watch in Mulmaster is near famed for being lazy and corrupt... not to say they wouldn't help you, but it may take time and/or coin to persuade them...

You encounter no guards on the way - if you want their support you'll need to send someone to request it.

The dogs seem eager to please, and seem to confirm Binnacy's story - leading you to the tower overlooking Talos' shrine. Their eagerness dies down as you get close however, and they seem to get nervous and skittish - like they're in the presence of a large predator.

- Do you want to spur the dogs forwards with you to the tower (Wisdom/Animal Handling 15) or you can either tie them up somewhere nearby or you're reasonably confident they'll run back home if you let them loose.

The watch tower where Binnacy’s siblings are stationed looks like most of the other towers set into the walls  surrounding Mulmaster. It is roughly 20 feet tall, providing access to the top of the city wall. A single door leads into the tower from this side of the wall. As you approach the tower, a strong gust of wind hits you, nearly to knocking you off your feet.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>As an aside the watch in Mulmaster is near famed for being lazy and corrupt... not to say they wouldn't help you, but it may take time and/or coin to persuade them...<br></em></p><p>You encounter no guards on the way - if you want their support you'll need to send someone to request it.</p><p>The dogs seem eager to please, and seem to confirm Binnacy's story - leading you to the tower overlooking Talos' shrine. ,

I'm less worried with you and your longsword at my side though.""  </b></p><p><strong><br></strong></p><p>She turns to the closest guard and throws a dagger from her belt.</p>

With the winds dying.  Still moving a pace.  Valornor swiftly scabbarded his longsword and reaching low he let his shield fall from his arm onto the walkway.  As he had practiced at least a thousand times.  Once his left arm was free, he unlimbered his strung longbow from over his head and shoulder.  While at the same time reaching back with his right hand and drawing a arrow from its quiver.  He brought it around and nocked it.  Then coming to a stop, (After moving 35 feet) He took aim and shot the arrow at the dark robed figure.
dice roll

Ume moved out of the trap door toward the nearest guard as she watched the ritual. Feeling uncomfortable, about the location of a sacred ritual as well as the person performing it. The fact the person needed guards to protect them during the ritual made her believe she must disrupt it. A sacred flame illuminated the area around the priest, in a lancing pulse of light and divine fire.
dice roll

Ryn, you see the arrow harmlessly deflected away from the priest, do you want to attack the priest or a guard with sacred flame?

Marenus rushes forwards and his axe bites deep into the closest guard who crumples to the floor.

column3: [Chapter 1] Mourning at The Troll's Tongue

column4: The sun crests the walls of Auerswald to a chorus of rooster crows. Its orange rays banish the previous night's shadows and rouse you awake as they pass over your eyes. Whether stepping downstairs from your room or travelling the length of the town you make your way to the common room of The Troll's Tongue; a two-storey reinforced wattle and daub building with a tiled roof and two single-storey buildings attached on either side. The titular signpost hanging above the door is painted with a severed river troll's head and its tongue hanging out of its mouth. Inside the common room is massive, bigger than the interiors of many other buildings that share the same street. The floor is covered by clay tiles in a checkerboard pattern of white and brown, but its hard to make out under the layers of stained rushes. A large stone hearth dominates one side of the room with a collection of sleeping patrons, dogs and discarded earthenware steins arrayed in front of it. The plaster walls are dotted with paintings obscured by a thin layer of dust, though close inspection reveals them to be depictions of fishing boats and hunting parties.

column1: You step up to the bar and find the only other ambulatory inhabitants; Claus and Hagen. The former is idly pulling pickled eggs from a large ceramic jar and popping them in his mouth, dressed in his usual leather apron and white linen shirt with his black felt beret topping his head. The latter, sitting bleary-eyed in his brown doublet and black pumpkin hose, is nursing a stein in front of him. Claus wipes his mouth off on his sleeve as he notices the new arrivals, coming out from behind the bar to put a table and some chairs upright, ""Apologies. We were feasting last night in remembrance of Longshanks Warmund. I'll get you something to eat, there's some perch and cabbage soup still boiling in the kitchen. Perfect thing to start a Marktag with.""

""That'll be fine, and thank you."" Anders sits at the table with an upright and unwavering posture. His brown eyes scour The Troll's Tongue, not because he has deciphered any evil within, but simply due to long habit. When Claus returns, Anders removes his cowl, revealing a long scar on the left side of his face spanning from brow to chin. He glances at his soup but then looks up to grab the barkeep's eyes. ""And who, might I ask, is Longshanks Warmund and why should I remember him?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""That'll be fine, and thank you."" Anders sits at the table with an upright and unwavering posture. His brown eyes scour <em>The Troll's Tongue</em>, not because he has deciphered any evil within, but simply due to long habit. When Claus returns, Anders removes his cowl, revealing a long scar on the left side of his face spanning from brow to chin. He glances at his soup but then looks up to grab the barkeep's eyes. ""And who, might I ask, is Longshanks Warmund and why should I remember him?""</p>

Claus slurps from the ladle he'd only just filled Anders bowl with, ""He was some sort of templar for Taal and Rhya, traveled the area tending their shrines he did."" The innkeeper points over Anders' shoulder in a northerly direction, ""-he was spending the night before last at one of their groves between here and the village of Steche when the goblins got him. Made a mess of him. The Roadwardens found what was left of his head skewered on Taal's horns. Grisly sight. Green bastards must have ate the rest of him, only scattered pieces of meat otherwise, not even enough to fill a post hole in Morr's garden."" With a smile, Claus leans down, ""Enjoy your food, sir. Let me know if there's anything else I can provide.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Claus slurps from the ladle he'd only just filled Anders bowl with, ""He was some sort of templar for Taal and Rhya, traveled the area tending their shrines he did."" Green bastards must have ate the rest of him, only scattered pieces of meat otherwise, not even enough to fill a post hole in Morr's garden."" With a smile, Claus leans down, ""Enjoy your food, sir. Let me know if there's anything else I can provide.""</p>

The rough looking elf slides into the common room, his morning walk from the cheap hostel had done nothing to raise his disposition of humans. Messy. It was all so messy and hectic.

Glaring round the room he walked up to the table and sat down two seats away from the young witch hunter. He glances briefly at the man, before scowling at the table. He knew him from the temple, an....   associate of Magnus’s. He was pretty sure the man disliked him, everyone did. Well, that was humans for you, just had to put up with it as best you could.

“You have water?” He asked. He hadn’t meant it to sound rude, he often didn’t, but old habits and all that.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The rough looking elf slides into the common room, his morning walk from the cheap hostel had done nothing to raise his disposition of humans. Messy. It was all so messy and hectic.</p><p>Glaring round the room he walked up to the table and sat down two seats away from the young witch hunter. He glances briefly at the man, before scowling at the table. He knew him from the temple, an....   associate of Magnus’s. He was pretty sure the man disliked him, everyone did. Well, that was humans for you, just had to put up with it as best you could.</p><p>“You have water?” He asked. He hadn’t meant it to sound rude, he often didn’t, but old habits and all that.</p>

Claus looks up and seems to visibly recoil ever so slightly at the elf's arrival. He chews on the inside of his cheek for a moment and then lets out a hoarse chuckle, ""Water? You need a basin drawn? I can set one on a table for you over there. If it's for drinking..you might want to avoid that unless you court the flux. Though perhaps your kind don't..."" His sentence trails off as he wipes his hands off on his apron, ""-I'll brew some barley tea, all the same, in case you change your mind.""

He chews on the inside of his cheek for a moment and then lets out a hoarse chuckle, ""Water? You need a basin drawn? I can set one on a table for you over there. If it's for drinking..you might want to avoid that unless you court the flux. Though perhaps your kind don't..."" His sentence trails off as he wipes his hands off on his apron, ""-I'll brew some barley tea, all the same, in case you change your mind.""</p>

Coriael smirked,

“Tea will be just fine. Thank you.” He added quietly.

“You know, if you took care of your rural waterways more carefully then you’d have less to worry about. I found a woodsmans drop toilet not a dozen yards from a stream in the forests last week. 

That’s not even thinking of the infestation of goblins.

Really, we should be doing more.” He seemed blissfully unaware of the condescending nature of his words.

Thank you.” He added quietly.</p><p>“You know, if you took care of your rural waterways more carefully then you’d have less to worry about. The elf finds he's lecturing to the innkeeper's back as Claus heads back toward the kitchen, his only indication he took in any of the criticisms leveled at human culture being his reply, ""You needn't worry on that here. Any shite you take in my inn goes straight to the sewers first before it hits the river. Very clean. Very sanitary.""

Tucking his head back down the elf looked again at the floor. Rushes. He mused.

He moved some with the toe of his boot. Seasonal, with a new growth next year. Good thinking for a human.

Slowly he took a heavy wood bound book from his bag, and began flicking through the pages.

[[My presumption is that Magnus is staying at the dormitory at the local temple.  Fünf is presumably staying in the Ghetto—I'll let him decide if he's met up with Magnus by now.  Will Anders and Magnus have met and discussed matters yet, or will this be their first meeting?]]

The door opens, and a figure clad in the robes of the holy priesthood of Sigmar steps into the doorway where it remains bathed in light.  Pausing there for a moment, the young, immaculate Sigmarite takes in the room and its inhabitants, making a note of the Elf and Witch Hunter, as well as the two others.  Stepping in less than a pace, a slight frown upon his face, he remains where he can remain wreathed in light, and calls out, ""Sigmar's morning upon you, Anders.  Are you enjoying your leisurely breakfast?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The door opens, and a figure clad in the robes of the holy priesthood of Sigmar steps into the doorway where it remains bathed in light.  Pausing there for a moment, the young, immaculate Sigmarite takes in the room and its inhabitants, making a note of the Elf and Witch Hunter, as well as the two others.  Stepping in less than a pace, a slight frown upon his face, he remains where he can remain wreathed in light, and calls out, ""Sigmar's morning upon you, Anders.  Are you enjoying your leisurely breakfast?""</p>

Anders stands and bows slightly to the priest, ignoring the elf. ""Good morn to you, Magnus."" Anders sits back down. ""I was enjoying my . . . simple breakfast before I heard tell of the grisly end of the Templar Warmund. I presume you've already heard of it?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Anders stands and bows slightly to the priest, ignoring the elf. ""Good morn to you, Magnus."" Anders sits back down. ""I was enjoying my . . . simple breakfast before I heard tell of the grisly end of the Templar Warmund. I presume you've already heard of it?"" </p>

""Indeed.  Man of Taal, they say.  Hits a little too close to home, I'm afraid.""

Magnus pauses for a moment, evidently lost in thought.

""Well, no matter.  The Temple wants me to investigate the matter and report back.  If you are interested, you would be welcome to accompany us.  I fear there is heresy and wickedness abounding in these woods, and goblins may only be the first taste of it.""

[[Taking a little license here.]]

Claus returns with a steaming cup that he sets in front of Coriael, the elf can smell the heavy mixture of barley and honey coming from it, ""There's more soup if you are..able to partake?"" The Reiklander stares at the fey for several seconds before turning toward Magnus and Anders.

""Ah, welcome Your Reverence. I'll get you a bowl immediately, and some ale for you both."" He shuffles off only to return moments later with another bowl and two steins clasped in his opposite hand both of which he sets across from Anders, where it seems he is assuming Magnus will sit, ""I'm told, by a physician no less, that the ale helps keep the palette cleared of the foul dust lingering in the air. Promotes good health.""

Promotes good health.""</p>

“Ah yes, soup will be...  fine also,” Coriael interjects, a little distracted by the other conversation. 

Leaning towards Magnus he takes a fierce tone,

“Listen, this is why I’ve come here. To this city. You people need to do something other than chop things down for money, or boats, or whatever...  the forest is life. It must be preserved, cleansed of foul creatures such as these goblins.

We cannot sit idly by. You will help?” Indeed it seems that the elf has gotten the wrong end of who is aiding who, but such is his intuitive claiming of the forest he can see it no other way.

The rising tone of voices rouses Durchwechsel from his resting place by the hearth.  He pushes his Tellerberret back from where it was covering his face, and swings his feet down off the bench onto the clay tiles. Looking rather disheveled, he rises to his feet and smacks his lips, grimacing in distaste. ""Gods, I need a drink."" After a cursory inspection of his belongings, to ensure he hasn't been robbed while he slept, he strides to the bar, one hand on the pommel of his rapier. ""Morgen, gentles. I'll have a pint of something dark, if I may.""

The innkeeper passes back over to the bar and grabs a stein, places it under the bronze tap of a barrel keg and fills it to the rim before setting the dark reddish liquid in front of Durchswechsel, ""There's a bit of soup left, perch and cabbage, though I also found some leftover smoked cheese if that's more to your taste."" He heads back to the kitchen to ladle out yet another bowl of soup which he delivers to Coriael, barely paying attention as he sets it down and rattles the crockery, causing thick droplets of soupy broth to spill out over the table.

Magnus strolls over to where Anders is seated, takes one look at the state of the seat before him, and decides to remain standing while he listens patiently to the Elf.  Once the Elf has finished, he, without responding, turns briefly to the fencer to look him over, before turning once again to Anders.

With a nod to the innkeeper, Durchwechsel replies ""Some soup wouldn't be amiss."" After taking a long draw on the pint of ale he reaches into his pouch and produces a comb, and begins tidying up his beard and mustache.

Claus repeats his journey too and from the kitchen and sets a bowl on the bar in front of the duelist, ""That's the last of it. The most flavorful part, too. You must have woken into Ranald's blessing today.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Claus repeats his journey too and from the kitchen and sets a bowl on the bar in front of the duelist, ""That's the last of it. The most flavorful part, too. You must have woken into Ranald's blessing today.""</p>

The sound of the bowl hitting the bar top seems to jar the mercenary from his stupor. He groans, tilts back his stein and then shoves it forward, ""Steche is right on the banks of the bloody Teufel. Those sharp-nosed pests will be at all our throats soon. Warmund was no slouch with a blade, that means either they came at him with numbers or..well."" He rubs his ginger beard and shakes his head, ""-it's an ill omen when Taal doesn't see fit to protect his own on his holy ground. Doesn't give me much hope that the gods will take mercy on our plight.""

Heavy footsteps going down the creaking stairs were heard, and the Dawi was announcing his approach without being seen, ofcourse. Soon enough a loud yawn was heard, and right after some of the caring patrons could spot a short, stocky and outrighteously gingerly dwarf. A well kept one, atleast his beard and hair was - the closer ones could smell some rooty ale stench coming from him, though. Deep, rough voice was heard right after ""Ah, good morning to you, manlings, Valaya's will granted ofcourse."" Dwarf continued to walk down to the nearest bar stool nearby - and while sitting down heavily and soon enough bar stool made some awful sounds against the checkered wood as the shortest of them all shifted up a little bit closer to the bar. ""Nothing better than a dark beer, eh?"" Taking out few pennies from the pouch he made them rang against the bar, and finally looked around his surroundings, his brows furrowing slightly as he saw the elf. ""Ah, grint. Good morning to you too, wutelgi.""

Claus visibly brightens at seeing the dwarf belly up to his bar, grasping hand moving out to snatch up the pennies before filling a stein and another besides and setting both before Snorri, ""Hail and welcome, Master Dwarf! I'll get a cheese board cut for you, and some cold pork as well."" The innkeeper flashes a big smile, revealing his missing tooth, and then rushes off back into the kitchen.

""This man seems to be.""  He motions towards Constantin.  ""Seems there's a general lack of faith here.""  The latter was spoken to no one in particular.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""This man seems to be.""  He motions towards Constantin.  ""Seems there's a general lack of faith here.""  The latter was spoken to no one in particular.</p>

He returns with a wooden board covered on one side with a wedge of dark orange cheese and on the other with an array of thin pork cutlets. Claus sets the board carefully before Snorri, but his eyes are set on Magnus and then switch to Hagen with arched brow, waiting a response.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>He returns with a wooden board covered on one side with a wedge of dark orange cheese and on the other with an array of thin pork cutlets. Claus sets the board carefully before Snorri, but his eyes are set on Magnus and then switch to Hagen with arched brow, waiting a response.</p>

Hagen scoffs at Magnus and climbs off his stool, ""You have me wrong, priest. I have an abundance of faith."" He reaches over to the end of the bar and pats the sheathed longsword propped up against it. ""I carry it with me as close as you carry your hammer and comet tokens. I consider myself blessed that Myrmidia is a practical diety in that respect."" He steps past the weapon and over to a pot in the corner, relieving himself into it. ""If you're travelling by foot, then you should leave soon if you plan to get back to Auerswald before nightfall. You could keep moving on to Steche, but it's not much of a sight to see. Another pimple of a village on the ass of the Reikland."" The mercenary chuckles at his own joke then walks back to the bar, strapping his sword across his waist and offering a bow to those in attendance, then starts for the door.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Hagen scoffs at Magnus and climbs off his stool, ""You have me wrong, priest. I have an abundance of faith."" He reaches over to the end of the bar and pats the sheathed longsword propped up against it. ""I carry it with me as close as you carry your hammer and comet tokens. I consider myself blessed that Myrmidia is a practical diety in that respect."" He steps past the weapon and over to a pot in the corner, relieving himself into it. ""If you're travelling by foot, then you should leave soon if you plan to get back to Auerswald before nightfall. You could keep moving on to Steche, but it's not much of a sight to see. Another pimple of a village on the ass of the Reikland."" The mercenary chuckles at his own joke then walks back to the bar, strapping his sword across his waist and offering a bow to those in attendance, then starts for the door.</p>

Turning to Anders, he says, ""Sigmar will know this land for his own again soon—and the people will be protected by their true Faith.  If you've finished eating, shall we see what has happened to the poor Templar?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Turning to Anders, he says, ""Sigmar will know this land for his own again soon—and the people will be protected by their true Faith.  If you've finished eating, shall we see what has happened to the poor Templar?""</p>

The elf sits quietly eating when the dwarf enters. He hurriedly closes the wood bound book and bags it. 

At Magnus’ call to arms he stands, and with a pronounced exhalation hisses,

“It pleases me to see some of your people have the vision to see to this as a priority to earning coin. Lead on to this village,”

Lead on to this village,”</p>
Anders delicately places the spoon in his bowl and wipes his mouth. ""I will happily accompany you, Templar."" Anders stands, adjusts the longsword on his hip, and beckons for Magnus to lead the way.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Anders delicately places the spoon in his bowl and wipes his mouth. ""I will happily accompany you, Templar."" Anders stands, adjusts the longsword on his hip, and beckons for Magnus to lead the way. </p>

The clatter of a closing door, as Constantin exits, is enough to finally rouse one of the men curled by the hearth. The haggard skeleton of a man, crumpled against the stone wall in a conspicuously uncomfortable position and buried in his charcoal beard and threadbare robes, shoots up from the floors like a child's spring-loaded toy, but with a string of lurid obscenities that shatter the comparison. 

With furious energy and volume, but still somewhat disoriented from the sudden consciousness, he begins to kick at the ribs of a handful of other patrons still slumbering near the hearth. ""Sun's up, skinbags! Day's movin' on without us, and Sigmar doesn't give a shite about your sleep."" His long beard and dangling nose-chain twist and bob as the zealot flails and bounds between the sleepers, shouting frantically as he kicks. ""Oh, not a fan of kickin', are ya? Better a broken rib from my wicker frame than the Boot of the Divine, eh? Get yer asses UP!""

It's a sudden and assaulting flurry, both verbal and physical, until he can rouse three or four of them to accompany him outside for morning prayers.

Should any refuse, or attempt to retaliate, he jumps back and slaps wildly at his bare arm where a crude shape resembling a twin-comet has been quite unprofessionally branded. With an unsettling grin amidst that ocean of black hair, he almost invites the challenge -- still slapping at the brand on his arm, again and again, until they settle down or take action. There's a clear social expectation that any Sigmar-fearing man should join a zealot when called to prayer, and to do otherwise holds far greater spiritual repercussions.

He doesn't appear to even register the presence of his ""traveling companions"" near the bar yet.

Dwarf grins widely as he sees the food set down right in front of him. Eating loudly, getting his beard a little bit dirty as he loudly enjoys the food, he nods to the words of the Sigmarite priest, speaking soon enough with a mouthful. ""Ofcoursh, I will join you ashwell."" Soon enough he washes the food down with the alcohol beverage, smiling as he cleans his mouth using his hand. ""Grobi must be confident if they killed him in the daylight. Or, he wandered off too far, it seems."" Dwarf right after that finishes off eating, eating the cold meat in a hurried, gluttonous ways. Wiping his hands clean against a handkerchief, soon he starts to check his bearings.

Finishing his soup and ale, Durchwechsel scatters his payment on the bar. ""I thought you said the road wardens found his body and said it was goblins? What's there to find out?"" He produces a pipe and bag of tobacco, loading it while speaking. ""Surely we're not intending to go running off into the Reikwald after them?"" Taking a thrush from the floor, he lights the pipe from the hearth.

Taking a thrush from the floor, he lights the pipe from the hearth. </p>

There is a rolling chorus of groans and coughs as the zealot's insistent prodding seems to hasten the mass of them to wake. The dogs run past Ziege and between his legs as they bound around the room in search of any lingering scraps nestled among the rushes. Some of the burlier types, a mixture of stevedores and hobblers, seem ready to accept his challenge on their own terms as daggers and ropemaker's clubs find their way into their eager hands. There's a tense standoff as the wiry fanatic slaps his arm in their direction, but before the angry group descends on him there's a call from back at the bar that draws their attention.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>There is a rolling chorus of groans and coughs as the zealot's insistent prodding seems to hasten the mass of them to wake. The dogs run past Ziege and between his legs as they bound around the room in search of any lingering scraps nestled among the rushes. Some of the burlier types, a mixture of stevedores and hobblers, seem ready to accept his challenge on their own terms as daggers and ropemaker's clubs find their way into their eager hands. There's a tense standoff as the wiry fanatic slaps his arm in their direction, but before the angry group descends on him there's a call from back at the bar that draws their attention.</p>

""None of that now!"" Claus reaches behind the bar and then places a pistol on the counter with a commanding thud before motioning to the workers with a thumb jerked toward the door, ""-off to work you drink-sodden malcontents! You've quite a tab to pay off and I've already checked all your pockets, let me say I wasn't impressed with their contents! I'll not have any of you die before I'm paid my due!""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""None of that now!"" Claus reaches behind the bar and then places a pistol on the counter with a commanding thud before motioning to the workers with a thumb jerked toward the door, ""-off to work you drink-sodden malcontents! You've quite a tab to pay off and I've already checked all your pockets, let me say I wasn't impressed with their contents! I'll not have any of you die before I'm paid my due!""</p>

The men stow their weapons with low grumbles and narrowed, malice-filled glances leveled at Ziege until they make their exit and start off toward the wharf. With them gone, the few more pious or simply compliant townsfolk among the rabble do make the sign of the comet over their hearts and join him in prayers.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The men stow their weapons with low grumbles and narrowed, malice-filled glances leveled at Ziege until they make their exit and start off toward the wharf. With them gone, the few more pious or simply compliant townsfolk among the rabble do make the sign of the comet over their hearts and join him in prayers.</p>

The dwarf didn't seem to acknowledge the mess at first it seems, since he looked around the place in confusion as the trouble ended before it really started. Quite a hasty lot has gathered here - he thought to himself, as he simply caressed his beard, waiting for anyone else to add some geld into that mess.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The dwarf didn't seem to acknowledge the mess at first it seems, since he looked around the place in confusion as the trouble ended before it really started. Quite a hasty lot has gathered here - he thought to himself, as he simply caressed his beard, waiting for anyone else to add some geld into that mess. </p>

Ziege is the last of the rabble to leave the tavern, muttering all manners of curses directed to those that chose not to join him -- in that manner one speaks when he wishes to sound like he's trying to keep it to himself, but most certainly wishes for others to hear.

His streaming monologue continues, mostly to himself, even as he exits. His own prayers are mingled throughout the tirade, performed as he walks laps around the open area (courtyard?) just outside the Troll's Tongue.

He's likely to finish in 10-15 minutes, considering morning prayers in the past, should the others deign to wait. Otherwise, he'll rush to follow Magnus as they leave (with more fuel to his tirade, of course).

column4: Earthdawn The Age of Legend 2nd group Campaign

Nehany evtizede hagytatok el a barlangjarataitokat ahol generaciokon keresztul a klanotok probalta atveszelni a Csapast. 

Miutan kimereszkedtek az elso felderitok, a Twilight hegyseg egeszen mas kepet mutatta, mint amit a mesekbol es legendakbol mar oly jol ismertetek.

Ahol korabban zoldello dombok, fuves fennsikok voltak, csak kopar sziklakat, halodo cserjeket talaltak. Keves volt az elelem, es a mindennapi eletben maradashoz elengedhetetlen nyersanyagok.

Megvaltoztak a klan szokasai a korabbi allattartas helyett mas megelhetesi forras kellett. 

Ti mar ebbe az ujabb vilagba szulettetek bele: hajoival jarja a klan a kornyezo telepuleseket es rajtautesek soran szerzi meg amire csak szuksegetek lehet, 

mikozben probalja megvedeni teruletet a tobbi troll klantol. 

Tobbnyire trollok elnek a falutokban de vannak szolgak is, akiket elfogtatok korabbi portyaitok soran.

Nehanyuk mar mar szinte egyenrangu lakoskent el veletek, mig masoknak sanyarubb a sorsa.

Epp egy ilyen portyarol tertek vissza hajotokkal, igen jol sikerult, olyan sok a zsakmanyotok, hogy a klan feje aki vezette a portyat mar utkozben csapra vert egy nagy hordo eros bort.

A hajo lassan megerkezik, majd kikot a falutok melletti reten ahol egy egyszerubb legvitorlas kikotot alakitottak ki oseitek.

A hajo mar erosen megkopott.

Nehany runa van a hajo faranal es orraban, ezek indulaskor kekes fenyben vilagitanak, bar az igazat megvallva sokat ezzel nem foglalkoztok.

Miutan eros kotelekkel kikotottetek a hajot es a hajohidat leengedtetek, nagy vidamsag kozepette mentek vissza a faluba, a klanotok vezetoje fut elol vidaman kialtva a felesege nevet:

""Charik, Charik merre vagy hadd lassalak!"" szinte morajlik a kornyek ahogy kialt. Nehanyan varnak  benneteket, bekapcsolodnak az unneplesbe.

Charik altalaban varni szokta a visszatero hajot egy egy portyarol de most nincs a tobbi falusi kozott.

A klán hangos kiáltásai között Mughrum az érkező csapat mögött marad pár lépés távolságra. Mély levegőt vesz. Markát óvatosan kinyitva széles tenyerében egy apró fa hajót tart, ami kiköpött mása saját bárkájuknak. Óvatosan arcához emeli a tükörsima faragványt. És kifúj. A hajó finom koppanással földet ér. Mughrum elgondolkodva lép át rajta: ""Hmm, fából van, mégsem repül. ""

Trawok nem sokkal kesobb kijon a hazukbol tobbedmagaval. Mogotte felesege, mellette pedig a kornyek 

samanjanak padawanja kovetoje aki fent lakik a kozeli hegyekben, neha le szokott jonni ha segitsegre 

szorultok, vagy ha szukseguk van valamire amit ok ott fent nem tudtak megtermelni , beszerezni.

Elegge aggodo arcot vagnak.

Trawok int nektek (a klan 3 adeptusanak): ""Kovessetek a tanacs hazaba, surgosen beszelnunk kell!"" teszi 

hozza, majd besietnek az egyetlen hosszuhazba amit a klan tanacskozasokkor hasznal.

Dorukaz, volt meg valami amit hozza tennel?"" nez Dorkra varakozoan.

En is...Jo kis harc volt.""</span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(89, 89, 89);"">Ahogy megmozdul, randul egyet az arca, es az oldalahoz kap, Charik a felesege segiteni akar de eltolja a </span></p><p>kezet, fejevel pedig int, hogy nem kell. Osszeszedi magat es folytatja:<span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);""></span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">""Dorkuraz es Orus kint voltak az erdoben, lattak egy leghajot lezuhanni, miutan harcba keveredett egy </span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">masikkal. Az egyik tulelo a falunk nevet emlegette tobbszor is, jo lenne tudni miert. ""</span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">Dorukaz, volt meg valami amit hozza tennel?""</span> nez Dorkra varakozoan.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(89, 89, 89);""> </span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(89, 89, 89);""><br></span></p>

Öööö, Igen. Két léghajó üldözte egymást...vagyis nem...az egyik üldözte a másikat, a másik nem üldözte az egyiket, mert akkor körbe körbe mentek volna. Értitek. A lényeg hogy harc volt, és az egyik hajó lezuhant, mi odasiettünk segiteni, van is egy túlélő, akit odahaza elláttam...mármint a sebeit, nem a baját. Ő most ott pihen. A kunyhómban. Van néhány cucc is, amit sietve összeszedtünk, azokat is leraktam a kunyhómban. De természetesen nem akarom elrejteni más elől, a közösség javára bocsátom, csak át kell nézni hogy mik azok.

Dawn breaks as our story continues, following our intrepid heroes, and Yorbi, towards the mythical Jhubu Tree... (seriously, they should get there in this chapter)

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-324112""><div class=""row"">

The sun was just cresting the horizon as Yorbi, Tharn, and Keeza made their way south, further into the yawning maw of the White Wastes, the bleached, blistering-hot desert that stretched out before them seemingly endlessly. It had been an hour since they'd broken camp, parting ways with Sarif and Girrant, who were headed back to Zeen where the traveling merchant could recover from his injuries. The dour dwarf had agreed to escort the man reluctantly, and had secretly loaded his friends' packs with various edibles before gruffly setting off with the turbaned human.

And so they walked, the goblin, the karhu and the human, walked across the cracked, sun-baked ground as they cast their comically disparate shadows upon the dramatic landscape. The bear, especially, was not built for this, and felt as though he was going to burst into flame as the hours passed and the sun climbed higher and higher into the sky. Yorbi had said that the journey into the desert would take a day and a half, but they'd discovered he meant a day and a half of trekking without stopping. By his estimation now, they were only about halfway there.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The sun was just cresting the horizon as Yorbi, Tharn, and Keeza made their way south, further into the yawning maw of the White Wastes, the bleached, blistering-hot desert that stretched out before them seemingly endlessly. It had been an hour since they'd broken camp, parting ways with Sarif and Girrant, who were headed back to Zeen where the traveling merchant could recover from his injuries. The dour dwarf had agreed to escort the man reluctantly, and had secretly loaded his friends' packs with various edibles before gruffly setting off with the turbaned human.</p><p>And so they walked, the goblin, the karhu and the human, walked across the cracked, sun-baked ground as they cast their comically disparate shadows upon the dramatic landscape. The bear, especially, was not built for this, and felt as though he was going to burst into flame as the hours passed and the sun climbed higher and higher into the sky. Yorbi had said that the journey into the desert would take a day and a half, but they'd discovered he meant a day and a half of trekking <em>without stopping</em>. By his estimation now, they were only about halfway there.</p>

“So this tree we’re looking for,” Keeza says, “it’s amazing, right?  I mean, like, gold-edged leaves and flowers like living jewels?  A honeyed fragrance that soaks into your clothes?  Maybe it sings in the wind?”  She takes a shallow sip of water from her waterskin and gives the others a smile that looks like a grimace.

“I mean, we’ve been walking for days, and I gotta figure a tree worth crawling up and down the dunes for is going to be the kind of thing we can tell great stories about the next time we’re in a tavern, right?  Does it grant wishes, this tree?”

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>“So this tree we’re looking for,” Keeza says, “it’s amazing, right?  I mean, like, gold-edged leaves and flowers like living jewels?  A honeyed fragrance that soaks into your clothes?  Maybe it sings in the wind?”  She takes a shallow sip of water from her waterskin and gives the others a smile that looks like a grimace.</p><p>“I mean, we’ve been walking for days, and I gotta figure a tree worth crawling up and down the dunes for is going to be the kind of thing we can tell great stories about the next time we’re in a tavern, right?  Does it grant wishes, this tree?”</p>

Yorbi only half heard the human child. He had been thinking about the fact that his stash of dried jhubu flower was running low, and that in turn had coaxed him into a fond reminiscence upon the way in which the jhubu smoke mediated the visions of Fate. Yes, sometimes those visions were lovely indeed...

But the girl child was still yammering on. What was she saying?  Some nonsense about singing trees. 

""The jhubu tree is sacred, human girl,"" Yorbi called behind him, in a tone that parents reserved for ignorant children to whom things must be explained slowly. ""The Winds of Fate blow through its branches. It grants us the jhubu flower, which as my master told me many years ago, is very fine. Only the jhubu bark will hold the power of the scrawls.""

 The little goblin sighed inwardly. When he saw Girrant again, he would have to tell the dwarf that he did not appreciate being left in the desert to look after two children, both human and bear. He was no nursemaid!
dice roll
