column1:
She rolled her eyes in frustration the leading question. Annoyance in his answer pecked at the beasts nape. 

“To Fight. But them, not each other” She said raising her left hand up in frustration, her right still firmly on her hip.

“You don't need to be nice Conner but showboating and making a scene when we should be working together. Doesn't help anyone take us seriously”

She sighed realizing her tone was getting angry and took a moment to breathe. 

The she-stag glanced at the other Redcap gang members in the bar. Making sure their conversation wasn't agitating them. Her weight shifted for a moment as she felt the anxiety inside of her swell up. 

Her doe eyes swiftly glanced around the bar. What looked like a nervous glance, in fact, was a calculated assessment. Where she could run, move to if this turned bad. Run, RUN RUN. Her mind screamed at her for a moment. She hated this, it happened all the time. She logically knew Conner wasn't going to punch her, he wouldn't dare..., right? He couldnt...right? Yet her mind doubted, her instincts feared. 

The laws of the woods weren't the laws here.

Annoyance in his answer pecked at the beasts nape. </p><p><span style=""color: rgb(118, 146, 60);"">“To Fight. But them, not each other”</span> She said raising her left hand up in frustration, her right still firmly on her hip.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(118, 146, 60);"">“You don't need to be nice Conner but showboating and making a scene when we should be working together. Doesn't help anyone take us seriously”</span></p><p>She sighed realizing her tone was getting angry and took a moment to breathe. </p><p>The she-stag glanced at the other Redcap gang members in the bar. Making sure their conversation wasn't agitating them. Her weight shifted for a moment as she felt the anxiety inside of her swell up. </p><p>Her doe eyes swiftly glanced around the bar. What looked like a nervous glance, in fact, was a calculated assessment. Where she could run, move to if this turned bad. <span style=""color: rgb(31, 73, 125);""><em>Run, RUN RUN.</em> </span>Her mind screamed at her for a moment. She hated this, it happened all the time. She logically knew Conner wasn't going to punch her, he wouldn't dare..., right? He couldnt...right? Yet her mind doubted, her instincts feared. </p><p>The laws of the woods weren't the laws here. </p>

column2: Conner's teeth flashed in a smile when Jamie got fed up and rolled her eyes at him. The question had been patronizing sure, but it had garnered a favorable reaction - her annoyance cut through her hesitation and some heat entered her voice, at long last.

""To fight,"" he repeated with a nod, ""for the Freehold."" He paused, noticing her attention slip and shift around the bar nervously. Damn, that was fast. Was she in the right court? He waited, but didn't otherwise react to her reconnaissance, letting the quiet bring her attention back to the conversation.

""So who's in your Freehold Jamie?"" He tilted his chin towards his gang at the bar, ""Them? Miranda? How about her little brother Charlie?"" He had stopped setting up the game to look intently at the Man-At-Arms.

""When do we start acting like Summer? Either we'll look out for you once you've been tortured, or we get up a little earlier and try to keep you from getting Lost in the first place."" His voice took on a hard edge, a hint of a snarl creeping up from his chest. ""This club shouldn't want members.""
He turned his attention back to the table, ""And it's not showboating to remind Winter that hiding under the bed is less important than finding lost kids.""

column1:
Jamie flinched a bit at the growl, the hairs on her arms and back of her neck rising rapidly at the threat of his voice.  She frowned, don't run, stands. Conner wasn't going to respect playing nice. As much as that was Jamies go-to strategy. She clenched her fist, before shooting back.

“We act when we are told too. That's our duty, there is a line of command, Conner. No matter how much you dislike it”

She waves her left hand to the side as if tossing the point away. “ You forced us to stand by you. You knew that. If we argue in front of the other courts… we will never get the respect we deserve. Reminding winter of themselves doesn't help those kids. “

She felt the hot heat of summer coming over her as she spoke. Her mantle seemed to sharpen with her words, the chorus of summer insects louder to those touched by the wyrd.  Her Digitigrade leg moved, scoffing at the floor of the sticky bar.

column2: With his attention back on the pool table, Conner moved the brightly colored spheres into the rack near the middle of the table. When Jamie spoke again, he shot a sideways look at her, taking in her agitated, determined stance. It was dizzying how quickly she shifted between fight or flight. Time to pick one.

""If you really believed in the chain of command, you wouldn't be here."" It wasn't as though he hadn't had this conversation with the Summer Queen. Great leaders earned respect, while command structures just demanded obedience. Jame was right about his choice though. He had forced the Crimson Court into his corner because it wouldn't have happened otherwise. Standing by while Autumn administered the bloody rites or Winter ruled that hiding your true identity from your family was more important than keeping them alive made you either a coward or a collaborator. If he hadn't stepped in at the Moot, Meredith would have made them both. Now she had to act.

""But I don't really care about that."" Conner dropped the eight-ball into the center of the triangle, his claws rasping on the dark resin. He stalked around the table, drawing closer to Jamie and into the heat of her buzzing mantle. As he stepped just a little too close for comfort, his own Wyrd aura brought a stifling quiet, like still air just before an ambush spotted too late. The Hunterheart narrowed his eyes and leaned down towards the Runnerswift.
""Did your nose turn brown in Faerie, or was that after you got back?""

With his attention back on the pool table, Conner moved the brightly colored spheres into the rack near the middle of the table. column1:
Maybe the Red Victor was right, or maybe she didn't respect his link in that chain, or maybe it was his disrespect towards Meredith that stirred her insubordination.  Her eyes traced Conner as he made his way around the table, placing the ball. It was like he wasn't even listening to her like he didn't care.

It was around that moment that Conner made his way closer towards Jamie, his mantle causing the hair and fur upon her to stand on end in anticipation. From this distance, she could just begin to make out the smell of the beer and the blood from the rare burger he had before her arrival.

“Look what ev-” Than he made the brown nose comment and it hit her like a sack of hammers across the head. The words in her mouth misting under a radiant heat. Her fist clenched and tightened, and her mind swirled like rapids down the mountain. The Stag instincts roared inside the head and the adrenaline shot into her veins.

Run…
          Fight…
                     RUN…

                               FIGHT!

With a low pitched grunt, she took a step sudden and swift step forward. Followed by a jerk of her head as she brought her forehead towards Conner...
dice roll

… and smashed into his face just to the side of his nose. Right before the blow landed there was a painful jerk that stole some of the impact from the strike as Conner brought his hands up and caught her antlers near the scalp.

column2: Fight then. She was quick too. He’d seen his words register on her face as the adrenaline dilated her eyes. Antlers always made things tricky, and he’d gotten hold of them before she could gouge out his eyes, but not well enough to block the hit. He tasted blood from the spiderweb of split skin on the inside of his upper lip, and the coppery flavor was intoxicating. The sudden flush of heat that raced through him was as much instinct as the ignition of the dueling Summer mantles.
With his grip on her antlers, Conner tilted Jamie’s head back and away from him so he could look down at the angry woman. He smirked, blood on his teeth, amusement in his voice, and growled.
“Come on Bambi, you can do better than that.”

column1:
“I’ll show you, Bambi!” She growled under her breath.  The smug wisecrack from Conner boiled her blood. The hunter hearts hands were gripped on her antlers, which she resisted with an agitated twist and jerk of her head. The thought pressed her anxiety straight to her brain, like a strong shot.


Eat shit

The beast weight lowered, her legs bending, tensions running through them like a spring. She didn't have time to think, her logical human thoughts, slipping away, Losing Control, all that was left was the Runnerswift., the stag. With a hollow grunt, Jamie slammed her hands on either side of Conner's shoulders and her legs sprang forward. Her momentum driving them back towards the pool table, her goal to pin the hunter down.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(118, 146, 60);"">“I’ll show you, Bambi!”</span> She growled under her breath.  The smug wisecrack from Conner boiled her blood. The hunter hearts hands were gripped on her antlers, which she resisted with an agitated twist and jerk of her head. The thought pressed her anxiety straight to her brain, like a strong shot.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);""><em><br></em></span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(79, 129, 189);""><em>Eat shit</em></span></p><p>The beast weight lowered, her legs bending, tensions running through them like a spring. She didn't have time to think, her logical human thoughts, slipping away, <strong>Losing Control,</strong> all that was left was the Runnerswift., the stag. With a hollow grunt, Jamie slammed her hands on either side of Conner's shoulders and her legs sprang forward. Her momentum driving them back towards the pool table, her goal to pin the hunter down.</p>

Come on then.

She tried to shake free, but he strengthened his grip and kept her points out of range. He’d paid for the grip and it held. She hunkered down, and he knew all too well what came next. Jamie struck slender hands against his shoulders, and he caught the glittering of her glass falling to the floor out of the corner of his eye. As it shattered like a starting gun Jamie lunged at him, the Beast Runnerswift’s coiled strength snapping out to drive them back. 

It was too much though, he’d gotten under her skin and she was Losing Control. Conner had done this before, and the Hunterheart knew how to counter a charge. Jamie pushed towards the pool table, and he redirected the force of her reckless leap. He released one of her antlers, snaking his hand out to snatch up her wrist, twisting and straightening the arm as he slipped to her side. 

They crashed into the pool table, but it was a heavy and unyielding piece of furniture. It shuddered with the impact, and the pool balls swayed but didn’t break. He leaned his weight against her, leaving her Pinned to the Table.
dice roll

Jamie struck slender hands against his shoulders, and he caught the glittering of her glass falling to the floor out of the corner of his eye. As it shattered like a starting gun Jamie lunged at him, the <strong>Beast Runnerswift</strong>’s coiled strength snapping out to drive them back. </p><p>It was too much though, he’d gotten under her skin and she was <strong>Losing Control</strong>. Conner had done this before, and the Hunterheart knew how to counter a charge. Jamie pushed towards the pool table, and he redirected the force of her reckless leap. He released one of her antlers, snaking his hand out to snatch up her wrist, twisting and straightening the arm as he slipped to her side. </p><p>They crashed into the pool table, but it was a heavy and unyielding piece of furniture. It shuddered with the impact, and the pool balls swayed but didn’t break. He leaned his weight against her, leaving her <strong>Pinned to the Table</strong>. </p>

column2: The instant they hit the gaming table, Conner sank into the move, keeping her off balance. He twisted Jamie’s arm deftly at the wrist, and jerked down with the hand still on one of her antlers, using their momentum to drive her head down into the felt covered slate.

Before Jamie hit the table, Conner angled her face away from the hard surface, protecting the more fragile bones of her nose and mouth. She smashed into the stone with a thud muted by green cloth and the pool balls jumped and rattled. She’d landed on the side of her head, crashing down on her cheekbone, eyebrow, and ear. He felt her go weak, dazed by the impact, and let go of her antler to slide his hand under and around her neck. He set his claws against her pulse, tight as jaws, and even stunned she froze. He leaned down so she could hear him.
“Not bad Jamie, we need more fighters like you,” he murmured.

He let go of her wrist and throat, and put his hands under her arms to haul her off the table. She wasn’t heavy, but she was staggered and he set her down on one of the stools the Redcaps had brought over earlier in the evening. He glanced up towards the bar. It had been quick. The whole fight start to finish had taken seconds, and Conner had been careful to control his movements and position his larger frame to cover their exchange where possible. If you’d looked up when the glass shattered, Jamie might have drunkenly shoved them both into a fall. Even now, patrons of the Elk Head were pointedly not looking at him. The Redcaps were rising, awaiting directions. Later.

“Chuck. A glass of water for the ranger.” He didn’t have to raise his voice, the pub gone quiet but for the occasional muttering. His cousin, Clarence, wore a frown and a furrowed brow, but he grabbed a fresh glass and a broom. Conner didn’t really care what the bystanders thought, but playing it off might make things easier on Jamie and him.

He ran his tongue over the blood on his teeth and glanced back at Jamie, sitting woozily on the barstool. She was naive and a little sycophantic, but she’d stood up to him. He didn’t think he’d gotten through to her about the Moot, and she’d probably be pissed when she came around. Still, an angry stag was better than a frightened fawn.

column1:
Jamie's head spun, the mixture of the blood pounding in her head and the adrenaline subsiding made her feel a bit nauseous. It had happened so fast she was left dazed by the sudden change of circumstance as she was flopped down in the stool. She leaned forward pressing her head into her hands, and that's when the pain of the strike finally emerged. Her nerve endings were on fire.

She let out a weaken groan as she traced her finger across the side of the face.  That's...going to be a bruise. She glanced up as the glass of water was presented to her taking it slowly she sipped it glancing towards Conner and the redcaps. She was pissed but she also was not of the mind to start another fight with Conner.  Her gaze wandered the bar to those shooting glances or pointedly looking away.

Oh...fuck.

It dawned on her what happened and what it looked like. This was not good, the news of the fight would spread like wildfire.  She downed her water as the realization sunk deep into her gut. Slowly the she-stag stood looking toward Conner.

“Good...hit.”She said in a half grunt. She placed the glass down on the pool table. Before moving for the door. Moving slowly and with intention, a feeble last attempt at saving face.
dice roll

Jared holds open the door, meaning to step through, and pausing for a moment as Jamie Horn, battered and bruised, walked with purpose out of the bar. He raises an eyebrow, but doesn't comment. Probably best not to push her at the moment. The Archivist came to the bar through a circuitous, crooked path, reveling in opportunity to feel alluring. 

The Black Goat is a lord of Spring, though sometimes he feels like he should have been in Autumn, an exemplar of the Unseeile philosophy, and dammit, he's going to act like it.

The Archivist raises a hand to the bartender and grins ""Evening Chuck, did you get that mead in? If so, I'll take a glass."" Then he takes the moment to read the room. Damn. Conner and the Redcaps; he's causing no end of problems lately, isn't he? ""Making good choices, I hope, Mr. Whelan?""

column2: Conner watched Jamie depart in silence. Word would get around, in both the town and the Freehold of Naukati. He took the broom from Chuck without a word. It was his mess, he’d clean it up. Chuck headed back to the bar and Conner started sweeping up the remains of Jamie’s shattered pint glass.

With his confrontation concluded, the Redcaps returned. Beneath the dusky skin tone of his mask, Emmet’s pale features were neutral as ever. Russel smiled bemusedly, and took a plate laden with burger and fries, his second of the night, over to one of the low tables near the edge of the room. Miranda wore a serious expression, anger and pain seething a little closer to the surface. One step forward, two steps back. Conner nodded to the pool table, where the game was still set up, if a little off kilter. 

He glanced at the doorway as Jamie drifted out and spotted the Archivist as he passed the Runnerswift on her way. Well now, that could be interesting. He knelt with the dustpan and gathered the shards before heading towards the bar. There was an echoing crack of the billiards breaking formation and scattering as behind him the Redcaps started up their game again.

Spring courtier addressed him as he approached, and he smiled with the corner of his mouth as he spoke. “When it counts.”

He walked behind the bar, stepping around Chuck, who was pouring out Jared’s drink, and tipped the pan into the trash. Conner had tended the bar at his cousin's place on occasion, and the old pub was familiar to him. He put away the broom, and sat against the counter at the back of the bar, facing the Ogre.
“What brings you out Mr. Anderson?”

Conner watched Jamie depart in silence. Word would get around, in both the town and the Freehold of Naukati. He took the broom from Chuck without a word. It was his mess, he’d clean it up. Chuck headed back to the bar and Conner started sweeping up the remains of Jamie’s shattered pint glass. </p><p>

Conner nodded to the pool table, where the game was still set up, if a little off kilter. </p><p>He glanced at the doorway as Jamie drifted out and spotted the Archivist as he passed the Runnerswift on her way. Well now, that could be interesting. He knelt with the dustpan and gathered the shards before heading towards the bar. There was an echoing crack of the billiards breaking formation and scattering as behind him the Redcaps started up their game again.</p><p>Spring courtier addressed him as he approached, and he smiled with the corner of his mouth as he spoke. <span style=""color: rgb(250, 50, 50);"">“When it counts.” </span></p><p>

He walked behind the bar, stepping around Chuck, who was pouring out Jared’s drink, and tipped the pan into the trash. Conner had tended the bar at his cousin's place on occasion, and the old pub was familiar to him. He put away the broom, and sat against the counter at the back of the bar, facing the Ogre. </p><p>
<span style=""color: rgb(250, 50, 50);"">“What brings you out Mr. Anderson?”</span></p>

column1:
The Archivist hooks the antler handle of his walking stick in the crook of his non-dominant arm and smiles warmly at Chuck, taking the glass with his left hand and taking a pull of the drink. Solid stuff. Who'd think that fermented honey, cranberries, and various autumn spices would be so delicious? Blessings upon whoever did. Jared shrugs casually, scanning the bar for a corner with some privacy before turning to address the Red Victor.

""Came in for a view of the river. Helps me think. You know, you never expect to have to say things to a fourteen-year-old like 'Please take the quarter out of your nose Kassius' but teaching is a marvellous adventure sometimes."" He shook his head ""He'll be one of mine next year.""

The Black Goat lowers his voice to a whisper and leans forwards ""Was it worth it? Beating Ms. Horne?""

Beating Ms. Horne</span>?""</p>

column2: The Black Goat wore a handsome mask. The somewhat aristocratic bearing the schoolteacher affected was a bit eccentric for rural Naukati, but the kids probably ate it up. Conner angled his head as Jared spoke, and looked past the other man’s smoke colored irises to the strange horizontal pupils of his mien.

With the altered perspective of the Lost, Conner could see the educator for what he truly was. The flickering flame above his head cast an eerie light over his curling horns, and over the words he spoke as well. The natures of the Lost were as twisted and varied as the Wyrd that shaped them, and the Ogre was as Unseelie as they came. Who knew what rites he ascribed to, as if the Pacts weren’t enough, and he worked with the youth of Naukati, three of whom were missing. The Archivist could just as easily be an accomplice, or a possible ally.
Conner smiled at the question and shrugged casually

Truth be told, Jamie had posed an interesting dilemma. But when you had one problem, you had a problem. When you had lots of problems, you might also have a solution. Time would tell which Jamie was. And which Jared was.
“So it’s teaching you need help thinking about?”

column1:
Jared snorts, and glances across the bar to an empty table by the river. He gestures off-handedly for the Red Victor to follow him and begins to walk his way to it ""Tangentially. Have you worked much with children, Conner? In loco parentis is something that educators take seriously, and I take it more seriously than most. That relationship doesn't end when the school bell rings, even though I have a few... notable differences between myself and the average student,"" he says, tapping at his brow where proud horns curl and witchfire hovers.

He takes a seat, virtually lounging on the chair, and takes a sip of the drink. ""Spring is coming, Conner, and with it the festivities of Spring Break.They say that at this time of year wishes come true. My wish is to find the children. What do you wish for?""

column2: Friday evening - a not great warehouse near the docks of Fawcett City

With Kendra watching Scream Queens with Tomoe and Sylvia out on a date with Alex, Brianna came over to hang out with you two while you worked on projects. Somehow Dot foisted beers on each of you and you find yourselves tipsy as she stands nearby smoking a cigarette listening in on you. Brianna is nearly overcome with giggles by this point, she assures you her super-fast metabolism will take care of any effects this alcohol will have on her sobriety, but right now, she's shirt-faced.
A few moments ago, Oliver started talking about his secret lair, the design of it, how beautiful and magical the place is. Kate, it almost sounds like... bragging?

column2: ""The Oaxacan mountains sound lovely, Oliver."" Dot says, her tone almost wistful. ""Kate, you should go, take some pictures for me. Maybe we can make one here?"" She takes another drag from her cigarette that never diminishes.

<strong>""The Oaxacan mountains sound lovely, Oliver."" Dot says, her tone almost wistful. <b>""Kate, you should go, take some pictures for me. Maybe we can make one here?""</b> She takes another drag from her cigarette that never diminishes.

""Fork yeah!"" Brianna says as she pumps a fist in the air. ""Take us, Ollie! Take us!"" She blinks, then looks over at you, Kate, asking, ""Wait, don't one of us need to be dead? To be psycho-pooped?""

<strong>""Fork yeah!""</strong> Brianna says as she pumps a fist in the air. <b>""Take us, Ollie! Take us!""</b> She blinks, then looks over at you, Kate, asking, <b>""Wait, don't one of us need to be dead? To be psycho-pooped?""</b>

column1:
I'm grinning from ear to ear. ""No, no, you don't HAVE to be dead, luckily. Just willing to hold close to me,"" I say with a little slur in my voice.

""But we can't go. I promised myself 'important teleportation only'. You see, my roommate saw things, and ..."" I drift off, forgetting my point.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I'm grinning from ear to ear. <strong>""No, no, you don't HAVE to be dead, luckily. Just willing to hold close to me,""</strong> I say with a little slur in my voice.</p><p><strong>""But we can't go. I promised myself 'important teleportation only'. You see, my roommate saw things, and ...""</strong> I drift off, forgetting my point.</p>

I shrug it off. ""Yeah... it would be cool to go, but the trip gets a little weird."" I shudder, remembering some of the things I've seen. ""What's your favorite thing, though, Oliver? About your HQ or Oaxaca... home... either one.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I shrug it off. <strong>""Yeah... it would be cool to go, but the trip gets a little <em>weird</em>."" </strong>I shudder, remembering some of the things I've seen. <strong>""What's your favorite thing, though, Oliver? About your HQ or Oaxaca... home... either one.""</strong></p>

""I will totally close my eyes, Ollie!"" Brianna assures you. ""I wanna check out the mountain fortress and see all the dead trinkets you keep. Like, have you seen all the cool shirt at the Hall of Justice? So many cool artifacts and doodads and stuff. I want a Mother Box sooo bad, like really bad. I saw pictures of the Forever People, aren't they awesome? I wrote some fanfic about Dreamer, she's so amazing.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""I will totally close my eyes, Ollie!"" </strong>Brianna assures you. <strong>""I wanna check out the mountain fortress and see all the dead trinkets you keep. Like, have you seen all the cool shirt at the Hall of Justice? So many cool artifacts and doodads and stuff. I want a Mother Box sooo bad, like really bad. I saw pictures of the Forever People, aren't they awesome? I wrote some fanfic about Dreamer, she's so amazing.""</strong></p>

Dreamer fanfic? For some reason that really cracks me up. Fanfic about real people? Or gods or whatever... I snort. I don't usually let myself get quite so tipsy when I'm with others... I'm more a broody drunk, usually.

""Ollie, now I think about it, it's only fair, right?"" I blink a few times. ""I've shown you mine, y-you should show me yours."" Scrunching up my eyebrows, I think about that sentence. ""That may not have come out right, but you get the point. Plus, Dot never gets to travel. She has to live viciou... vicarl... vicariously through my many exploits.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Dreamer fanfic? For some reason that really cracks me up. Fanfic about real people? Or gods or whatever... I snort. I don't usually let myself get quite so tipsy when I'm with others... I'm more a broody drunk, usually.</p><p><strong>""Ollie, now I think about it, it's only fair, right?"" </strong>I blink a few times. <strong>""I've shown you mine, y-you should show me yours."" </strong>Scrunching up my eyebrows, I think about that sentence. <strong>""That <em>may</em> not have come out right, but you get the point. Plus, Dot <em>never</em> gets to travel. She has to live viciou... vicarl... vicariously through my many exploits.""<br></strong></p><p><strong></strong></p>

""The problem with this exploit,"" Dot observes wryly, ""Is the likelihood of perfect recollection is practically nill. Congratulations, Oliver and Brianna. You've actually gotten Kate drunk. This is quite an accomplishment. I'm not saying she's a lush, but you should check the sides of her neck for gills.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""The problem with this exploit,""</strong> Dot observes wryly, <strong>""Is the likelihood of perfect recollection is practically nill. Congratulations, Oliver and Brianna. You've actually gotten Kate drunk. This is quite an accomplishment. I'm not saying she's a lush, but you should check the sides of her neck for gills.""</strong></p>
""This is awesome! We're going to the mountains!"" Brianna cheers.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""This is awesome! We're going to the mountains!""</strong> Brianna cheers.</p>

""Wait, wait, we're not going anywhere, okay? I'm ... I'm too drunk to drive,"" I respond. This is getting out of hand. I can't take people with me anymore. Also, how am I supposed to teleport a hologram? How does that even work?

""I'll tell you every detail and answer all of your questions. Uhm, what were your questions again?""

I know I don't fight peer pressure well. I'm already at my breaking point, and they've barely pushed against me. I want them to be my friends, but I don't want to hurt them like I hurt Virgil. Maybe they'll back down now that I'm answering questions.

I quickly put down my beer bottle and try to scramble away, but find myself tripped back down onto the couch, surrounded by three women who all seem suspect now.

I stand up and straighten my clothes. I put out my hands and grasp Kate and Brianna's hands. I've tried to sober up, but I still feel a little tipsy. This is such a bad idea. I go full skull and say, ""Prepare yourselves.""

The halo rises up from the ground and slowly swallows us. For a moment, the world goes dark for all of us.

Somehow, we arrive unharmed. We're inside a verdant cave in the Oaxacan mountains.

""Look around all you'd like. Don't jump into the pool of water, though, unless you want to travel to the land of the dead.""

""Welcome to the End.""

I'm nervous ... I feel like anything they have to say about this place is a reflection of me. I hope they judge me well.

""It must be a comfort for your... clients? to pause here on their way to rest of their afterlives. I know we made a joke of it, but thank you so much for bringing us to your special place.""

I look around, taking things in for the first time again with the power of Bri and Kate's awe.

""Kendra and I tried to organize the books I have, and we got pretty far, but there's so many, and often in languages I can't read. There are pieces of armor, weapons, and other items that I haven't even begun to sort through. I don't know if my predecessors were keeping them locked away or if they were using them, or both.""

""Basically, haha, I need to spring clean this place!""

""If you ev... ever need help, Ollie, you know I'll do it. Think we should call in an expert?""

""I'm afraid that the more people I bring in, the more likely it is that this place becomes a museum or gets robbed, or both. I'm risking a lot by showing it to you.""

I turn to Bri and to Kate. ""I'm sorry, Bri and Kate, I'm not trying to say I don't trust you. I just don't know who to talk to about these things. I have the burden of an entire generation's journey to the afterlife to worry about.""

""What I'd like you two to do is to help me get some images made so that I can study things and talk to others about things without having to bring people here. We can take some pictures, catalog some things, organize it some. In the end, I do want to know what I have access to and how to put it to use, you know?""

""Can you help me with that?""

I walk over to an ancient table made from some preserved wood that has probably been here for centuries and I pick up a simple wooden cup. I then walk over to a pool of water (not THAT pool) and scoop up some water. I drink it down and then scoop up some more and walk over to Kate, where she's found a place to sit.

""Here, drink this, you'll feel better,"" I say, and sit down beside her. ""I'm sorry I said that my place is better than yours, Kate. Comparisons like that don't make any sense. I was just being a braggart.""

I break out into a laugh. ""Oliver! My place is a not-great warehouse in Fawcett City... yours is a mysterious cave system with a view. In Oaxaca, which has all the wonderful food! With mysterious artifacts and cool books."" I take the water and drink it down. Mountain spring water, slightly mineral taste from the source, but delicious. ""And the water beats Fawcett City tap, hands-down.""

""But... but... but... the psycho... it's not poop... psychopomp thing? You're so close to something that the rest of us will do anything not to think about. Death."" I say that dramatically, like, deaaaath. ""What... how are you so forking cheerful most of the time?""

I blow air out of my mouth in a long exhalation while I lean back against the stone wall of the cavern. Natural light floats down on the backs of dust mote fairies and settles on my stomach and warms me up some.

""I haven't always been who you see, and, to be honest, I'm not always who I seem to be. After my first few missions, I cried so much. It never gets to be less heart-breaking, Kate. Every one of those beautiful souls had a life to look up to and loved ones that grieved.""

""One time, though, this one soul was so generous. This teenage girl, Guinevere Alvarez, after we snuck our way through the jungle of the afterlife and arrived at the doors of her reward, she tried to give it to me. She said, 'You look so depressed. Please, come with me, and we can both be happy.'""

I pause for a long while. It hurts to tell this story.

""I felt the power of the place we were standing before. And I knew, Kate, that I could've stepped in with her. Can you believe that? I have the choice when I die! I can spend eternity in reward!"" I stare at Kate with these unbelieving eyes for a moment.

""If, that is, if Ra's al Ghul doesn't kill me first and put me in his pits,"" I add.

""But, if I do, then those souls who die in the future, they don't get a guide to the afterlife. They don't get to know how to avoid the creatures that prowl that jungle and arrive safely at the doors. I, I get to guide them to the happy reward that they deserve.""

""I get to be a force of good, and help make this cruel world worth it. That puts a smile on my face, Kate. Not always, but often. Sometimes, though, it's the Wellbutrin and therapy that get me through the day.""

""Well,"" Brianna begins, standing there like she's got too much energy to sit, ""There was this snow-globe thing, but it looked like people were moving inside? I didn't shake it, I promise! Is it bric-a-brac from the previous psychopoopers?""

Something about that box's description makes me think of something I heard once, but I can't quite place it.

""That's great, Brianna, thank you. I'm guessing that they're gifts or memento mori. It's like I'm all ready for a yard sale with the creepiest items in the world!""

I stand up, feeling rested and a little bit happier. ""Come with me, I want to show you something,"" I say to Kate and Brianna.

I walk us to an entrance to the cave and roll back a circular stone door and step out onto a ledge. When Kate and Brianna have joined me, I say, ""Look out and see, this is my homeland.""

After a long moment, I say in a soft voice, ""Lovely. It must be a comfort, having someplace like this.""

column4: The night at the hotel within the upper district in San Francisco was like a dream as you barely remember what had occurred there, but you know you are well rested,fed, and cleaned the other night as it was a pleasure being there. Knowing a day has passed and two more to come until the arrival of the Soldier to be here to answer some of your toughest questions. The sounds of the urban life of this bustling city is starting to become natural for you all to coop with. Though one lingering mind still plagues you, Shara, you know the little boy from the village up along one of the rivers awaits you from the outskirts of the city, hoping you will come with others to seek help for a matter much dire to him and his people.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-324826""><div class=""row"">

The morning for Kylena was spent sleeping most of the night, along with the meal located in the hotel's restaurant, all courtesy of Ms. Senal. Though not interacting with the others as they have been, the young dancer was up doing some small dancing movements but also reading the book she had found within the chest, giving her a chance to understand how gears worked and sprockets were used for. With this new knowledge, Kylena began looking at her own music box which was of course a Clockwork design. Carefully and gently, she opened the device and began tinkering with it, understanding how it works and how it was put together.

Aside from dancing, this was becoming an interesting hobby she was developing and learning all about the majestic world of machines as she put her knowledge from the book into some small form of practice.

""Amazing...upon winding up, it actually stores the kinetic energy from the force I place on it. When there is enough stored energy, it begins to play a set along the grooves of the cylinder. Wow, I'm very surprised that is how I can hear the tone. Maybe one day, I can make a better music box.""

Kylena said to herself aloud, as she hummed the tune in her head as she continued to tinker with the device on an even table in the hotel with her tool kit and learned from the designs of the intricate music box.

Rising before dawn, Shara greets the rising sun as had become her custom during her time among The People. Singing a jilting chant in a language she barely understands but knows is a prayer of some sort, she idly wishes that The Great Spirit continue to guide and protect her during her travels as she washes her face with water from the primitive sink. The water tastes metallic and dirty as she sips at it however, and as the city awakens she muses on the differences between the movement of the city and the silence of the wilderness. It's as if they are two completely different worlds, she muses as she stares out of the window. I wonder what the world I came from before the Charred Lands took my memory was like. Was it more like this city? The woods, forests and rivers where The People live? Somewhere in between? So many questions...

From her vantage point in the hotel, she found herself looking in the direction of the slums. Even now a foul odor poisoned the air from that direction, and the sounds from that corner of the city brought a shadow of sorrow across her face. Those poor people...I wish there was something I could do to help them...

Pulling out the small gold nugget that she had received barely a day before, her sadness hardened into a strong determination. Turning from the windowsill, she slipped on her new boots and grabbed her things. ""There is a people I can help though...""

Coming downstairs, she found that she was one of the first awake among her group. Only Kylena had beaten her to the lobby, settled onto a desk with a book open and fiddling with her music box. ""Good morning,"" Shara greeted as she sat down beside her. ""Sleep well?""

She turns to Shara as she smiles to her,

""Salam Shara, I am glad you are awake. I did sleep well. That is the first time I have had such comfort in a long time, I am just seeing how this music box work, believe me, it is very interesting. I'm not sure what we should do today, since I can do some dancing in the dance hall they have here.""

Kylena brimmed with excitement and joy as she put her music box away and closed it properly as she gave her full attention to Shara.

Hina made sure to get her enjoyment from the previous days meal before enjoying the comfort of the beds, even if they were a little small. Waking with the rise of the sun peaking just on the horizon she takes in the unfamiliar environment as their senses return to them. Nodding in greeting as she descends the stairs with a wave ""Hola Princess, Smokey"" going to take a seat with a heavy creek ""So the feathers in the beds definitely beats a hanging net for comfort...you guys have a good time too?""

Catria awakens and heads down to the stairs and sits down with the group

""Morning girls, at least we actually get beds to sleep in, but to be fair, its better that the sleeping in a cardboard box""

As the others begin to wake up, you all see a young boy outside the hotel, wandering around, though it appears as though a man who is of the law goes up to him and begins talking to him. The boy looks to be confused as the officer tries to tell him something but his actions look to be getting upset as officer continues to say something to him.

As Rosemary woke up, the white rabbit rubs her eyes and blinks up at hearing slight noises coming from outside. Jumping up on the window sill near Hina, Rosemary takes out her binoculars in order to have a closer look at the interactions between the two.
dice roll
Examining the scene with the lawman and young boy (Sensibility + Insight + Small Binoculars): 3D6+8+4+3

Hina leans just out the window from her chair to observe the scene, looking from the boy to the officer to try and get whats going on.

Nodding her head in greeting, Shara replies with a flat, ""Hina. Good morning. And to you too Catria. I've never slept on a feathered mattress. Or at least, I think I haven't. It was...comfortable,"" she finishes with a smile. Turning where she sat and looking at the rest of the group, she looks to Kylena. ""Well, I'm glad everyone is here. Wait, where's Tallan and the rest of his men?"" Looking around, Shara's mouth draws to one side in confusion. Probably still hung over from the firewater that he and his men drank into the small hours last night...

""No matter,"" she says with a shrug. ""I'll ask him when he shows up or leave a note or something. Anyway,"" she continues with a smile, picking up where she left off, ""I'm glad that you all are here. Catria, do you remember yesterday, the boy in the slums? I...hang on...""

Standing up and looking out the window, Shara blinks in concern as a commotion grows outside.

""Probably is, you know how men are. Always wanting to be silly when they have no care. Yes, if any we can leave him and his company a letter from the Hotel to give to him while we are out. Speaking of, what is happening outside exactly?""

Kylena places her tools and book back into her bag and looks on over to the group where they are looking outside with the young boy and his horse being talked to by one of the lawmen.

""I wonder what is going on out there?"" She questions out loudly to the others.

Speaking of, what is happening outside exactly?""</span></p><p>Kylena places her tools and book back into her bag and looks on over to the group where they are looking outside with the young boy and his horse being talked to by one of the lawmen.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(217, 150, 148);"">""I wonder what is going on out there?""</span> She questions out loudly to the others.</p>

The scene outside seems to be a bit of a commotion to those who are outside, the officer seems to be rather upset about something which involves the boy and his horse, though the boy seems to be trying to say something to him but the rest of the group is far away from hearing what this, even through a plane of glass.

Rosemary:

Everyone in the present group seems to be focused on the situation outside and sees what is going on, however, you being a rabbit with excellent hearing coupled with your new binoculars are able to witness this scene as if you were right there in front of them as you hear the exchange between the boy and the officer.

""You need to clean up the mess your horse is making on the streets, this is public ground, If you do not clean up after your animal, then I'm going to be filing a ticket son!"" Says the Angry officer

""I am sorry sir, but why is it only my horse you are looking at, others I have seen with horses come through here and their friends do the same, but you do not look their way."" Says the Boy with the horse

""I don't care, your horse seems to be eating something that is making a bigger mess and as the owner of your animal, you need to clean up after it!"" the officer says looking still angry

""With what Sir? I do not have anything to clean up with, if any, can you provide me with something to clean up after my friend?"" the Boy says in a calm manner

""Listen, Son. You pick up your horses' crap now, or I'm going to be booking you for Littering and Disobeying an Officer of the Law!!!""

She looks closer at the boy and remembers to where Catria and Shara first met

""Oh yes, I remember him, but why is he being talked down by an officer? Did he do something?""

She looks confused as to the situation is being displayed before the group

""Let's go find out,"" Shara replied, standing up from the table.

""Woah there, excuse me,"" Shara says, holding her hands up and standing at each of their shoulders, a nervous smile plastered on her face. ""I was just about to come looking for you."" Looking down at Alto, Shara felt the nagging worry that her failure to let the boy know to wait a day had caused this. 

Facing the officer, Shara puts on her sweetest smile possible. ""Sir, what seems to be the trouble?""

Looking between the officer and the kid trying to get a better handle on the state of things.

As you all approach the man with the Star patched to his chest with a club in hand stares as you approach and ask what is happening, the officer gruffly replies,

“This is none of your business, move along!”

He turns back to Alton,

“I’m giving you 10 seconds or its the slammer”

Shara:

When you approach the officer, all you can tell from his expression his trying to uphold the law as his job is meant to be, but you have no ideal what other reason why Alto of all people?

column2: Lagging behind her companions, Rosemary recalls the scene between the lawman and the young boy when she was looking through her little binoculars. Based on the conversation, it seems like a bit of prejudice could be going on here. Although, perhaps it is something else? Stretching out her legs, the white rabbit leaps onto Shara's shoulder's, hoping the firestarter doesn't become too startled by her sudden action.
column3: The woodlander begins speaking in a quiet voice, but it would still be enough for the group to hear if they're close enough, ""Ms. Shara, it appears this child will be charged for littering and disobedience of an officer if he does not obey his orders. I've heard,"" she points to her ears gesturing that they were sensitive enough to hear the conversation from afar at the hotel, "" the boy's horse has been making a mess in these streets. However, others have done the same and have not been bothered by this lawman either. How strange that this man feels the need to pester a child, of all things."" With that, Rosemary jumps down to the ground while she settles her gaze on the gruff officer, searching for any further clues on his face and body language.

column1:
The officer's brusque dismissal caused Shara to recoil, throwing her calm. At a loss for words, Shara is almost thankful for Rosemary's timely appearance. Blinking rapidly as she tries to digest the bunny's explanation, Shara takes a short breath to recompose herself. ""Thank you Rosemary, that helps a lot,"" she says as she now steps between the lawman and the Native boy.

""Sir, please, the boy is with me. Clearly there's a problem somewhere, how do we solve it?""

Clearly there's a problem somewhere, how do we solve it?""</span></strong></p>

The officer looks to you Shara as you speak,

“Does it look like your problem here? Cause if you want to take responsibility for this horse crap on the sidewalks here then I can book you too.”

The officer says with some metal cuffs showing at his side,

“It’s always you kind of people who bring in this kind of filth to our city, when your here, you follow our rules of society. So I’m going to ask you nicely little girl, either you and your women walk away from this or would like to spend a night in the jailhouse?”

Rosemary;

You listen to this and inspect this person in question. As you continue to look over him you see the silver badge is real, but upon closer inspection, this man does not seem to be a “true” man of the law, as to him being what is considered to be an appointed deputy by the Law Enforcement of the city whom you can tell is over extending his use of the law.

Kylena stands behind the others but looks to the man with the badge as she approaches,

""Please sir, do not get upset with him. He is just a boy, if anything we can help clean his horses mess, there is no reason to punish him for what we normally do as part of nature. Come on, please? Then we will be out of your way.""

Kylena hopes her words can have some form of meaning to convince him to lay off Catria and Shara's friend.

""I understand that your trying to do job, and I can respect that being a man of the law, but it doesn't seem right to pick on a child for litter and disobediance when they are trying to make a living, please, ease up on the poor boy""

She feels as if the young boy is being discriminated an wants the officer to calm down

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);"">""I understand that your trying to do job, and I can respect that being a man of the law, but it doesn't seem right to pick on a child for litter and disobediance when they are trying to make a living, please, ease up on the poor boy""</span></strong></p><p>She feels as if the young boy is being discriminated an wants the officer to calm down</p>

""My kind of people?"" Shara asks incredulously, her hackles clearly raised. ""What exactly do you mean, my kind of people?""

Count to three...one...two...

""You know what? Nevermind,"" she says, putting on a sickly sweet smile. ""I think I get the picture. So, all that has to be done is to clean up after his horse? Where's the pile that caused all this?"" she asks, looking around. Pointing to one nearby, she asks innocently, ""Is it that one? No? Silly me, thinking that it being the biggest one would be what caused all this,"" she says with a cheerful giggle.

""So which one is it? And all you want is for it to be removed?""

Nevermind,""</span></strong> she says, putting on a sickly sweet smile. <strong><span style=""color: rgb(227, 108, 9);"">""I think I get the picture. So, all that has to be done is to clean up after his horse? Where's the pile that caused all this?""</span></strong> she asks, looking around. Pointing to one nearby, she asks innocently, <strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""Is it that one? No? Silly me, thinking that it being the biggest one would be what caused all this,""</span></strong> she says with a cheerful giggle.</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""So which one is it? And all you want is for it to be removed?""</span></strong></p>

“If your insistent on cleaning up, then why not the whole block here, since it looks like pretty much the same from the ground.” The man with the badge says though his presistance seems to be a bit loosen when both girls speak to him about letting the boy off,

“If I did, then what point is there to any of people breaking any laws here than to a thief stealing from a shop-owner? I’m already being nice here so I’m going to-“

“Mr. Parker, what in blazes are ya doing?” A very heavy accented voice bellows out as man in blue uniform with pale skin matched with red curly hair looks down at the man with the badge.

“Oh Officer Mcdogal I thought you were sick today?”

The big Irishman laughs a bit but gives a stern look to Mr. Parker,

“I’ll be resting when I’m dead, what is this mess that is going on here?” Officer Mcdogal questions the man in the badge and the rest of the group.

“Well Officer McDogal, I caught this boy and his friend’s horse making a mess more than any other animal trailing through here and told him to clean up this mess but they don’t want to.”

I’m already being nice here so I’m going to-“</p><p>“Mr. Parker, what in blazes are ya doing?” A very heavy accented voice bellows out as man in blue uniform with pale skin matched with red curly hair looks down at the man with the badge.</p><p>“Oh Officer Mcdogal I thought you were sick today?”</p><p>The big Irishman laughs a bit but gives a stern look to Mr. Parker,</p><p>“I’ll be resting when I’m dead, what is this mess that is going on here?” Officer Mcdogal questions the man in the badge and the rest of the group.</p><p>“Well Officer McDogal, I caught this boy and his friend’s horse making a mess more than any other animal trailing through here and told him to clean up this mess but they don’t want to.”</p>

column2: Rosemary gazes up to see the new arrival of the pale-looking officer, speaking up a bit louder in order to gain his attention.
column3: ""There is a small misunderstanding here, Officer McDogal. When I was listening to the conversation, the boy didn't have much of a problem with cleaning up although he didn't have any supplies to help with the process."" Glancing at the gruff officer, she crosses her furry arms and looks back at the pale man, ""Instead of trying to help this child, Officer Parker told the boy, and I quote, ""To pick up the horses' crap now, or you'll be booked for littering and disobeying an officer of the law"". I almost thought that he wanted the boy to clean the excrement with his own bare hands, which is a disgusting way to deal with a situation."" Of course, the real reason isn't the cleanliness of the streets. Hasn't this officer smelt the unclean, smoke-filled air of this city before? She wishes the idea of prejudice is more of a ""weird humans being weird"" kind of thing, but animals have their fair share of this behavior as well.
column4: Letting out a sigh, Rosemary implores the officers, ""Now, me and my companions only wish to help this boy. And, there is no need for anyone to be jailed.""

column1:
""Aside from the fact that the largest piles on this street aren't from my friend's horse,"" Shara interjected. ""AND that I've offered twice now to help clean them up. But Officer Parker seems more interested in harassing us than working with us.""

Shooting Parker a smile with dancing eyes, she oh so sweetly adds, ""But it's my people who are the problem, since we don't follow the rules of...how did you put it sir? Your society?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""Aside from the fact that the largest piles on this street aren't from my friend's horse,""</span></strong> Shara interjected. <strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""AND that I've offered twice now to help clean them up. But Officer Parker seems more interested in harassing us than working with us.""</span></strong></p><p>Shooting Parker a smile with dancing eyes, she oh so sweetly adds, <strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""But it's <em>my people</em> who are the problem, since we don't follow the rules of...how did you put it sir? <em>Your</em> society?""</span></strong></p>

Officer McDogal stares down to Mr. Parker as Rosemary and Shara tells him what was going on,

“Mr. Parker, as much as I am a man who cares about hygiene and all, but forcing a boy to clean up is not his duty. The city’s street cleaners do that. You are simply deputized to uphold the law not using it for your own will. You go march on down to the station and turn in your badge Undeputized Mr. Parker, you disgrace that badge you wear.”

Officer McDogal demands pointing his baton in the direction of the Police Station, Mr. Parker begrudgingly nods as he says nothing but you can all tell he is fuming at this point as he stares down at you Rosemary.

“If I find you or any of your friends outside of this city, you better be hoping I don’ run into you. Not even your tall friend there.”

He sneers as he walks away to the Station.

Hina scoffs for a moment turning her head a little to Mcdogal ""There wouldnt be any laws towards threatening someone would there?....I mean i could take great offense at that mans comments towards our group""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Hina scoffs for a moment turning her head a little to Mcdogal ""There wouldnt be any laws towards threatening someone would there?....I mean i could take great offense at that mans comments towards our group""</p>

“That’s just Parker, he talks big but his harmless. Should have known he would be causing trouble. But I will make sure he is going down there to turn in his badge. Sorry fer the mix up. Have a good day lassies.”

Officer McDogal tips his hat off to you all as he twirls his baton in hand as he seems to be a bit better as the color in his skin returns to its normal hue.

But I will make sure he is going down there to turn in his badge. Sorry fer the mix up. Have a good day lassies.”</p><p>Officer McDogal tips his hat off to you all as he twirls his baton in hand as he seems to be a bit better as the color in his skin returns to its normal hue.</p>

""You'd better hope that too,"" Shara whispers back, matching the man's fuming with a glare.

""Well, that worked out well,"" Shara remarked as the two law officers -or rather, the one officer and the one non-officer- walked away. ""I was about to do something that might've been a bit drastic.""

Looking down at Alton, she smiles. ""Greetings again, Alton. I was just about to ask these people here if they would join me to come find you.""

I was just about to ask these people here if they would join me to come find you.""</span></strong></p>

“Once again thank you Shara, you have proven to be what has been prophezied to be.”

Alton smiles as he brushes his horse mane,

“If you have others to aid us, then please bring them with you for we will be more than happy to have more to help us. If you are ready to go, then we can be to my village in less than a day by horseback.”

If you are ready to go, then we can be to my village in less than a day by horseback.”</p>

column2: As the former officer seethes and stares down at the rabbit, Rosemary fixes a glare towards his direction. Although due to her small stature and harmless physical features, the hare’s expression probably didn’t look frightening or intimidating at all to the man. While Officer McDogal says his farewells, the woodlander tips off her top hat as well to gesture her goodbyes to the sickly policeman. Thankfully, his skin changes into a more normal healthy hue. A faint smile crosses Rosemary’s face.

“Well, at least not all authorities are megolanmanics in this world.” The rabbit comments as she readjusts her overcoat. Hearing the young boy’s name, Rosemary greets him and bows slightly. Looking in her small pouch, she considers for a few seconds then she looks back at Alton, “Actually, I need a bit more time for preparation. No matter how long or short your destination is, it is better to be well-prepared for anything on your travels.”

column1:
Alton turns to Rosemary as he smiles to her,

""It is a life our people live, people either fear us or they hate us. That is how most view us, but I do not let them get to me. Though I thank you all for accepting this task to help my people free the river from the grasp of this great evil.""

He bows and shakes each of your hands as his horse neighs an approval snort,

""By all means, please take the time you need to get prepared for the journey to my people's tribe is far along what was the banks North East of here, though I will follow you all until we are ready to depart.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><img src=""https://d2folr83karyot.cloudfront.net/image/20127.jpg"" style=""width: 390px;""></p><p>Alton turns to Rosemary as he smiles to her,</p><p>""It is a life our people live, people either fear us or they hate us. That is how most view us, but I do not let them get to me. Though I thank you all for accepting this task to help my people free the river from the grasp of this great evil.""</p><p>He bows and shakes each of your hands as his horse neighs an approval snort,</p><p>""By all means, please take the time you need to get prepared for the journey to my people's tribe is far along what was the banks North East of here, though I will follow you all until we are ready to depart.""</p>

""I am sorry to hear that Alton, my name is Kylena, it is a pleasure to meet you too. We are more than willing to help those in need. If anything I am ready to leave anytime everyone else is.""

Kylena says as she already has her pack already bagged and ready along with a new crossbow she had purchased the other day when they were heading on towards the hotel, it was simple at most along with a quiver of arrows at her side to be used. She smiled as she waited for the others response to helping Alton.

We are more than willing to help those in need. If anything I am ready to leave anytime everyone else is.""</span></p><p>Kylena says as she already has her pack already bagged and ready along with a new crossbow she had purchased the other day when they were heading on towards the hotel, it was simple at most along with a quiver of arrows at her side to be used. She smiled as she waited for the others response to helping Alton.</p>

""Hina, Nice to meet you both....and sure ive got everything i need with me"" shifting her usual sack that hangs from her shoulder ""Prefer to travel light either way, can pretty much gather whatever else needed along the way""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Hina, Nice to meet you both....and sure ive got everything i need with me"" shifting her usual sack that hangs from her shoulder ""Prefer to travel light either way, can pretty much gather whatever else needed along the way""</p>

""I am ready as-oh! One moment,"" Shara says as she runs back inside. Stepping up to the front desk, she leans against the bar as the concierge greets her. ""Excuse me, can you write a message to Mr. Tallan and the rest of his men from me? When they wake, that is.""

After telling him where they are headed and what to look for when they arrive, Shara steps back outside with her staff and satchel that she had left inside at the table. ""Now I'm ready,"" she says cheerfully.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""I am ready as-oh! One moment,""</span></strong> Shara says as she runs back inside. Stepping up to the front desk, she leans against the bar as the concierge greets her. <strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""Excuse me, can you write a message to Mr. Tallan and the rest of his men from me? When they wake, that is.""</span></strong></p><p>After telling him where they are headed and what to look for when they arrive, Shara steps back outside with her staff and satchel that she had left inside at the table. <strong><span style=""color: rgb(247, 150, 70);"">""<em>Now</em> I'm ready,""</span></strong> she says cheerfully.</p>

The concierge gives Shara a smile,

“Of course madam, I will inform them of your whereabouts once they wake up.”

Once more outside, Alton smiles as he welcomes you back.

“If this is all who is coming, I do have some other horses to help us travel back to my village.”

He whistles as a team of horses follows through as there is one for each of you (also having Rosemary ride upon the front of someone else).

“Before we leave, there is one other individual who answered my people’s plea. We just need to go and pick him up at the nearby Firewater tavern.”

Alton leads you to another tavern far from the Sickly Sweet from the harbor, as it leads onwards towards the outer rim of the city limits, this building is somewhat similar to the other establishment but is more rougher on the outside, jaunty piano music plays out loud as the sound of rabble-rousing, bottle breaking, and the heavy smell of tobacco fills the air. Alton walks on in as most of the patrons seem to be dressed in Western wear of the Wild West, with pistols at their waist and spurs upon their boots. The boy walks on through the watching crowd of drunkards and cowpokes.

Soon enough he walks on towards a far distant table to the back of the main hall, within a dark room as the sound of jaunty piano music closely dies down to a much more serious bend of music. The air in this part of the building is much more tolerable but still a bit hard to see, though Alton walks on through with you all in check, he stops as he goes to a table with a single light above a table of cards. A couple of shadowy figures seem to be playing a game of poker as they seem to be in silent stand off as each play their hands.

""Excuse me, I am looking for the one who has called me here, I am Alton, Son of Hathaul. I have found the ones who will help us. We are ready to leave now.""

We just need to go and pick him up at the nearby Firewater tavern.”</p><p>Alton leads you to another tavern far from the Sickly Sweet from the harbor, as it leads onwards towards the outer rim of the city limits, this building is somewhat similar to the other establishment but is more rougher on the outside, jaunty piano music plays out loud as the sound of rabble-rousing, bottle breaking, and the heavy smell of tobacco fills the air. Alton walks on in as most of the patrons seem to be dressed in Western wear of the Wild West, with pistols at their waist and spurs upon their boots. The boy walks on through the watching crowd of drunkards and cowpokes.</p><p>Soon enough he walks on towards a far distant table to the back of the main hall, within a dark room as the sound of jaunty piano music closely dies down to a much more serious bend of music. The air in this part of the building is much more tolerable but still a bit hard to see, though Alton walks on through with you all in check, he stops as he goes to a table with a single light above a table of cards. A couple of shadowy figures seem to be playing a game of poker as they seem to be in silent stand off as each play their hands.</p><p>""Excuse me, I am looking for the one who has called me here, I am Alton, Son of Hathaul. I have found the ones who will help us. We are ready to leave now.""</p>

The Poker Players simply do not react to Alton's plea, as a bright red light bellows from the shadows as if someone was taking in a smoke giving off a shallow view of its owner. A glow of a iron tipped pipe glows from the embers from its flame as the visage of a young man in his early 20's takes in the smoke, his jet black hair stands on end as it shows his tough exterior dressed in loose clothing as he inhales his pipe and lets out a bellow of black smoke into the air and onto the table of cards.

""Good, I am just about done here.""

He shows his hand of cards to the other Poker Players look in shock at his winning hand, the young man stands out of the dark booth and into the opening, standing at 5'9, this individual is indeed young for his age, but to his side holds a single weapon in hand as it lies within its sheath.

""Hey, I was about to win, you cheatin'!!!""

One of the men flashes out a metal weapon in hand as you all see this to be a gun the man is about to pull the trigger but the young man quickly pulls out his sword and cuts the barrel of the gun in half as the shocked man reels back from the quick draw.

""I do not cheat. I played my hand at the right time.""

He takes whatever amount of gold on the table and places it into his pocket and looks to the others.

""Forgive me for showing you that disgraceful display, Yosaku, is what people call me.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The Poker Players simply do not react to Alton's plea, as a bright red light bellows from the shadows as if someone was taking in a smoke giving off a shallow view of its owner. A glow of a iron tipped pipe glows from the embers from its flame as the visage of a young man in his early 20's takes in the smoke, his jet black hair stands on end as it shows his tough exterior dressed in loose clothing as he inhales his pipe and lets out a bellow of black smoke into the air and onto the table of cards.</p><p><img src=""https://d2folr83karyot.cloudfront.net/image/20140.jpg""></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><span style=""color: rgb(49, 133, 155);"">""Good, I am just about done here.""</span></span></p><p>He shows his hand of cards to the other Poker Players look in shock at his winning hand, the young man stands out of the dark booth and into the opening, standing at 5'9, this individual is indeed young for his age, but to his side holds a single weapon in hand as it lies within its sheath.</p><p><strong>""Hey, I was about to win, you cheatin'!!!""</strong></p><p>One of the men flashes out a metal weapon in hand as you all see this to be a gun the man is about to pull the trigger but the young man quickly pulls out his sword and cuts the barrel of the gun in half as the shocked man reels back from the quick draw.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><span style=""color: rgb(49, 133, 155);"">""I do not cheat. I played my hand at the right time.""</span></span></p><p>He takes whatever amount of gold on the table and places it into his pocket and looks to the others.</p><p><span style=""color: rgb(95, 73, 122);""><span style=""color: rgb(49, 133, 155);"">""Forgive me for showing you that disgraceful display, Yosaku, is what people call me.""</span></span></p>

After stocking her pouch with clean bandages from one of the local pharmacies, Rosemary walks behind Alton into the rowdy tavern. The strong odor of tobacco smoke elicits out a cough or two while her sensitive nose wrinkles in distaste. Avoiding pieces of broken glass and ashes scattered across the floor, the white rabbit hastens her step as she narrowly evades the bustling feet of the Firewater's patrons. Glancing at the customers' intoxicated expressions cautiously, she hopes there won't be bar fights happening anytime soon. The hectic disorder of the bar is already enough for her anyway.

As the group moves in a dark room, the rabbit exhales and breathes in the slightly clearer air although her sights are still obscured by the smoky atmosphere. Rosemary looks up to see the shady figures playing some kind of card game. She feels a sense of unease at the silence and the poker players' lack of responsiveness out until one of them stands up. 

A swordsman? I suppose we do need one. We are lacking one particular old man with a sword, the rabbit thinks back to Tallan missing among the team, And he looks quite young as well. Maybe around Shara or Catria's age. A shout and a flash of metal breaks her thoughts, bringing her eyes toward a drawn gun.

Rosemary nearly freezes at the pistol's gleam. It reminds her of the shine on a hunter's rifle. Despite her nervousness, she tries to grab for her small sling. Luckily, the mysterious young man slices its barrel in a fast motion. Seeing the barrel drop and roll around the ground, the white rabbit lets out a sigh and slows her breathing to relax her shaky nerves.

As the young man introduces himself, the hare tips her hat off and greets him, ""Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Yosaku. You may call me Rosemary.""

""I am Shara of the Two Rivers tribe. That was quite impressive...where did you learn such a skill?""

She makes a small bow

""Its a plesure to meet you""

Still, the hawk symbol printed on the bloodstained banner bore an uncanny resemblance to her own mysterious trinket, and her hand unconsciously drifted toward the leather thong around her neck. That hawk...could that have been the flag I belong to...?

Alton nods to you Shara acknowledging your woes,

""Our lands along the Hec'hal River was a life I have heard from my elders, a pristine valley filled with so much green that many would come to drink of our waters. Those were the days of old our elders would sing about, but now, a group of men have entered our lands, holding their iron hands around our river, forcing her to a choke hold, releasing little to no water for us. Forcing the land to die little by little. We have tried to fight these devils who encroach upon our lands, but they use mighty weapons against us, forcing us away from the river as they take more and more from us, taking more from Hec'hal herself.""

The boy speaks, as you all listen to his story along the journey up and down dusty and dirt filled plains, soon enough you see what appears to be a skinny snake like river slithering itself along a patch of green here and there but little to support yellowing plant life. Though as Alton continues his story, large black plumes of smoke rise above ahead as the sounds of screaming and explosions fill the air along with the smoke.

""Oh no, my people!!!!""

Alton nudges his steed forward as the horse neighs in response as they go in a full gallop towards the smokes and screaming.

Pain flashes up Shara's arm where she had landed first in a futile attempt to break her fall. Time seemed to slow to a crawl as she tried to at least sit up; the grunts howling their war cries, the roar of her flames momentarily free from her influence, the whinny of her horse as it panics and flees. Somewhere in the distance she can hear a voice echoing, calling out for the frightened beast, and after a moment's reflection Shara is shocked to find that it's her own. For perhaps the first time in her life, Shara realized just what exactly she had gotten herself into, and felt genuine fear. 

That fear flashes back to anger as time resumes the chaotic pace of battle, and somehow Shara found herself on her feet. More determined than ever, she slides her hand down her staff and grips it like she had seen Yosaku grip his sword, another spark forming at the end. And with a great swing she sends another fireball into the crowd of attacking soldiers.

Glancing over to the dancing flames separating the offending soldiers and the tribe's warriors, she directs the flames with her hands, and with a brisk motion directs the wall of fire to advance, pushing the enemy further from the villagers.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Pain flashes up Shara's arm where she had landed first in a futile attempt to break her fall. Somewhere in the distance she can hear a voice echoing, calling out for the frightened beast, and after a moment's reflection Shara is shocked to find that it's her own. Yosaku says as he pulls out his pipe and lights his instrument in a nearby fire as he takes a causal smoke break.

Still glowering at the backs of the fleeing enemy, Shara is only really pulled out of her fit of anger by the sounds of the villagers emerging. ""We are fine Shara, thank you. All of you for coming to our aid, my grandfather here Rolling Tobacco, came out here to see our saviors and of course you.""

Alto holds the hand of a very old individual, perhaps in his 70's, Rolling Tobacco stares into the faces of each of you, nodding his head as he finally comes to your face Shara as he speaks in a slow yet steadied voice of a language you all can understand.

""For many nights, we have been tormented by those demons who have taken the River from us. We had prayed to our ancestors to give us the strength to go on. As the waters began to hide under the banks, more and more of those creatures came to harass and kill my people. Though this was one of their biggest attacks on our village. I prayed to the Great Sun to send us their greatest warrior to save us. And now. You are here Child of Fire, you and your friends here have answered our prayers.""

Rolling Tobacco lowers his head to acknowledge Shara, as the other villagers do so in response to their Chieftain.

""You should come with us to my Grandfather's Lodge, he and other Elders will see about telling you what they know about what is happening here."" Alto says as he helps his grandfather up onto his feet.

""'Great warrior?' Doesn't really sound like me,"" Shara says. ""Warriors are supposed to be big and brave and help people. I just..."" she trails off as they pass the charred body of one of their attackers. ""All I seem to do is hurt people...""

""But you did"" Alto responds to Shara, ""You used your powers to save us and you showed those Gritz Goons a thing about not messing with Native Power."" 

He smiles to Shara as Rolling Tobacco mutters something, but all of you follow Alto and Rolling Tobacco to the slightly burned lodge as more elders sit around a small fire built inside filled with large clay pots along the walls. A younger man stands near the side of an empty wall as he is also one of the people here as he gives a bit of sneer to you all, but is quickly reformed his expression as Rolling Tobacco grunts at him. The Chieftain beckons you all to sit, he motions Hina to return to your normal self for this as well.

As you all sit down, Rolling Tobacco pulls out of his pouch some very fine grain as he sprinkles it into the fire, unleashing a plume of smoke into the air.

""Long ago, Our land was rich and beautiful, as Mother River had given us in the time of Plenty. Animals of various sizes came to drink of her banks to seek refuge from the harsh desert sands. For many Winter Moons, we were at peace with nature. Even her banks were blessed by her presence, as we were known to use these sacred waters to purify the strength of Obsidian as your people would have used. Though as time went on, Mother River began to show signs of weakness, as her form began to shrank in size, soon there were these ""men"" who came to us, telling us we would need to move to another place. Our people refused to let these demons tell us to do what they wanted, we could see in their eyes, they were filled with evil. Our people stayed, as they warned us this would not be the end. Again Mother River shrank to the size of a snake. We did what we could as we sent our greatest warriors to find the cause of this disaster. His name was Standing Rock, a big warrior who could swing his arm and break a tree trunk in one swoop. We sent him and other braves to go up the river and find the source. Many nights passed as no one returned. Only one day, a sole warrior came back blooded and near his end. He spoke his last words to us saying, they have Dammed Mother River as the Beavers would do, but built out of harden stone. So we had learned.""

Rolling Tobacco turns to you all once more with his story told,

""That's why you are all here, to Free the river from them. I think they called themselves Sekto Natural Springs Water Company. They are selling the blood of our mother for their own greed.""

Alto adds to his grandfather's story.

Hina slowly shifts back into her normal form cracking her neck as she rubs it with a large hand ""I think i can handle the barriers if you want, maybe a few flood defenses or traps as well since those other guys didnt seem the most aware, the odd pit trap too might even get those big metal carriages stuck on their way"" turning around to the others ""I mean if you got the wood spare, otherwise time to break in the tool before it starts to gather rust"" pulling a strange tool from her pack that looks like a cross between a shovel and a Axe as she flexes a arm ""If the others can keep up of course"" finishing with a low chuckle ""Oh right, and after all this, since you seem to be the wisest of the people here i was curious if you knew about a certain item, but immediate issues first i guess""
