Shara:

The people of the village seem to be doing their best with what they have now, though they seem to have enough for what is being required by the Elders to perform their Cleansing Ceremony for the fallen as they seem to be working on gathering food, preparing it, starting normal fires, and some who are slowly but respectfully moving the bodies towards an area with cloths over their faces as some are there also grieving for their lose. Though all seem to be very welcoming of your presence more or less. Those who have lost a loved one, seem to be carrying flowers to the departed, saying small prayers to their fallen as they seem to do their best to not break into tears as some have already.

Hina:

You see the younger people gathering what wood they can find, some from the banks, others from the nearby foliage available to them, though they manage to find enough wood to start building these wooden barriers for the upcoming battle to hold them in place. Alton seems to be carrying as much as he can hold towards the village, though Hornedtooth simply carries some small amounts of wood as he seems to be busy with something else on his mind as he also carries a spear with him. Though among them, you do see Yosaku is helping a little, tying some of the wood together and using the tools of the people to erect these barriers around the village. The work is slow but it is getting done.

Kylena:

As you take apart the ruined vehicle, you do spot the inner workings of the machine as they simply are large casings with many wires and gears all working together with a fuel source to power this thing to life. With your knowledge, these many machines make up a bigger one which leads to it to do one thing, to move on its own with a fuel source. With what you know, you can perhaps make something similar with this, perhaps make some device to move you around easier or perhaps making armor with some extra gadget to boot, though these thoughts run through your mind as you continue to work with this destroyed machine of what Hina had left.

The fire itself begins to turn into a sicknening green color as the center of the flames grow darker as a figure of sorts forms before you in the green flame. Two shapes of eyes stare back at you from the flames as the vines coil and grow over and around you. But once you blink, this horrific visage disappears as it quickly appeared, leaving you with the people in solid prayers in the moment you began to pray.</p>

Yosaku himself watches from a distance as well, seeing the people in a moment of bliss, as he simply sharpens his sword with a whetstone he carries in his pack, whistling a tune as he does so. Knowing what is to come the next day and so forth. Only taking sips of water and some food as a kind gesture from his clients, soon enough he sees the night brings most of the villagers to a slower pace as some begin to head towards their adobe homes.

Only taking sips of water and some food as a kind gesture from his clients, soon enough he sees the night brings most of the villagers to a slower pace as some begin to head towards their adobe homes. </p>

Shocked into silence by her sudden vision, despite the heat of the night and the fire a cold sweat broke out across her face. Glancing left and right as the rest of the tribe and seeing none of them give even the slightest hint that they had seen what she had seen, Shara politely but hurriedly excused herself and worked her way out of the crowd. Once free, her pace began to quicken until she was nearly at a run, looking back over her shoulder as if afraid that the shadows of the tribe would come chasing after her. 

She's nearly at the rivers trickling edge before she stops, her breath pounding from exertion and fear. This far from the center of the village, the light of the fire is a distant flicker, its normally comforting and embracing warmth poisoned by the green flames that she saw. The distance seemed to help, and the icy tendril of terror that had wrapped its way around her heart instead shifted to confusion, worry. Instinctively she turns to Minwaadizi, for guidance...but she isn't there. Of course she isn't there...

Groaning in frustration at her lack of understanding and her own fear, Shara paces restlessly as she tries  to wrestle with her own emotions, sparks flinging off of her fingertips as she flicked them, trying to dislodge the feeling of the thorns that still scratched at her arms. 

""Okay, okay,"" she said to herself as she ran her hands through her hair, ""calm down, deep breaths. Breathe. Just, breathe..."" And as if on cue her feet slowed and her eyes closed as she breathed in the warm night air. ""I can do this...""

column3: DDEX1-1 Defiance in Phlan; Mission 1: The Meeting at Deepnight

column4: Players

column1:
You were told that Madame Freona’s Tea Kettle was the place where adventurers could find work and avoid the hassle associated with other places in Phlan. So far, that has been true. Madame Freona, a stout and officious halfling who runs the establishment with her five daughters, has proven an excellent hostess.

Although you have had to share a common bunkroom with several other adventurers, the evening meal was excellent and the atmosphere pleasant. You are preparing to bunk down for the evening when one of Freona’s daughters peeks into the room. She calls a few of the adventurers, including you, into the hall.

“Pardon my interruption,” says the halfling girl named Reece, one of Freona’s five daughters, just shy of adulthood. “A chap just came into the common room downstairs and asked me to fetch you. Something about some coin needing to change hands for an easy job.” She plays with her red hair nervously.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-324638""><div class=""row"">

The lot of you, strangers but kindred in spirit, through fate, happen to be staying in the same barracks style bunk room.

You follow the young halfling girl down the stairs into the tearoom proper, where dockside merchants, scarred mercenaries, foppish dilettantes, and even a particularly erudite sounding bugbear rub elbows over steaming cups of Oolong tea and whisper business in hushed tones. 

A beautiful elven woman plucks a soft soothing melody from her lute, not quite loud enough to drown out the whispers at your own table. 

Reece leads you past the open seating of the center floor to one of the tearoom’s private booths where a few extra coins can buy you the privacy of a curtain.

Sitting in the booth, a mysterious hooded man leans over his cup of tea, wafting in the steamy aroma, and effectively hiding his face.

You pile into the booth and Reece closes the curtains, effectly closing you off from the rest of the room.

Well hello there chap, names Tamvarian, *holds out his small halfling arm out in greeting* who do I have the pleasure of meeting this fine night.? I hear talk of easy coin and greased palms...I think you were lead to the right man* he smiles a wide halfling smile*.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Well hello there chap, names Tamvarian, *holds out his small halfling arm out in greeting* who do I have the pleasure of meeting this fine night.? I hear talk of easy coin and greased palms...I think you were lead to the right man* he smiles a wide halfling smile*. </p>
Tatiana stays silent, waiting for the prospective employer to introduce himself first.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Tatiana stays silent, waiting for the prospective employer to introduce himself first. </p>

Relion glances at Tamvarion's palms briefly, then pipes in.  ""Relion Velar, arcanologist, apprentice, debonair extraordinaire.""  He fluffs the collar of his long brown coat, briefly exposing the hard boiled leather breastplate hidden beneath.  ""And what name follows you, stranger?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Relion glances at Tamvarion's palms briefly, then pipes in.  ""<strong>Relion Velar, arcanologist, apprentice, debonair extraordinaire.</strong>""  He fluffs the collar of his long brown coat, briefly exposing the hard boiled leather breastplate hidden beneath.  ""<strong>And what name follows you, stranger?</strong>""</p>
Calithia relaxes into the booth waiting for the details to come to light.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Calithia relaxes into the booth waiting for the details to come to light. </p>
Alton folded his arms and remained standing. He needed a job for more reasons than one, but something about this hooded man was giving him the creeps.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Alton folded his arms and remained standing. He needed a job for more reasons than one, but something about this hooded man was giving him the creeps. </p>

As you sit the man takes a long slurping sip of his aromatic tea.  

Once seated a slight smile crossing his face before he begins, “Indeed, I wish to hire you for a job. For the greater good of Faerun, I am trying to infiltrate a network of smugglers.” He takes another slow sniff of his tea. “I have acquired some information about the clandestine auction of a red dragon’s egg. This egg has already been purchased by a dwarven merchant who will be unavailable to make the designated exchange of payment.” He face still obscured by his hood seems to look to Kywin. “I would never be able to pass as the dwarf, but you could.” He pulls out a bag and set it on the table. “I want you to meet with these smugglers, make payment with this bag of fake diamonds, and then bring me the egg.” He then pulls out a small silver pin and sets it on the table. “This pin needs to go with the smugglers. This is of the utmost importance, with this pin I will be able to find these criminals wherever they may hide.” He pauses to make sure you understand the importance of the task at hand. “When you have bought the egg, and planted the pin, meet me in the stables around back. With the egg in hand I will pay you all a hefty sum of two hundred gold.” He waits to make sure all in attendance acquiesce to the task. Once confirmed he continues, “You will find the smugglers in a old abandoned barn at the norther edge of town. Under no circumstances should there be blood shed or the egg harmed. The point is to track them, so killing or capturing them is counterproductive.” He reaches for the hot tea pot at the center of the table and slow pours himself another cup. “Oh and the meeting is supposed to happen in a hour, so you should hurry.”

“No names. It is just the buyer and the seller. Fences, smuggler, and thieves like to keep things anonymous.”  

He takes another sip of tea and lets out a low sigh.

“Follow the Stojanow trail until you reach the Quivering forrest and then turn right into the wilderness. Follow the southern edge of the forrest until you hit upon the barn.” 

He waves his hand as a guesture towards the door. 

“Happy trading friends, the clock is ticking.”

You follow the directions as given and find yourself standing in an open field of three foot high grass, with a dark foreboding forest on your left, looking at a old ramshackle barn in the dead of night. 

The light of civilization only faintly illuminating the horizon to the south, indicating that no one who does not intend to be there would be casually passing by. 

Selune is full and shining as bright as she can muster, and “the sellers” must already be there because you can see lamplight emanating from the window and broken slats in the walls.

The forest and barn are quiet leaving only the sound of the cool breeze rustling the tall grass.

Thinking lightly cooled her nerves and kept her from moving too quickly than the rest of the party. </p>

Roy looks absent-mindedly at the other members of the group, and eventually pipes up, ""Using cheese wheel in a sentence is very easy, I would think. Although, if I can be brutally honest, I didn't like the look of the man who gave you, errr, the deal. Kind of dubious, you know?"".

He stares at the windows, with the light emanating from it seeming to be almost blue to him. Strange. He better get his eyes checked. ""So, I guess it's time?"", he says.

The barn itself is a simple, open structure, 30 feet wide and 80 feet long. A ladder at the end of the barn opposite the open doorway leads to a hay loft 10 feet above the barn floor. The loft is 40 feet long and the entire width of the barn, directly above the end of the barn opposite the door. Rusted farm implements lean against the barn walls.

A sinewy elf in gray clothes smiles at three humans behind her. “I told you they would come. A dragon egg is much too valuable to pass up.”

The elf turns back to you. “Now, let’s do this quickly. Here is what you asked for.” She holds a very large hide backpack toward you.

“You throw the payment over to me, and we will leave the egg here. We will exit the barn, and then you can leave after five minutes have passed. No fuss, no muss.”

His eyes shift back and forth between Tally and the elf woman. Alton plans to support the not-dwarf as needed, but he has no interest in jumping in and messing up whatever play Tally has planned. The deal seems exceedingly simple to Alton, but he knows from experience others often see the angles he does not, and acting rashly rarely paid off.

speaking.

Arms outstretched, Zeek would give a silent muffled yawn having been woken up by the sound of conversation behind the bail of straw just behind him. The night before was an interesting one, and had began to wonder if perhaps the farm owner had gotten him drunk to bribe him into appraising his property more than it was worth. Unsure of what exactly was going on, he would slowly inch himself to the edge of the bail of straw/hail and attempt to easedrop.

""Dragon Egg?"" Zeek would think to himself, ""Such a thing is rather precious and rare! This would most certainly be worth a listen...""

Zeek would make a more conscious effort remain hidden, hoping his small stature and natural stealthiness would grant him a safe vantage point.

Tamvarion seeing an opening bolts to the other back side of the barn and take a pot shot at the half orc as he runs. ""Come on team, operation over easy was a success. NOW!!!! Operation to go breakfast is a go"". He smiles and thinks...man I never thought I'd get to make these puns organically.
dice roll

Returning the laugh with a smirk, Zeek would make another attempt at his Shocking Grasp, if it connected he would retreat to provide support to those still in the barn, otherwise he'd arm himself with his dagger knowing his crossbow wouldn't do him much good in close hand to hand combat.

Despite the temporary victory over the thugs seeming leader, the flame is spreading and more bandits are closing in. Alton quickly decides that in this situation discretion would be the better part of valor. He sends a bolt of flame towards the first bandit off the ladder, then takes off after Tamv as fast as his short legs will carry him.

You let the other bandits fade away into the night, and make your way back to town. 

Only the four of you arrove back at the Inn the fate of your other companions unknown.

The mysterious man is waiting for you, as promised, in the stable behind Madame Freona’s Tea Kettle.

It’s only been two hours since you left the tea house. 

“So, it’s done?”

""Got it right here boss""  tally removing his disguise ""they attempted a double cross but we kept the mission intact, we have the egg and I personally placed the pin during the exchange."" Tally leans on the stall and looks over to his friends ""200 gold right, I believe that was the salary if I'm not mistaken"".

Occ: Tamvarion is looking over the guy before making the exchange to make sure hes not getting double crossed and when he gets the gold he wants to make sure it's real.
dice roll

Upon arriving with the rest of the crew, Zeek would take note of the mysterious benefactor who had matched the description of who he was to assist the day before.

""Greetings! Are you the one who had sent word for assistance with the trade off? If so I can personally attest that this lot did an amazing job! I personally saw the exchange, and the Dwarf did as he was asked!"" Zeek would explain admirably, not yet aware of Tamvarion's disguise. Then in a harsher tone, ""That isn't to say that it wasn't without its annoyances. Another band had attacked us all hoping to make an easy catch after the exchange. We had dispatched a good lot of them before returning here!""

((OOC: Using Diplomacy in the hopes of gaining favor with the dark stranger, possibly to make a more favorable presentation for the rest of the party who survived the encounter. Pre-rolled with Advantage if applicable.))

Alton nods and a rare, thin smile cracks his soot covered face. ""Pretty good performance all around I'd say, considering what we were faced with.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Alton nods and a rare, thin smile cracks his soot covered face. <strong>""Pretty good performance all around I'd say, considering what we were faced with.""</strong></p>

The man takes the pack from Tamvarion and removes the egg inspecting it closely before looking up at you all eyes narrowed, then with a heavy sigh, “The egg is fake.” He casually tosses it back to Tamvarion   

Returning his attention to the people in the room, he says, “I’m glade to hear it went well at least.”   

He produces a sack of gold coins, and tosses it to Zeek for safe keeping. “Here is your payment, and here is a little something extra.” He says as he tosses a blue vile to Calithia  The label on it reading potion of healing.  

“We have seen an increased interest in all things related to dragons. We have also heard of more dragon sightings in the Moonsea region—and elsewhere. Keep your eyes and ears open for further information on dragons. It might save your life.” Then he quitely exits the side door, out into the darkened streets of a sleeping Phlan.

Fin

column3: Chapter 3-3: Cave of a Hundred Corpses

column2: Cade Init: 1d20+3, Droo: 1d20+2, Gira Init: 1d20+2, Io Init: 1d20+1, Kal Init: 1d20+2, Max Init: 1d20+2, Ais Init: 1d20+4

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-324839""><div class=""row"">

After defeating the necromancer ambush, the party starts their trip toward the north, where Altier told them they could find the necromancer lair in a cave.

After resting, Gira scouts well ahead of the party out of contact while they all make their way north. (The guidance spell only helps for like less than a minute of stealth)

After about another hour, Gira is still ahead of the party. His spidey senses start to tingle, and he realizes there are few if any signs of animal life anymore. It is starting to get dark, but the spider form has darkvision so Gira can see fine.

More interestingly, in the darkness Gira can now spot what looks like the light of a torch in a rocky forested valley ahead. It's about a quarter mile away, but it seems to be meandering in this general direction as if on patrol.

Does Gira press on for more scouting, or return toward the party to tell them what he's found? He's still got another hour of spider form I think.

He's still got another hour of spider form I think.</p>
When the Giraspider vanishes creepily from sight all extra stealthily, Aisling shudders. ""Spiders are soooo creepy...""

Gira presses on, cautiously.  If he draws attention to himself he attempts to play it off as if he is a normal giant wolf spider and moves quickly in the opposite direction of the threat.  Here is a second stealth check if you want it.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Gira presses on, cautiously.  If he draws attention to himself he attempts to play it off as if he is a normal giant wolf spider and moves quickly in the opposite direction of the threat.  <span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">Here is a second stealth check if you want it.</span></p>

Also, Gira is paying attention to the time and will want to get out of sight/sense of the patrol while still in Spider form.  He is very conscious of not reverting to Elf form while in sight of any of the patrol.

So Gira is also conscious of not letting the group get into patrol range. Sorry, for some reason I read the first post as Gira being an hour ahead of the group, I am not sure how ahead he is.

Gira pushes on a little further. Now the trees just ahead of you are dead too. It's unnaturally dead, so it doesn't even give Gira any good decay vibes. You still can't make out any figures around the light, and its apparent behavior hasn't changed.

At this point you also are pretty sure that a ""normal giant wolf spider"" wouldn't be caught dead around here. Or maybe the problem is that he would.

Gira and the party don't have direct contact, but best guestimations are that the party is about 15 minutes behind Gira's current position.

I'm going to assume Io can at least see the person in front of her (unless there is magical darkness) to follow along but as she doesn't fear the dark, she isn't concerned with having a light on at the moment because cover of darkness is more important.

Pat let me know if you are waiting on another response from me or things are still playing out based on the last one.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><span style=""color: rgb(155, 187, 89);""><span style=""color: rgb(192, 80, 77);"">Pat let me know if you are waiting on another response from me or things are still playing out based on the last one</span></span>.</p>

Based on the time Gira thinks it best to double back and let the party know what he has seen. He specifically mentions the fact that basically anything alive is out of place here and the unnaturalness of the death as well as the suspected patrol.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Based on the time Gira thinks it best to double back and let the party know what he has seen. He specifically mentions the fact that basically anything alive is out of place here and the unnaturalness of the death as well as the suspected patrol.</p>

Gira's gotta find the party first. I'll start with 2 5-minute segments of Gira action as he heads back. You would expect to find the party during the second segment.

In each of the two, post rolls for the things you are doing, probably combinations of stealth, survival to track, or perception to look around. You can use the same skill for multiple rolls, you get 3 in each segment. And tell me when or if you are being a spider. Obviously where you are now stealth will keep you safe if there's anything bad around, but stealth later will make it hard for the party to spot you if you miss them.

The cave ahead of them appears to split to the north and south. The north split is the more alarming. A large chamber appears to be full of zombies. The zombies do not appear alert, and look comatose, even for zombies. They also are behind some thankfully sturdy-looking bars.

The southern split ends in a door. It appears light inside the room as you can see some light under the door.

The chamber you are in seems to also continue around to the south, possibly even just wrapping around a central ""column"". (to speed things along, one of you scopes it out and yes that's what it is)

You can approach the giant zombie cage, or go toward the door. Either way probably make a stealth at least.

""Yes the larger good is why I held my tounge earlier, that and I am not hurting as much as Cade and Io.""
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Yes the larger good is why I held my tounge earlier, that and I am not hurting as much as Cade and Io.""</strong></p>

Io had just been about to respond to Gira that we stay when Cade mentioned the Zombies.  ""Although my desire to end this here is strong, I regretfully must agree with Cade.  We need to return and report what we have seen.  With any luck, we will be the ones to return to end this nightmare in the cave.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Io had just been about to respond to Gira that we stay when Cade mentioned the Zombies.  <strong>""Although my desire to end this here is strong, I regretfully must agree with Cade.  We need to return and report what we have seen.  With any luck, we will be the ones to return to end this nightmare in the cave.""<br></strong></p>

At some point as they are leaving, ""Gira, you are not wrong.  I would like nothing more than to give them rest and end the necromancers foul play but having taken up a job with the riftwardens, I must also balance that duty.  Dying at the mouth of the cave will achieve nothing short of turning over what we have to those who have lost their ways.""

Max thinks the study of necromancy isn't dissimilar to his own arcane studies. But in his experience, it's a degenerate discipline undertaken exclusively by power-hungry lowlifes who were unable to succeed in a more advanced field of study. He doesn't feel obligated to end their existence.

He's also never encountered anything on the scale of what Cade is describing. The idea of a small army of undead is alarming, but easy to escape if need be. And with the ample warning that this party can provide, he feels even the meekest town defenses can stand up to a few shambling corpses.

Most importantly, perhaps, the idea of successfully completing a quest without a fight is very appealing to him.

""Kal, I respect your desire for a quick end to this den of necromancy, but I think the day is already won. I suggest we away, take whatever precautions we can to safeguard the book, and warn the nearest town about the growing threat here.""

Aisling nods when Cade asks about her assistance. ""Ah yes, while you were retrieving that book I prepared this for you."" She kneels in front of Cade to bring herself to halfling height, and pulls the charm that she showed Max earlier out of her bag, and moves to place it around Cade's neck.

""It is a periapt of health, a protective charm against normal disease. But with a blessing of Sune, it can do more for one like you, with the wasting. It is no cure, but it should stave off your... hunger... for a little while longer.""

Assuming no one objects, Max takes the book from Cade and spends 10 min casting ritualized Identify on it. He'll just peruse the book the rest of the time looking for anything unique magic that he hasn't been exposed to at Midland Lorekeep. He returns the book to Cade (or whoever else claims ownership) after the hour is up.

Max doesn't detect anything magic about the book, it's largely an ""academic"" work. It doesn't even have spells, and it's hard to decipher what is a madman's ramblings and what might be some shred of insight. The author had some crazy theories about everything from faster or easier paths to lichdom to how to contact his long dead mother to what kind of food he thinks his dead dog would eat if he could raise it as a zombie. It would take a lot of time and patience to find anything of value in the book.

column4:
Pasan unos dias desde la escena anterior, sin nada destacable, aunque si hubiese que mencionar algo, seria la ausencia de Silas. En el fondo, que uno de los chicos del pueblo salga a pescar, o a cazar, o simplemente a estar solo un par de dias no tiene nada de especial, pero al tercer dia de no saber nada de el, sus padres empiezan a inquietarse, y a preguntar a los chicos del pueblo si saben donde esta.

Los Oseznos miran al suelo, a las nubes, a un perro que pasa por el pueblo y dicen que no, que no saben nada. Y se rien muy bajito, rapidamente, nerviosos. Porque saben que la ultima vez que vieron a Silas se encaminaba hacia La Aguja, para entrar en las ruinas, algo que nadie ha intentado antes, o al menos que se sepa.

Alrededor del mediodia, Irene enciende el horno tras su cabaña, y se pone a trabajar en la cocina. El ruido, los olores de especias y los viajes entre la cocina y la despensa hacen que todo Luaru deje de pensar en Silas, y en cambio, piense en una sola cosa: Irene esta haciendo bizcochos. Los bizcochos de Irene son famosos, y envidiados, en todo el pueblo, y poco a poco, el olor que sale del horno conquista el aire. Mientras los bizcochos se hornean, Irene se acerca a vosotros y os avisa de que dentro de una hora estara lista para probar la primera hornada. 

Asi que, pasada la hora, os encontrais en el taller de Irene, con una taza de te y un plato de bizcochos aun calientes delante de vosotros, mientras Irene se pone a trabajar en su telar.

Supongo que os habeis dado cuenta de que los padres de Silas estan preocupados. Silas es un cabeza hueca, pero sus padres le quieren, y seria una pena que le pasase algo.

Me he fijado en que Per y sus amigotes saben algo, pero no lo quieren decir, asi que me imagino que se ha metido en un buen lio, y que sus ""amigos"" creen que callandose le estan ayudando. Yo no lo creo.

Aunque vosotros pasais bastante tiempo con la panda de cabestros esa, sois diferentes, asi que os voy a tratar como los adultos que casi sois, y os voy a hacer dos preguntas, sin mas rodeos.

Primero: ?Sabeis donde puede estar Silas?

Tranquila, Rianna, nadie te esta culpando de nada. El unico responsable es Silas. Si quiere ser un adulto, tiene que portarse como uno, y ser responsable de sus decisiones... no se trata de afeitarse esos cuatro pelillos que tiene a modo de bigotito, o de hablar de casarse. Eso son bobadas.

Nadie le dijo que no.... ?A que exactamente? ?Por que ibais a parecer unos cobardes?

Rianna, eres una mujer llena de recursos, mas de los que tu misma crees. Estoy preocupada por Silas, y por sus padres.

Por favor, si sabes donde ha ido, vete a buscarle y traele de vuelta. Me parece que le ha pasado algo y no es capaz de volver por su pie.

Y Rianna... hace años que no se han visto lobos cerca del pueblo, durante un invierno especialmente duro cuando tu no eras mas que un bebe. Y aunque algun lobo despistado se acerque por el pueblo, estara mas interesado en una oveja indefensa que en una joven capaz de darle un estacazo en el morro. 

Asi que no te preocupes por los lobos. Y los monstruos teluricos... bueno, de eso no se nada.

Rianna se movía con rapidez. Cruzó casi todo el pueblo hacia su casa. En su mente tenía un plan.

En los libros que había leído, sabía que para ir de aventuras había que hacerse aventurero. Había que rellenar una petición o licencia o ficha. Y luego escoger una profesión o algo. Ella escogería algo que tuviese que ver con libros o dibujar.

Necesitaba también comida. Como si se fuese a morir de hambre 3 veces. Y una cuerda, los aventureros siempre tenían una cuerda. Y un palo para caminar.

No podía coger comida de la casa de hielo. Eso necesitaba frío. Decidió coger una cuña de queso grande de la despensa. Y había leído, que para ir de excursión, lo mejor eran los frutos secos y gumibayas pasas.

Tenía que dejar una nota a sus padres.

Conteniendo la respiración, entró en su casa esperando que no estuvieran sus padres.

En resumen: Comida, cuerda, palo, supongo que tus cifras (quicir, objetos magicos). Puedes llevar un arma ligera (Daño 2, -1 a la dificultad del ataque), como un cuchillo o una daga, y algunas cosillas listadas en el libro basico, pero no vamos a complicarnos la vida

Vale, te preparas, consigues tu carné de aventurera, y te encaminas a....

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Lo de las gumibayas lo voy a usar, que lo sepas, que me ha llegao al alma...</p><p>Sobre el palo, tu mismo, pero avisado quedas tambien:</p><p><a href=""https://pluspora.com/posts/f5983c3006c80137b382005056264835"">https://pluspora.com/posts/f5983c3006c80137b382005...</a></p><p>En resumen: Comida, cuerda, palo, supongo que tus cifras (quicir, objetos magicos). Puedes llevar un arma ligera (Daño 2, -1 a la dificultad del ataque), como un cuchillo o una daga, y algunas cosillas listadas en el libro basico, pero no vamos a complicarnos la vida</p><p>Vale, te preparas, consigues tu carné de aventurera, y te encaminas a.... </p>

Entró a la casa. Los familiares olores de la casa la envolvieron.
Sus padres no estaban y se tenía que dar prisa.
Cogió una mochila de viaje de su padre del recibidor.
Subió a su cuarto y cogió sus pinturas, un poco de ropa y un abrigo. Casi sin darse cuenta cogió las pociones de la princesa.
Bajó a la despensa y cogió lo que había pensado antes. Además cogió un odre de agua.
Fue al despacho de su padre. Allí entre los papeles de viajes, había un mapa de la zona.
Se subió a una silla y buscó la caja encima de la estantería. Allí en una caja blanca, con un bastón rodeado por una serpiente, estaban las medicinas de la casa.
""Asclepio, Dios de la medicina, dame tu protección. Voy en busca de un joven perdido.""
Cumplida la ofrenda, abrió la caja y cogió unas cuantas cosas. Por si acaso Silas se hubiese echo daño.

Y con más miedo que nunca salió por la puerta.

(Y no, no se ha acordado de coger un cuchillo. Ya haré una escena comiéndose el queso con las uñas)

Casi sin darse cuenta cogió las pociones de la princesa. <br>Bajó a la despensa y cogió lo que había pensado antes. Además cogió un odre de agua.<br>Fue al despacho de su padre. Allí entre los papeles de viajes, había un mapa de la zona.<br>Se subió a una silla y buscó la caja encima de la estantería. Voy en busca de un joven perdido.""<br>Cumplida la ofrenda, abrió la caja y cogió unas cuantas cosas. Por si acaso Silas se hubiese echo daño.</p><p>Y con más miedo que nunca salió por la puerta.</p><p>(Y no, no se ha acordado de coger un cuchillo. Ya haré una escena comiéndose el queso con las uñas)</p>

column4:
With the senior Hunters missing, Bellatrix finds herself in charge of what's left of the Vampire Hunters. Unfortunately for her, things don't look good. She has the help of Delmas as well as her fellow Hunters Dirk, Moonlight, Reyna, and Marten, but there is much to be done for so few people.

It seems that only the senior Hunters have gone missing, so there are quite a few junior Hunters that could be organized to help in the fight. However, these Hunters are Scattered and Scared after their mentors went missing. They will not be easy to find, and they may not trust you initially.

You are also fairly certain that at least a few of the senior Hunters escaped capture. However, you're certain that these remaining Hunters are Being Watched. It won't be easy finding them.

Of course, there are the captured Hunters to rescue. From what Valence was able to tell you before you parted ways, these Hunters have been captured as part of a Nefarious Plan. They're not dead because the Vampire Lords still need them for something, but you don't know how long they have left. Fortunately, the Vampire Lords are Vying for Power, so they are delaying each other's plans.

You're pretty certain that you can get some information from the Vampire Prisoners that you have on hand. You're pretty sure they know something, but if they have valuable information, then that means that Something is Coming for them, and you risk being attacked by a larger force every moment that you stay here. You're pretty certain that this isn't a safe location.

GM: 1 FP

Bellatrix: 3 FP

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-325373""><div class=""row"">

""We'll need to find some extra help to figure all of this out. The apprentices that are left may be able to give us some insight into what happened to their masters, or at the very least they can give us some extra hands. We'll also need someone to interrogate these prisoners to find out what else they know. Finally, we'll need to check Isvelyn's house again for clues.""

Surveying each member of their party, she though of who would be best for each job. 

""Reyna and Moonlight, you two should do the interrogations. Don't do them here, though; I have a feeling we shouldn't stay here long. Do it at the warehouse just outside of town. Delmas and I will check Isvelyn's again then meet up with you once we're done.""

She wanted to make sure that Delmas stayed with her to prevent any issues with the hunters. She knew that Reyna and Moonlight would be intimidating enough for the interrogation, and Dirk would be good with trying to track down the others. Marten was a little trickier because she wasn't sure how his interrogating skills were, but she also wasn't sure how well he'd take to going to Isvelyn's place.

""Dirk and Marten, you two need to find the other hunters. Get them to meet us at the warehouse. Keep in contact, and we'll let you know if we need to set up another meeting place.""

She turned to Delmas. ""I guess we should get going. It's dark now, so most people will be asleep. I'm not sure if we should take your truck; it might bring too much attention.""

Bellatrix uses Shadow Cloak to conceal herself for the walk to Isvelyn's house.

I'm not sure if we should take your truck; it might bring too much attention.""</span></strong></span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(89, 89, 89);""><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);""><span style=""color: rgb(89, 89, 89);"">Bellatrix uses <em><strong><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">Shadow Cloak</span></strong></em> to conceal herself for the walk to Isvelyn's house.</span></span></span></p>
dice roll

You arrive without incedent at Isvelyn's house. When you open the door, a scene of carnage and chaos greets you. Charred bits of paper litter the floor, there are scratch marks along one of the walls, and dark drops of blood lie crusty and dry on what used to be a pristine living room carpet. You're certain that something horrible happened here, but in all the mess, it may be impossible to discern what happened.

Beyond the living room is a doorway into a disheveled kitchen. The rest of the house is dark, but a soft pulsating red-orange glow emanates from the room. You can't see what's emitting that glow.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You arrive without incedent at Isvelyn's house. When you open the door, a scene of carnage and chaos greets you. Charred bits of paper litter the floor, there are scratch marks along one of the walls, and dark drops of blood lie crusty and dry on what used to be a pristine living room carpet. You're certain that something horrible happened here, but in all the mess, it may be impossible to discern what happened.</p><p>Beyond the living room is a doorway into a disheveled kitchen. The rest of the house is dark, but a soft pulsating red-orange glow emanates from the room. You can't see what's emitting that glow.</p>

Bellatrix creeps closer to the glow, careful to avoid tripping on the mess in front of her. She peered through the doorway, squinting at the glowing object to catch what it was. She made sure Delmas was right behind her and ready in case of what they saw. 

As silently as her hoofs could be, she crept into the room.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Bellatrix creeps closer to the glow, careful to avoid tripping on the mess in front of her. She peered through the doorway, squinting at the glowing object to catch what it was. She made sure Delmas was right behind her and ready in case of what they saw. </p><p>As silently as her hoofs could be, she crept into the room. </p>

Ok, from the kitchen you can get a pretty good idea about the layout of the house. There's a dining room attached to the kitchen, and a study past the dining room. You saw a bedroom off of the living room, you suspect that it's Isvelyn's. If you were to go into the study, you would see a door leading to a bathroom. The bathroom is also connected to the bedroom, so that the house is shaped like a giant doughnut.

When you step into the kitchen, the mysterious glowing rock starts to hum and emanate a lot of heat. A Living Inferno bursts out of the oven and starts burning things in the kitchen! Someone must have planted it there to destroy the evidence!

Each room contains things that you might find useful. Some of it might help you find Isvelyn or the other hunters, some of it might tell you what happened here, and some of it might help you down the road. You won't have all the time in the world to search, however, because the Inferno will destroy some of the things you need. You can spend time fighting it or searching the house, but not both. Delmas can either fight the Inferno or search for clues and items as well. When items are found or destroyed, I will notate it on this grid. You can either roll Perception to find things, or you can choose to automatically find an item. When you do, you give up a time point, which the Inferno can use to complete its mission of burning up all the evidence. However, failure at the Perception roll means that it cost you something to search for the item: we will determine what that cost is when it happens.

Kitchen
2 Items, 0 Left

Dining Room
1 Item (+4)

Living Room
3 Items, 1 left (+4)

Bedroom
2 Items, 1 Left (+4)
  • Mysterious Planner

""PONY!!!""

The Living Inferno reaches out tendrils of flame to try to envelop you.

You nimbly step out of the way, but your skin feels a little toasty from the heat, and your mane is a little singed.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong><em><span style=""color: rgb(227, 108, 9);"">""PONY!!!""</span></em></strong></p><p>The Living Inferno reaches out tendrils of flame to try to envelop you.</p><p>You nimbly step out of the way, but your skin feels a little toasty from the heat, and your mane is a little singed. </p>

Bellatrix winces from the heat, then calls to Delmas.

""This thing's gonna burn down the house! Keep it back until I find some evidence!""

She rushed back into the living room while Delmas held back the Inferno. She quickly searched the area to try to find out what had happened.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Bellatrix winces from the heat, then calls to Delmas.</p><p><strong><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"">""This thing's gonna burn down the house! Keep it back until I find some evidence!""</span></strong></p><p>She rushed back into the living room while Delmas held back the Inferno. She quickly searched the area to try to find out what had happened.</p>

Delmas searches the kitchen for something to use against the Living Inferno.

He remembers that Isvelyn keeps a fire extinguisher under her sink. He lunges for the sink, but the Inferno blocks his way. When he opens the cabinet to pull out the fire extinguisher, the inferno blisters his arm and face.

The burn begins to heal almost immediately thanks to the vampiric curse coursing through his body, but now Delmas is drained of energy. He will begin to get uncontrollably hungry very soon.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Delmas searches the kitchen for something to use against the <strong><em><span style=""color: rgb(227, 108, 9);"">Living Inferno</span></em></strong>.</p><p>He remembers that Isvelyn keeps a fire extinguisher under her sink. He lunges for the sink, but the Inferno blocks his way. When he opens the cabinet to pull out the fire extinguisher, the inferno blisters his arm and face.</p><p>The burn begins to heal almost immediately thanks to the vampiric curse coursing through his body, but now Delmas is drained of energy. He will begin to get uncontrollably hungry very soon.</p>
Bellatrix stuffs the objects in her pocket and quickly searches for more evidence. She runs into the bedroom and looks around.
dice roll
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Bellatrix stuffs the objects in her pocket and quickly searches for more evidence. She runs into the bedroom and looks around.</p>

The Living Inferno takes another swipe at Delmas. Delmas ducks under the table and isn't harmed. Satisfied by his attempts to drive Delmas away, the Living Inferno moves into the dining room and begins looking for evidence to consume.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The <strong><em><span style=""color: rgb(227, 108, 9);"">Living Inferno</span></em></strong> takes another swipe at Delmas. Delmas ducks under the table and isn't harmed. Satisfied by his attempts to drive Delmas away, the <strong><em><span style=""color: rgb(227, 108, 9);"">Living Inferno</span></em></strong> moves into the dining room and begins looking for evidence to consume.</p>

You can have Delmas continue to harass the Inferno, but he will no longer search for items. He just happened to recall the fire extinguisher, so he grabbed it.

Whenever you fail a perception roll, you can either simply waste your turn, or you can have something bad happen as a cost to your success. Delmas would have needed a +4 to beat a +2, so he spent a +4 consequence as a cost to succeed.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>You can have Delmas continue to harass the Inferno, but he will no longer search for items. He just happened to recall the fire extinguisher, so he grabbed it.</p><p>Whenever you fail a perception roll, you can either simply waste your turn, or you can have something bad happen as a cost to your success. Delmas would have needed a +4 to beat a +2, so he spent a +4 consequence as a cost to succeed.</p>

Bellatrix dashes into the bedroom and looks around. Isvelyn's planner is lying on the bed, but it's hard to read. She seems to have notated events in a peculiar shorthand, probably designed to foil any attempts to glean information from it. Either Delmas or one of the other hunters might be able to glean some information about it, but it may take some careful studying.

For now, Bellatrix stashes the planner away for later study.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Bellatrix dashes into the bedroom and looks around. Isvelyn's planner is lying on the bed, but it's hard to read. She seems to have notated events in a peculiar shorthand, probably designed to foil any attempts to glean information from it. Either Delmas or one of the other hunters might be able to glean some information about it, but it may take some careful studying.</p><p>For now, Bellatrix stashes the planner away for later study.</p>

With the Living Inferno gone from the room, Delmas has time to search for items in the kitchen.

He thows open several cabinets, but then he finds what he was looking for: Isvelyn's pride and joy, the Vampire Hunter's Cookbook. It's a bit of an heirloom of the Owlscribes - it contains recipes for manufacturing a variety of weapons useful against vampires, most of which would seem innocuous to normal people (or even ignorant vampires). There's also a few recipes for weapons useful against normal people, but those wouldn't seem nearly so innocuous.
dice roll

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>With the Living Inferno gone from the room, Delmas has time to search for items in the kitchen.</p><p>He thows open several cabinets, but then he finds what he was looking for: Isvelyn's pride and joy, the Vampire Hunter's Cookbook. It's a bit of an heirloom of the Owlscribes - it contains recipes for manufacturing a variety of weapons useful against vampires, most of which would seem innocuous to normal people (or even ignorant vampires). There's also a few recipes for weapons useful against normal people, but those wouldn't seem nearly so innocuous.</p>

While Delmas is looking through the kitchen cabinets, the Living Inferno burns through the dining room. Isvelyn's nice tablecloth catches fire and is quickly reduced to ash.

Insensitive to the value of Isvelyn's fine china, the Inferno begins knocking over cabinets and violently emptying the contents of every drawer.

Satisfied that it has done a good job of making a mess, the Living Inferno moves on to the Study.
dice roll

Bellatrix runs to the Bathroom in search of more clues, desperate to get to as many rooms as she could before the Inferno could makes it's round.
dice roll

column5:
Kendra,

You show up promptly at eight with guac and chips at Tomoe's dorm room. The place looks cleaner than the last time you came over, smells faintly of Febreeze. Tomoe's wearing her hair in pigtails and she's put on a light touch of makeup, too. She's wearing a cute yellow plush-knit swing dress, no shoes. She welcomes you into her room, locks the door, and asks Alexa to play some music, some Japanese playlist name like Hatsune Miku. It's dancy and fun.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-324995""><div class=""row"">

""Thanks for the guac and chips, Kendra. You look great! Come have a seat on the couch here,"" Tomoe says as she gestures towards the couch by the window.

What do you do?

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Thanks for the guac and chips, Kendra. You look great! Come have a seat on the couch here,""</strong> Tomoe says as she gestures towards the couch by the window.</p><p>What do you do?</p>

""Oh, thanks, Tomoe. You do too. I don't think I've seen you wear a dress before."" I head over to the couch and sit down. ""If I would've known, I would've dressed up a little more."" I look down at my cuffed jeans and chunky sweater. I bend one leg under me getting comfy. ""The guac is my mom's recipe, and completely delicious. And the chips are organic.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Oh, thanks, Tomoe. You do too. I don't think I've seen you wear a dress before.""</strong>  I head over to the couch and sit down. <strong>""If I would've known, I would've dressed up a little more.""</strong> I look down at my cuffed jeans and chunky sweater. I bend one leg under me getting comfy. <strong>""The guac is my mom's recipe, and completely delicious. And the chips are organic.""</strong></p>

""No, it's okay,"" Tomoe says about your outfit. She offers a nervous smile, reaching up to stroke one of her pigtails, ""I just didn't take off my makeup or change yet, that's all. What would you like to drink? No sake this time, I know.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""No, it's okay,""</strong> Tomoe says about your outfit. She offers a nervous smile, reaching up to stroke one of her pigtails, <strong>""I just didn't take off my makeup or change yet, that's all. What would you like to drink? No sake this time, I know.""</strong></p>

I give her a grateful smile when she takes sake off the table definitively. ""Water's fine, thanks.""

I'm worried about this whole situation. It feels like walking on such thin ice and I'm never sure what will cause the first crack. ""So, how have you been recently? Are classes going well?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I give her a grateful smile when she takes sake off the table definitively. <strong>""Water's fine, thanks.""</strong></p><p>I'm worried about this whole situation. It feels like walking on such thin ice and I'm never sure what will cause the first crack. <strong>""So, how have you been recently? Are classes going well?""</strong></p>

Tomoe gets you a water from her little fridge, and even pulls out a teeny ice tray to put cubes in a glass, and pours the water into the glass. She brings it over, bottle and glass, puts it on her coffee table, then she hustles back to grab the chips and guac, and sits down beside you. ""Classes are boring, it's all core curriculum stuff. I went to high school in Tokyo, this is basically remedial for me. I don't have classes with hardly anyone I know except for Super Self-Defense and a couple other Supers courses. All my normal classes are islands of nobodies. What about you?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Tomoe gets you a water from her little fridge, and even pulls out a teeny ice tray to put cubes in a glass, and pours the water into the glass. She brings it over, bottle and glass, puts it on her coffee table, then she hustles back to grab the chips and guac, and sits down beside you. <strong>""Classes are boring, it's all core curriculum stuff. I went to high school in Tokyo, this is basically remedial for me. I don't have classes with hardly anyone I know except for Super Self-Defense and a couple other Supers courses. All my normal classes are islands of nobodies. What about you?""</strong></p>

I feel the corner of my mouth turn down a bit when she talks about her Supers courses. ""About that, uhm..."" I cringe a little. Why is it always the 'uhms?' ""We haven't really talked about, well, all of that. The Super stuff."" Really, I've avoided the topic because of my duplicity, but here it is, staring me in the face, and it would be weird if I ignored it completely now. ""Do...you want to? Talk about it?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I feel the corner of my mouth turn down a bit when she talks about her Supers courses. <strong>""About that, uhm...""</strong> I cringe a little. Why is it always the 'uhms?' <strong>""We haven't really talked about, well, all of that. The Super stuff."" </strong>Really, I've avoided the topic because of my duplicity, but here it is, staring me in the face, and it would be weird if I ignored it completely now. <strong>""Do...you want to? Talk about it?""</strong></p>

Tomoe nods, but it's not like she brought this up to brag. She swallows, clears her throat, and says, ""My father. He was a major hero in Japan. My great-grandparents survived the bomb at Nagasaki, and my father was born with energy powers. He. He used his powers for the good of our people for many years, joined the Global Guardians and the Big Science Action Team. I grew up in his shadow, but I adored him and how he treated everyone. I was born with powers. I can project blue beams of light, which I can make into hard light if needed. Or lasers. It's... flexible, I'm still learning the extent of the powers. Which is partially why I'm here.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Tomoe nods, but it's not like she brought this up to brag. She swallows, clears her throat, and says, <strong>""My father. He was a major hero in Japan. I was born with powers. I can project blue beams of light, which I can make into hard light if needed. Or lasers. It's... flexible, I'm still learning the extent of the powers. Which is partially why I'm here.""</strong></p>

I'm nodding as she talks, aware that this is new territory and not wanting to make any wrong moves. But this is also an opportunity to understand her more, and I don't want to miss out on that.

""That's really cool, Tomoe,"" I say carefully. ""Really cool."" I pause a moment, then add even more carefully, ""You...you said before that your whole dorm set up was a bribe from your dad. A sort of peace offering. Is...that related to some of the hero stuff?""

But this is also an opportunity to understand her more, and I don't want to miss out on that.</p><p><strong>""That's really cool, Tomoe,"" </strong>I say carefully. <strong>""Really cool.""</strong> I pause a moment, then add even more carefully, <strong>""You...you said before that your whole dorm set up was a bribe from your dad. A sort of peace offering. Is...that related to some of the hero stuff?""</strong></p>

Tomoe nods, becoming quiet for a bit, looking away from you at the TV, which she turns on, but mutes. The screen shows some commercial for a cleaning product and Plasticman shows up in the commercial using his powers to spray the product in increasingly bizarre places in his home to clean it before the Justice League (played by actors) shows up for a dinner party.

""I joined the Super Young Team last year."" Tomoe says quietly, the news should be something she'd be proud of, the Super Young Team is the premier superteam in Japan, whizzes with technology, appearing on the internet, they even have a Reality TV show dedicated to their exploits. ""I was a junior member, but they were really great to be around. I wanted to fly with  Crazy Shy Lolita Canary, and dance with  Well-Spoken Sonic Lightning Flash."" She huffs a single laugh at the memory, ""Like everyone else, I had a huge crush on  Most Excellent Super Bat. God, he's so hot."" The memory seems to sting as she admits this crush, and she pulls her knees up to her chest, heels on the couch cushions. 

After a moment, she puts her chin on her knees, ""My father. Earlier this year, he was at a party and he... he got drunk. I always thought he supported me, I thought he wanted me to join a team like- like he did. But he came to the office of Innovative Concepts, they're-they're the marketing company who sold Super Young Team, Inc. merch and marketed us. No. Them. He destroyed everything that had my face on it, Kendra."" A sob breaks in her throat, and you see tears form in her eyes that she tries to blink away.

What do you do?

God, he's so hot.""</strong> The memory seems to sting as she admits this crush, and she pulls her knees up to her chest, heels on the couch cushions. </p><p>After a moment, she puts her chin on her knees, <strong>""My father. Earlier this year, he was at a party and he... he got drunk. I always thought he supported me, I thought he wanted me to join a team like- like he did. But he came to the office of Innovative Concepts, they're-they're the marketing company who sold Super Young Team, Inc. merch and marketed us. No. Them. He destroyed everything that had my face on it, Kendra.""</strong> A sob breaks in her throat, and you see tears form in her eyes that she tries to blink away.</p><p>What do you do?</p>

I watch Tomoe's face closely while she explains, and when I see those tears form in her eyes, I feel my own eyes start stinging too. I swallow the lump in my throat, reminding myself that I don't have to be a sympathetic crier. I just am.

I reach out a hand, hesitate a moment, then place it on her shoulder. ""I'm sorry, Tomoe."" I swallow again then speak softly, trying to encourage her, ""M-maybe he just didn't want you getting caught up in all the fame and stuff? I mean, he sent you here, right?""

I just am.</p><p>I reach out a hand, hesitate a moment, then place it on her shoulder.<strong> ""I'm sorry, Tomoe.""</strong> I swallow again then speak softly, trying to encourage her,<strong> ""M-maybe he just didn't want you getting caught up in all the fame and stuff? I mean, he sent you here, right?""</strong></p>

column2: Tomoe turns to you and leans forward, wrapping an arm around you, sobbing into your shoulder. The touch, your wet eyes, the compassion, it unlocks all that she's been bottling up. ""There's more, Kendra!"" She weeps against your shoulder, clutches you for long moments before she's able to move from blubbering to speaking clearly.

She whispers in your ear, unable to look into your eyes, ""After... after he ruined everything with my face on it, he turned on Innovative Concepts! Before Super Bat erased the recordings, he showed me how my-my father murdered all of them. The whole floor! He stalked them, Ken-Kendra, used his powers on them... it was awful. We didn't know! I swear, I had no idea, you have to believe me. He came after me, Kendra, stalked me in downtown Tokyo. He fought all of us- of of them. We beat him, but he hurt Canary. He hurt me, too, pretty bad."" She takes a shuddering breath, sits back and looks at you again. ""Lightning Flash figured out that Mister Mind had controlled him. We removed that- that thing from my father and took it into custody, but it was extradited to America... then the Super Young Team erased my entire time on their team. Everything, like I was never there. I was so angry with my father! I had nothing but shame in Japan... so I came here."" She exhales sadly and looks down at your lap.

column1:
I hold Tomoe as she cries, feeling more and more horrified and uncertain as she tells her story. Her own father, turned murderer, turned on her, and then to be cut out? Like she never existed? How am I supposed to respond to that? And beyond that, how am I supposed to continue as Mackenzie knowing what I know now?

It’s overwhelming. I feel so far out of my depth.

“Tomoe,” I swallow my own tears, trying desperately to be strong. “I’m. I’m so sorry. That’s just, just horrible. It’s....not your fault. And it’s not his fault either. He wasn’t in control of himself.”

It feels useless, saying these things. I take her hand, holding it in both of mine, gripping tightly, more tightly than I could as Mackenzie, weirdly. Because as Kendra, I’m able to hold as tight as i want. As Mackenzie, I’d need to hold back.

“You’re so brave to be here after all that. I’d be...” I shake my head a little, struggling to find words. “A wreck.”

Her own father, turned murderer, turned on <em>her</em>, and then to be cut out? Like she never existed? How am I supposed to respond to that? And beyond that, how am I supposed to continue as Mackenzie knowing what I know now?</p><p>It’s overwhelming. I’d be...” </strong>I shake my head a little, struggling to find words.<strong> “A wreck.”</strong></p>

Tomoe sniffles, clutching to your hand like you're a lifesaver, ""I am a wreck, though, Kendra! I've been a total bench to this one heroine, and I can't. I can't even help myself. I see her, and she's so flicking perfect, and I just see him! My-my dad, I see them both, and I just. I just hate them! And my team, they're-they're not good guys. I mean, Glitch is, well, you know. And, just... ugh, I just feel like. Like if I try to live up some kind of lie, like I thought I was a hero on the Super Young Team, then I'll blow it. So I'm being bad. And it's worse! I feel stuck, Kendra. I don't even know why I'm here anymore.""

I don't even know why I'm here anymore.""</strong></p>

""Listen, you can be whoever you want to be. You can be a hero, if you choose to be. You've already conquered so much just to get here."" I hesitate, trying to find the right words. My heart is racing almost as quickly as my mind. I have to say something. I have to tell her. Somehow. ""Tomoe...I..."" I adjust my grip on her hand, willing her to not freak out and run away. ""I know you're talking about Mackenzie Marvel. And I know she'd forgive you, if she knew what was going on.""

Tomoe's mouth opens slightly and she looks at you with obvious surprise. After a moment, she sniffs, then her eyes grow watery, ""You're going to tell her about me? Kendra, she won't forgive me. She wouldn't even understand! Her life's perfect, she's so busy judging me that she'd never even listen!""

I shake my head quickly, backing out before this devolves too far. ""No, no. I'm not going to tell her. Not unless you want me to."" I rub comforting little circles on the top of her hand. ""But I hope you tell her yourself. She's...she's not as perfect as she might seem.""

What do you do?

My eyebrows go up just a bit at her request, lips parting just a bit. I didn’t expect that.

“Oh, uhm. W-wow, Tomoe. I...” I can’t say no. I can’t. She’d hate Kendra AND Mackenzie then, guaranteed. “Of course. Yes, of course.”

Even as the words come out of my mouth, I know it’s a mistake, but there’s no taking it back now. It’s out there. I might as well enjoy this while it lasts. I pull her in for a hug, resting my chin over her shoulder and hiding the troubled look on my face. “Of course I’ll be there.”

I stumble over my words for a few moments, blindly grasping for a reason that I'd be so adamant that Tomoe not call right now, then finally get out, ""She's, she's probably sleeping already, and, and besides, isn't this the sort of thing you'd want to talk about in person?""

I barely don't cringe after the words have left my mouth. I think I've already dug my grave at this point. Now I'm just shoveling the dirt in over the top of me. I sigh inwardly.

""Let's take our chips and guac and sit outside. It's a nice night.""

What do you do?

Casual dating, of course. I mean, that makes total sense. But a good word, please.""</strong> She grins, hopefully.</p><p>What do you do?</p>

""Yes, of course. Of course I will."" I grip her hands back, feeling closer again. Like real friends. Like normal friends.

""But you're going to have to tell me what's so good about Ian for me to do it properly."" 

I raise an eyebrow at her, waiting. Really, though, I think it would be good for Kate to date a little. Just to help her get out of the workshop and have regular college experiences. With her past being what it is, I doubt she had any real time for fun and relationships. I mean, at least I got to go to prom and bonfires and the winter formal. I want Kate to have a chance to experience that too...or, something mildly like it at least.

column2: ""Well,"" Tomoe says after a moment of consideration. ""He's smart, makes good grades, and he's studying business. He's pretty handsome, athletic even without the whole, you know, hell hound part."" She takes on a thoughtful look, less like she's thinking of more to say, but more like she's noodling how to say it. ""I've been, you know, pretty hateful. Not just with Mackenzie Marvel, but with my team, too. And he's kind. He isn't a pushover. But he tries to make room for me. Listens. He's... well, he's a good guy. Does that make sense? I just want him to be happy, and he likes Kate.""

""I'm so sorry."" Man, I really screwed things up with her. ""I wasn't mad at you, I was...I was mad at me. I...I sent a really dumb text last time we were together. With all the sake. I just...I just...I'm sorry.""

column3: [Cassidy, Mary] W1N4 Asking for Permission

column4:
Mary is looking to investigate a church that is located in the Northeast neighborhood thus Mary must ask the Sangiovanni for permission to do so.

Mary is outside the Sangiovanni mansion, it is quite large and looks quite old, but still sturdy and kept in good repair.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-325170""><div class=""row"">

Permission. Permission was the absolute state of power. In a city with a gigantic gate, the gatekeeper is queen, for she decides who enters and who exits, who's allowed and who's not, who lives and who dies. This was why that for a moment - Cassidy was the true princess. Mary was standing at the door of the Sangiovanni mansion, dressed in a dress as if it were the medieval era. At her side was a sword, for when diplomacy failed and insults turned to attacks. 

Then she rung the door bell, not once, but twice. Asking permission was beneath her, after all she was Queen, she could just walk in if she wanted too. Yet she didn't survive by stepping on other people's toes, she survived by asking permission when she didn't need too, making friends when making enemies was easier, she would ask permission -- to make a friend if nothing else. After all, let Cassidy be princess for now, but hidden in the shadows, Mary would be queen.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Permission. Permission was the absolute state of power. In a city with a gigantic gate, the gatekeeper is queen, for she decides who enters and who exits, who's allowed and who's not, who lives and who dies. This was why that for a moment - Cassidy was the true princess. Mary was standing at the door of the Sangiovanni mansion, dressed in a dress as if it were the medieval era. At her side was a sword, for when diplomacy failed and insults turned to attacks. <br><br>Then she rung the door bell, not once, but twice. Asking permission was beneath her, after all she was Queen, she could just walk in if she wanted too. Yet she didn't survive by stepping on other people's toes, she survived by asking permission when she didn't need too, making friends when making enemies was easier, she would ask permission -- to make a friend if nothing else. After all, let Cassidy be princess for now, but hidden in the shadows, Mary would be queen.</p>
A few moments later the door was opened by a man in an old fashioned suit. Without a word said he looked her up and down as if to judge and then stepped to the side to allow her in.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>A few moments later the door was opened by a man in an old fashioned suit. Without a word said he looked her up and down as if to judge and then stepped to the side to allow her in. </p>

Mary didn't pay any attention to the man, merely walking past him to find Cassidy. Along the way, she looked for anything about Cassidy, any photos, any paintings, anything that could piece together who she is.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mary didn't pay any attention to the man, merely walking past him to find Cassidy. Along the way, she looked for anything about Cassidy, any photos, any paintings, anything that could piece together who she is.</p>

As she entered she felt the cold. Inside the a.c. was blasting and were she still alive, that would have been uncomfortable. The smell of bleach tickled her nose as she noted how spotless the place was.

Inside the main hall she noticed several more people stopping to stare at her. Silence was eerie. Marie couldn't quite put her finger on the source of this discomfort until she took notice she couldn't hear a single heartbeat between all of them.

The man who opened the door lifted his arm in a welcoming gesture, then pointed her towards the northern wing and started leading the way himself.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>As she entered she felt the cold. Inside the a.c. was blasting and were she still alive, that would have been uncomfortable. The smell of bleach tickled her nose as she noted how spotless the place was.</p><p>Inside the main hall she noticed several more people stopping to stare at her. Silence was eerie. Marie couldn't quite put her finger on the source of this discomfort until she took notice she couldn't hear a single heartbeat between all of them.</p><p>The man who opened the door lifted his arm in a welcoming gesture, then pointed her towards the northern wing and started leading the way himself.</p>

She briefly glanced around her, ignoring the glares of the surrounding dead. Everything here felt dull, the air was cold, the people were cold, everything was cold. If your going to live forever, it should be enjoyed and savored like a fine meal, not spent moping around in a cold mansion. She continued to follow the man. ""Cassidy darling!, It's me Mary and I've come to talk!"" She called out in a gleeful tone, knowing that Cassidy was nearby. There was a warm smile on Mary's face, making her stand out like a beacon of warmth among the cold.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>She briefly glanced around her, ignoring the glares of the surrounding dead. Everything here felt dull, the air was cold, the people were cold, everything was cold. If your going to live forever, it should be enjoyed and savored like a fine meal, not spent moping around in a cold mansion. She continued to follow the man.<em> ""Cassidy darling!, It's me Mary and I've come to talk!""</em> She called out in a gleeful tone, knowing that Cassidy was nearby. There was a warm smile on Mary's face, making her stand out like a beacon of warmth among the cold.</p>

Mary's voice echoed in the hall with only shoefalls as accompaniment.

Her nose got tickled by a new sent as they took a turn. A slightest hint of decaying flesh broke through the bleach. Turning her gaze ever so slightly Mary noticed more than a few corpses hidden around the hall.

After a few moments the hallway ended with a massive door. Snippets if conversation between children could be heard beyond. As her guide approached the door and knocked, Mary could see that the door was one of the few things in the that spoke of the events that transpired here not so long ago. The door was checkered with claw marks and cracks.

The conversation behind the door stopped. After a few book slams one of the voices from before squeaked ""Enter."" The man opened the door.

The man opened the door.</p>

She briefly glanced at the clawed door, Cassidy had a terrible sense of decoration, corpses strewn about, clawed up doors, not only was the mansion depressing, it was also a crime scene. She entered the door, still paying no attention to the man.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>She briefly glanced at the clawed door, Cassidy had a terrible sense of decoration, corpses strewn about, clawed up doors, not only was the mansion depressing, it was also a crime scene. She entered the door, still paying no attention to the man.</p>

Mary entered a large round study. All the walls in the room were covered floor to ceiling with books. To one side an old porcelain doll was placed. Mary found it surprising, how wonderfully beautiful the doll seemed. Managing to drag her gaze away from the door, in front of a large table in the middle of the room she saw a girl. Cassidy looked to be in her mid teens, short brown hair somewhat covered her dark sunken eyes that rose to observe the newcomer. The girl was dressed in bright floral dress.

Noticing Mary Cassidy scurried to cover her arms in long dress gloves, however Mary couldn't help but notice, that her hands and forearms were covered in burns in vein patterns.

""Miss De Artois,"" Cassidy greeted her guest. ""To what do I owe the pleasure?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Mary entered a large round study. All the walls in the room were covered floor to ceiling with books. To one side an old porcelain doll was placed. Mary found it surprising, how wonderfully beautiful the doll seemed. Managing to drag her gaze away from the door, in front of a large table in the middle of the room she saw a girl. ""To what do I owe the pleasure?""</p>

She grinned warmly, eyeing the porcelain doll with curiosity in her eyes. There was a sense of youth to her, as if she was still in the prime of her life, sweet, pretty and almost innocent.

 ""Miss De Lupo!"" She greeted back ""I'd like to request permission to visit a certain church of yours. There's a cult there which I'd like to investigate, a cult on your territory."" She explained ""There's an elder vampire called Manasseh, recently he sent a mob to attack our Princess. We believe he's working with a group called the VII, a bunch of scoundrels who we believe Manasseh is working with. Of course, this is a big problem not only for me and you, but our entire city. Ah I'm rambling again, I propose an alliance, we'll work together against a common enemy, instead of each other.""

""VII? You must excuse me, I had little time to acclimatize to the local politics... Which cult was that?"" she asked quite coldly as the smile seemed to fade . ""Remind me please were they the pagans or the bible thumpers?""

""Bible thumpers"" She returned the childlike smile, she clasped her hands together, talking in a casual tone, as if she was gossiping about the newest scandal  ""In their demented minds they saw Manasseh as a benevolent god!. <textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Cruel though that may seem,  you must admire the tactical advantage taken... But I digress. What church are you planning to explore?""</p>

""It's a church in the northeast neighborhood. I don't know the name, I'd reckon it doesn't have one either, after all, it was their hiding spot, what's more obscure than a church without a name?. Cass raised an eyebrow.

""All churches have names..."" she mused then loudly clapped her hands and shouted ""Tanno!""

Seconds later a lady wearing a heavy coat opened the door.

""Yes, mistress?"" She asked.

""Bring me a map, one of the detailed old ones.""

As the door closed behind the servant Cassidy turned her eyes back to Mary.

""Let us check what the old Sangiovanni have to say of this church of yours...""
