""and I'm saddened by your lack of confidence"" Mary replied, a look of glee in her eyes ""You see, We are damned and when we die, we're going straight to hell. But there's a bit of a loophole see?, We will live forever. It doesn't matter if we live doing god's work or spitting on the cross. Because we will never die and we will never be punished or rewarded for our actions. We are above god's judgement. In a way, even a God cannot stop us""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>""and I'm saddened by your lack of confidence"" </em>Mary replied, a look of glee in her eyes <em>""You see, We are damned and when we die, we're going straight to hell. But there's a bit of a loophole see?, We will live forever. It doesn't matter if we live doing god's work or spitting on the cross. Because we will never die and we will never be punished or rewarded for our actions. We are above god's judgement. In a way, even a God cannot stop us""</em></p>

""Confidence has little to do with this... Our lives may be prolonged, but death is far from conquered. If you do not agree try having a walk under the sun, or approaching a bonfire... Even forgoing your meals for  few weeks... Death is far from a thing we have defeated. And as for this god... Be careful, dear Mary, lest you start sounding like a bible thumper yourself.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Confidence has little to do with this... Our lives may be prolonged, but death is far from conquered. If you do not agree try having a walk under the sun, or approaching a bonfire... Even forgoing your meals for  few weeks... Death is far from a thing we have defeated. And as for this god... Be careful, dear Mary, lest you start sounding like a bible thumper yourself.""</p>

""Don't compare me with those bible thumpers. I'm nothing like them"" Mary replied, referring to the Lancea Et Sanctum ""I find them boring anyways. It's always ""We are damned"" this and ""God hates me"" that, they're nothing but a bore. Your Requiem is meant to be enjoyed, after all, why bother being damned if you don't enjoy it?.""

She paused, having realized she was rambling again, she adopted a serious face, dropping her sweet attitude ""Death is conquered if we're smart with our Requiem. I'm not going to walk into the Sun now am I?. I've been playing this game centuries before your grandfather was born. When you were a child, I was Queen of France. When everyone told me I would die, I survived. I've watched cultures start and end, I've watched Neonates become Elder's, I've watched this all and I watched it end. While here I stand untouched by time. Do not tell me I will die soon, you'll find yourself waiting a long time""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><em>""Don't compare me with those bible thumpers. I'm nothing like them"" </em>Mary replied, referring to the Lancea Et Sanctum <em>""I find them boring anyways. It's always ""We are damned"" this and ""God hates me"" that, they're nothing but a bore. Your Requiem is meant to be enjoyed, after all, why bother being damned if you don't enjoy it?.""<br><br></em>She paused, having realized she was rambling again, she adopted a serious face, dropping her sweet attitude <em>""Death is conquered if we're smart with our Requiem. I'm not going to walk into the Sun now am I?. I've been playing this game centuries before your grandfather was born. When you were a child, I was Queen of France. When everyone told me I would die, I survived. I've watched cultures start and end, I've watched Neonates become Elder's, I've watched this all and I watched it end. While here I stand untouched by time. Do not tell me I will die soon, you'll find yourself waiting a long time""</em></p>

""Seems I hit a nerve..."" Cassidy smiled. ""No one here is plotting your doom, Mary, relax. But think on your reference, waiting a long time means nothing when one has nothing but time, as you so eloquently put."" Her eyes drifted to a small shelf above the door, where a single long fanged skull was placed. ""I'm fairly certain my grandsire there thought he had been victorious too..."" Cass mused.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Seems I hit a nerve..."" Cassidy smiled. ""No one here is plotting your doom, Mary, relax. But think on your reference, waiting a long time means nothing when one has nothing but time, as you so eloquently put."" Her eyes drifted to a small shelf above the door, where a single long fanged skull was placed. ""I'm fairly certain my grandsire there thought he had been victorious too..."" Cass mused.</p>

column2: The Apex squadron, hastily assembled out of necessity, have materialised out of hyperspace in the Vendhelm system. Their calculations were spot on, saving them from crossing the asteroid belt, surrounding the system. Each and every one of the craft were painted differently, showing not only the personalities of their pilots, but also the diversity of race, backgrounds, lack of resources and, according to the Imperials, also the disarray of the Rebels. This time perhaps, they would be right - while the newly assembled Apex squadron might sound elite in name, the colourful bunch of various vessels gave an entirely different impression. This impression was strengthened by the fact that they were flying together for the first time and unlike the strict formations that the Imperials used, the loose cluster in which Apex was surrounding the freighter looked crude and amateur like.

column3: Little could the Imperials know that the squadron was led by a Rebel Commander – an individual with more than enough experience from his previous leadership of hastily assembled Ragtag squadron. Even after having been established as a fighter squadron, Ragtag kept this name to honour its former leader.

As the long lines of light shrank back into the stars before their eyes, the rebel sensors flickered and displayed their target – the currently still peaceful looking maintenance station of the Vendhelm system.

column2: Despite the commanders public doubts in the competence of Rebel Intelligence, the scanners showed exactly what they had anticipated - only a few TIE fighters were patrolling the area and no larger ships in sight.
column3: Apex Heavy to Apex Leader - we're approaching the station. It appears their security is light, nothing you can’t handle I guess. Still… would prefer not to have her repainted after the mission. Hopefully they won't get reinforcements anytime soon. May the Force be with us - Apex Heavy out.""
column4: With this the large Galofree transport ignited its main engines, pushing them to their limit. Within moments the bulky vessel was under way, pushing itself ever faster towards the station.
column5:
The few patrolling TIE fighter, warned by the sensor buoys in the asteroid belt, headed towards them at flank speed and Imperial comm channels were flooded with alarm messages and warnings. It was only a matter of time before imperial reinforcements would arrive.

(higher resolution)

Being thrown forward during the deceleration, Jessa cursed silently about her craft's current state. While it seemed safe to fly again, its performance was still hindered due to the reactor damage it sustained in the prior mission. 

Seeing the large frame of the Galofree moving past them, accelerating towards the station, the girl activated her targeting computer to see what was out there worth shooting at. 

""This is Apex Six reporting in! All systems functional"" ""Wish it would be true"" Jessa though t to herself. ""Eight bogeys on intercept course. Seem to be regular Ties! Requesting permission to engage."" 

Closing the Squad comms, she said to her Astromech ""Alright Rowdy! Round two for us! Give me full power to the weapons and angle shields double forward. Time to shoot us some Imps!""

""Exclamation: I am looking forward to aid you in the deletion of more troublemakers master. Advice: You should however not push this craft quite as hard as you did last time. It might expire before we make it back. I am skilled at repairs but I am no Jedi. I cannot magically hold this fighter together.""  the R5 commented before following his master's orders.

So... we are commiting. It is impossible to fall back after this point without leaving the transporters behind. We just have to go through with it... and Force be with us all... 

Kai lowered his yellow visor and activated commincator to broadcast. His voice was calm and matter-of-fact: ""Apex Three ready. Over."" He switch the channel to internal communication: ""Everything all right up there, R5?"" He heard a series of beeps, read the translation on his display and smiled: ""Same here, buddy. Don't you worry, it is just in and out and we will be back home in no time...""

He watched the blips on his sensors as Imperial Starfighters were closing in on them. Just in and out...

Amara smiled as they came out of hyperspace right on-top of some completely unaware Imps. 'Gotcha!' she thought, then triggered her comms. ""Alright Checkers - Apex."" she corrected herself. ""Up and at them! Apex Leader, I'll leave that lower formation to you and yours. Three, Six, with me! I'm gonna go right down their throat, make them scatter and give them something to think about. Get on their asses when they're busy dodging and regrouping, and light them up!""

Pushing the throttle forward and heading towards the first formation of TIEs with all the speed her Y-Wing could manage, Checker Leader - now Apex Two - found herself grinning fiercely. ""Alright Zeeto. Shields double front, full power to weapons. Let's keep them to busy to think, shall we?""

The TIEs loomed closer and closer, and Amara kept heading straight for them. ""I'm not gonna dodge, boys. My ship as shields and a hull more robust than tinfoil. I know y'all have to be mentally impaired to fly those things, but surely ya ain't suicidal, eh?"" When she got into range, Amara pushed down the trigger and held it, sending red laser fire towards the TIEs. She sort of aimed for one of them, but her main intent was to scatter them and keep them busy.

Apex Two is rerouting power to weapons (+2 to Shooting)

Borun makes sure everything is in order. The mechanics may have a hard job, but they did well on his craft. Shortly, he relishes in the situation; swimming through the outer sea was much more preferable than walking on dry land.

Hearing Apex Six calling at first, he wonders, but accepts the fact that the numbers are called in reverse here. Expecting Neve to call, the Quarren is wondering again as Three is next, followed by Two and answered by Six again.

Splaying shortly his tentacles, he hits the radio button after there's silence on the channel again.

back to his unit and put on his helmet. His Rebel marines were assembled around

""Syrush, what is the best way to defeat your enemy?""

Tall imperial officer pointed at young cadet taking a short nap on the tactics lesson


""To keep your fighters safe and defeat enemy through attrition. Outnumbering the enemy will quickly break the resistence""

Young baron was gazing at instructor with bloody eyes. This was the strategy from old republic book he got from his father. He said it was best.


""You will never gonna be a leader Alderaanian. You need to make sacrifices for victory. Quickly bite snakes head off and without their leader, demoralize enemy pilots.""

Imperial instructor was happy with himself. He hated the nobility...

...

""This is Apex Heavy to Apex Leader! We've docked the maintenance station and we're boarding!""

Major Lomax has sent only short, formal message to the commander, but his mind was busy. He and his marines have waited in anticipation, till the airlock door will open. No one really knows what will await them on the other side...

Finally, the airlock has opened with a silent hiss, and the silence was filled with sound of trading blaster bolts.

Kappa Nine is attempting to evade tailing from Apex Four:
Roll 12 + 3 (piloting) + 2 (TIE) = 17! Apex Four managed to position himself behind Kappa Nine without significant problems.

Kappa Twelve has attempted to evade tailing by Apex Twelve, but being shot kinda ruined his efforts.

3RD ROUND (GALACTIC EMPIRE)
Only three of them remained, bravely trying to stop the Rebel forces, knowing they probably won’t live longer than next few seconds, maybe minutes, if they are lucky.
“Kappa Squadron… this is Kappa Leader. We knew what we signed up for… and we’ll defend this station to the last breath. For the Empire!”

Although his statement was quite calm, his voice has been slightly shaking. After all, he was a man flying to his death. There was so much more he felt, what he wanted to tell… about the greatness of the Empire, about the peace and prosperity it brought, about their comrades-in-arms… his own pilots. And yet, he managed to let out only standard imperial message to keep up his face.
Lastly, his thoughts went to his wife and their six months old son, and lingered there for a while. This was quite safe assignment and now…

… he closed his eyes to see them clearly one last time, before he flies to his death.

Kappa Leader is firing on Apex Leader:

Roll 7 + 3 (shooting) + 3 (wingman) = 13. Miss!

Kappa Nine is wingman to Kappa Leader.

Kappa Eleven is attempting to tail Apex Four:

Amara  crept closer to the TIE that was Kappa Twelve, her thumb hovering over the trigger. Soon. Soon. Now!

And Kappa Twelve exploded, with Jessas X-wing racing out of the fireball. The blonde gasped out a curse and yanked her stick around, one foot slamming down on the rudder pedals. Rosies engines screeched in protest as Amara pushed her into a dive, and they just barely cleared the oncoming fighter. Close enough to count the scales pained on it's side.

""What the fuck Six?!? Have you gone insane? Warm me before you pull shit like that!""

But Jessa was already gone, shooting more Imps, taunting them over comms.

""That girl is fucking nuts."" Zeeto agreed with a series of upset beeps.

Seeing the last Tie explode in a fireball, Jessa brought her craft to full stop.

""Where is the nearest ejected pilot?"" she enquired

""Report: While there are numerous pilots drifting between debris, the closest belongs to Kappa Five and is located approximately 200 meters above you, Master."" the R5 replied swiftly. 

Carefully maneuvering her fighter close to the ejected pilot, Jessa could see hil drifting helplessly in space, turning in all axis. Apparently his stabilizers on his suit had given out or were damaged in the explosion of his craft. When she was only 3 meters away from the Imperial, Jessa depressurized her cockpit and opened it. 

The vacuum of space was noticeable even through her armor but her HUD informed her that she had 10 minutes before life support were to run out. ""More than enough time"" she thought to herself.  

Switching her helmet comms to open frequency, she noted ""Its a pitty I cannot see your face you imperial pig... Id love to see that fear in your eyes right now... You think you will be taken prisoner? Maybe still hope that your bloody emperor will swoop in, shooting lightning out his ass to kill us evil rebels? Well let me make this clear... just in case someone is listening... I am no rebel... I am Jessa Daeh of Mandalore and for any imperial unlucky enough to get too close... I am death...""

With these words, the girl pushed off her fighter, drifting towards the pilot, who by now started flailing violently in a futile attempt to stabilize himself. When she was in reaching distance, she pulled her Beskar knife from her boot and slit it slowly into the man's flight suit. 

The pressurized air rushed out through the cut but so did blood, now quickly freezing to red crystals. Again and again Jessa stabbed the Pilot until his movements seized and both of them were silently floating in space. 

""Hmpf... funtime is over it seems..."" the girl remarked before using the dead body as resistance and pushed herself back to her fighter. 

Back in the cockpit, Jessa sighed deeply but smiled widely. ""Guess we better be ready to aid those marines in salvage... don't want to be court-marshaled for what they surely will call murder... AND for disobeying direct orders...""

""Remark: The idealistic meat-bags will not understand your motives, Master but I do."" Rowdy said.

After the fighter was pressurized again, Jessa turned her craft towards the station but waited for further instructions before engaging her drive.

And they the beeps changed into a worried screech. She glanced down at the text translation and let out another curse. ""She is doing what now?!""

Amara craned her head as she looked for Jessas X-Wing. She found it floating in space, the canopy open, and Jessa going after an Imp pilot with a knife. ""Six, back off, now!"" But the girl didn't react. Maybe she didn't even hear her, not having tuned her helmet comms into the squad channel. Air and frozen blood clouded around them.

Jessa received her instructions quickly enough - together with the wailing alarm of a target lock. ""Six, lock your S-Foils and disengage your weapons."" Amaras voice was flat and distant. ""Make for the station at half speed, straight approach, no detours.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>And they the beeps changed into a worried screech. She glanced down at the text translation and let out another curse. <strong>""She is doing what now?!""</strong></p><p>Amara craned her head as she looked for Jessas X-Wing. She found it floating in space, the canopy open, and Jessa going after an Imp pilot with a knife. <strong>""Six, back off, now!""</strong> But the girl didn't react. Maybe she didn't even hear her, not having tuned her helmet comms into the squad channel. Air and frozen blood clouded around them.</p><p>Jessa received her instructions quickly enough - together with the wailing alarm of a target lock. <strong>""Six, lock your S-Foils and disengage your weapons.""</strong> Amaras voice was flat and distant. <strong>""Make for the station at half speed, straight approach, no detours.""</strong></p>

""Wilco Boss, heading for the station now... no need for that target lock though... were on the same side after all."" Jessa replied in a voice too happy for the occasion. 

She locked her S-foils and began her approach but halfway there something happened that she did not expect.

""Warning: Reactor pressure building rapidly. Source: a broken weld on reactor chamber. Solution: Extend S-fouls to provide cooling to reactor and proceed to station at flank speed."" Rowdy warned his pilot.

""Damn... that reactor aint gonna hold long enough for me to calmly truck over to the station... Rowdy how long until full system failure?""  the Mandalorian asked, her voice now more nervous than before.

""Reply: Reactor failure imminent. Time remaining approximately 4 minutes and 30 seconds. If reactor fails, retro-thrust capability will be lost and you will impact the station at whatever speed you are traveling at time of failure."" her R5 answered. ""Addition: Due to the leak, high amounts of heat and radiation are leaking into the superstructure of the fighter. Without extended S-Foils you will be boiled in your armor within the next 2 minutes, Master"".

""Sorry Boss, something came up so I'll have to be a bad girl for a while longer and disobey that order you just gave... see you on the station!"" she radioed before she reopened her s-foils and engaging her main engine at flank speed, darting towards the imperial depot. Due to the impaired reactor, The T-65 was limited in its maximum speed and acceleration but was still fast enough to leave Amara's Y-wing in the proverbial dust in the first moments. 

[The roll is to see if the acceleration breaks any tail Amara has on Jessa] -> she doesnt. Her crippled fighter can easily be caught again if Amara wants to

Amara started to follow Jessa as they headed towards the station. She glanced down at her instruments, checking her systems. ""Zee, reroute pow- yeah, that."" Letting out a long breath as she kept an eye on the X-Wing before her, Apex Two tried to ignore the shiver that had went down her spine at the girls happy tone.

And then Jessa unflolded her S-Foils, gunned the engines and started to open the distance between them. Amaras eyes went cold. She didn't bother to race after the girl, or order her back. ""No you won't."" And she thumbed down her trigger.

""Warning: Incoming ion blast"" was all the R5 was capable of saying before the projectile hit the T-65.

The shields flickered and died and the systems of the craft were overpowered with the charged particles. 

""Oh come on Boss... not cool!"" Jessa shouted but she was not sure if Amara could hear her with the power of her suit radio alone. 

The engine of her x-wing sputtered and died, leaving the ship drifting towards the station. 

""St...us:"" Sy....tem....r..b...ting...60...."" came from her trusty R5 but the girl grumpily noted ""Yeah take your time Rowdy... its not like your Master is being fried here or something like that...""


After a moment of silence the girl heard ""Status Update: System reboot successful. Ship status: disabled. Reactor burnt out. Restart Impossible. Radiation Warning. Evacuate craft immediately."" 


Trying her luck with the eject function, Jessa unbuckled and ejected the canopy with the explosive bolts, letting the escaping air carry her from the cockpit. 

""Well then eject from craft Rowdy... you will be my way to the station if all else fails"" Jessa ordered.

After the droid detached from the craft he used his thrusters to realign himself and his pilot and began the deceleration process so that they no longer were barreling towards the station. 

The T-65 would most likely impact the station somewhere near the docks is it kept its current course but ta the current speed the craft would detonate upon impact. 

Now close enough to Amara's bomber to see her squad leader, Jessa did what any adolecent teenager that just got shot would do and flipped her off. ""You freakin shot my fighter Boss... so not cool...""

""I better find a new ride on that station or Boss and I will have to have a talk later..."" Jessa remarked to her droid.

Seeing Jessa eject from what she assumed was a perfectly good, if now slightly singed craft, Amara arched a brow. ""She is going to make it difficult, is she?""

Carefully bringing her ship closer to the disabled craft, Amara extended her landing gear and used it to hook the X-wing, starting to carefully drag the ship to a relative standstill. ""Apex Heavy, Apex Two. Be advised we have disabled craft in need of a tow once we're done with the station. Have the marines secured an LZ for us, or are we to wait?"" She didn't grace Jessa with a reply for now.

Be advised we have disabled craft in need of a tow once we're done with the station. Seeing Amara dock with her derelict craft, Jessa frowned and ordered her droid ""Rowdy boost my comm signal as much as you can. She might be a bit trigger happy but I dont want her roasted alive by radiation either.""

""Report: Signal strength increased by 90%. Probability of penetrating radiation disturbance at 60%. Apology: This is all I can currently do, Master."" her droid replied

“Apex Two be advised: T-65 has catastrophic reactor failure. Your lovetab just gave it the rest. Radiation is leaking into the hull of the craft and beyond. Would suggest detaching the craft to prevent radiation damage to you.” Jessa said, hoping her signal got through. 

In the meantime all she could do was to continue on her way to the station, assisted by her astromech.

""Life Support depleted in 8 minutes, 45 seconds"" her HUD showed her. 

""Hey Rowdy... how long till we reach that Hangar there?"" the Mandalorian asked

""Information: At current speed we should arrive at the hangar force-field in 7 minutes 24 seconds"" Rowdy replied. 

""Hey with time to spare!"" Jessa grinned. 

Getting bored of just silently floating towards the station, the girl started reciting a poem she had written, not noticing that she was still broadcasting her weak signal on squad frequency. While the likelihood of it being picked up was slim due to her limited signal range.

The voice with which she was reciting her little poem was eerily happy and in stark contrast to its content.

""You beat me once, you raped me twice
made me long for paradise
but when I lay there on the floor
the next of you came through the door

Not for one night, not for one year
after a while it all was clear
I had to kill you, one by one
with twisted knife or fired gun

Too much liqueur, too much sex
and you forgot the restraint checks
so I was free and you were doomed
my darkest wishes finally bloomed

The flesh around your throat is pale
Indented by my fingernails
Death is a friend to love and I
But sorry love, this is goodbye

And you will not the only be
There will be others! You will see
there were to many for me now
I had to get out, get out how?

And this is how the story went
I could escape thanks to a vent
but one day I’ll be back, its true
and then the one afraid is you""  the girl cheerfully rhymed

Jessa was floating towards the station in the space. With that station shielding the comms
signals, he wasn’t aware of what happened and quickly looked for some threat or
debris of some… but came up empty:
is Apex Three… what the hell happened here? An enemy ambush?!”
Kai smiled. Sensor screen was clear, no more enemies. His last manouver put him
closer to the station and further away from the rest of the squadron. He
frowned… everything seemed clear… but Epp always used to say
honest, he always used to say
unexpected or it will bite you in the arse’ ...</em> but the point stands. </p><p>He punched
shields, so I will make a flyby around the station. That should reveal any
possible hidden weapon systems. Just because the sensors say that there are
none, doesn’t mean that it is really the case.

column2: Kappa Nine has been destroyed! Roll on save: 2! Died in explosion!
Kappa Ten has been destroyed! Roll on save: 2! Died in explosion!
Kappa Leader has been destroyed! Roll on save: 6! Pilot has managed to eject was later picked up!

After the last TIE was destroyed, there was silence… Jessa managed to reach the station in her armoured suit, where the marines were still fighting their way towards the spare parts. The rest of the squadron was anxiously waiting, knowing that the sent distress call from the station must have been intercepted by now. The situation was only made more nerve wrecking by the fact that the already thinly staffed Apex currently was one fighter down. No new enemy squadrons started from the station, as the boarding was swift and deadly – Imperial pilots scrambling towards their fighters had been cut down by blaster-fire or had to take cover, leaving space superiority to the rebels… for now.

The situation that Apex squadron was finding itself in right now was surreal to the highest degree. Not only did they all just witnessed their sister-in-arms exit her fully functional fighter to mercilessly stab a defenceless imperial pilot but also had to look on as their second in command committed friendly fire, in an attempt to reign in her rogue subordinate.

column1: While Jessa was now floating towards the station in what can only be described in the most podracer-esque way imaginable, the rest of the squadron had but one question on their minds: What now?

column2: Alright everybody, this is not the end of the mission yet. You have about 10 minutes of ingame time for some RP, before the reinforcements arrive. I suppose you guys have now more than enough INTERESTING events to ponder about, so have fun! Personally, I can’t wait to see angry baron in action.
I’ll write here mid-mission results, but that doesn’t mean you can add any skillpoints just yet, nor you can erase any debt (not like any would be needed. You mercilessly broke my toys.)

column4: 4 pilots died (from which one was murdered by Jessa after ejecting),

column3: Baron Vernon Syrush - 1 kill (Kappa Eight), 10 kills in total
Amara Kariya - 1 kill (Apex Six), 2.5 kills in total
Kai Acheron - 2 kills (Kappa Three, Kappa Six), 4.5 kills in total
Borun Berir - 2 kills (Kappa Seven, Kappa Nine), 5.5 kills in total
Neve Kurp - 3 kills (Kappa Two, Kappa Ten, Kappa Eleven), 7 kills in total
Jessa Daeh - 4 kills (Kappa Leader, Kappa Four, Kappa Five, Kappa Twelve), 7 kills in total

column1:
Seeing Apex Three zoom past her on his way back to the formation, Jessa waved him and replied ""Nothing much Three... I stabbed an Imp, boss shot me which killed off my reactor, prompting me to some space acrobatics... will try to join you up there ASAP but for now... you are one down... i hope they have something spaceworthy down there. Six out."" 

The way the girl spoke was happy and carefree, as if everything she just described was absolutely normal. Only the words ""boss shot me"" were spoken with a slightly accusing tone.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Seeing Apex Three zoom past her on his way back to the formation, Jessa waved him and replied <strong>""Nothing much Three... I stabbed an Imp, boss shot me which killed off my reactor, prompting me to some space acrobatics... will try to join you up there ASAP but for now... you are one down... i hope they have something spaceworthy down there. Six out."" </strong></p><p>The way the girl spoke was happy and carefree, as if everything she just described was absolutely normal. Only the words ""boss shot me"" were spoken with a slightly accusing tone. </p>

""Six failed to comply a direct order when told to back off from the pilot. She then failed to comply with yet another order when told to lock her S-Foils and make for the station at half speed. To ensure the safety of further POWs I disabled her craft. I was not aware of a reactor failure at that time."" Amara calmly answered Kai's question, staying close to Jessa in case the girl needed a lift. The her usually non-chalant tone was all steel. ""Apex Six, meet me in the station's hangar bay once you have reached it.""


Setting her ship down in the hangar, Amara could se obvious signs of a firefight, but the actual shooting had evidently moved on. She stayed inside her cockpit for a moment, calmly pulling off her gloves and helmet, giving Jessa time to reach her.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Six failed to comply a direct order when told to back off from the pilot. She then failed to comply with yet another order when told to lock her S-Foils and make for the station at half speed. To ensure the safety of further POWs I disabled her craft. I was not aware of a reactor failure at that time.""</strong> Amara calmly answered Kai's question, staying close to Jessa in case the girl needed a lift. The her usually non-chalant tone was all steel. <strong>""Apex Six, meet me in the station's hangar bay once you have reached it.""</strong></p><hr><br><p>Setting her ship down in the hangar, Amara could se obvious signs of a firefight, but the actual shooting had evidently moved on. She stayed inside her cockpit for a moment, calmly pulling off her gloves and helmet, giving Jessa time to reach her. </p>

Once she passed the force-field, the girl hit the deck hard due to the artificial gravity taking effect. ""Gonna feel that one in the morning"" she groaned but quickly stood up, pulling her blaster from its holster. 

""Rowdy take cover behind these crates and give me a warning, should someone enter the hangar bay"" she ordered. The droid complied silently, rolling slowly behind the cover, pointed out by his master. 

Aiming down her blaster's iron-sight, the Mandalorian slowly approached Amara's bomber, turning often, keeping her head on a swivel. ""You never know what to find on a freshly boarded station... wont get a shot in the back from any of these imps..."" Jessa told herself. 

reaching the craft, the girl waved to Amara, signalling that the area seemed clear for now and it was safe for her to exit the cockpit. Keeping her back towards the bomber, she continued to survey the hangar, keeping her eyes on the few entrances.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Once she passed the force-field, the girl hit the deck hard due to the artificial gravity taking effect. <strong>""Gonna feel that one in the morning""</strong> she groaned but quickly stood up, pulling her blaster from its holster. </p><p><strong>""Rowdy take cover behind these crates and give me a warning, should someone enter the hangar bay""</strong> she ordered. The droid complied silently, rolling slowly behind the cover, pointed out by his master. </p><p>Aiming down her blaster's iron-sight, the Mandalorian slowly approached Amara's bomber, turning often, keeping her head on a swivel. <strong>""You never know what to find on a freshly boarded station... wont get a shot in the back from any of these imps...""</strong> Jessa told herself. </p><p>reaching the craft, the girl waved to Amara, signalling that the area seemed clear for now and it was safe for her to exit the cockpit. Keeping her back towards the bomber, she continued to survey the hangar, keeping her eyes on the few entrances. </p>

""Considering that they have made no attempt to flank our own forces, I dare to doubt that the defenders have anyone in place to take a shot at us."" Amara jumped down from her cockpit, settling into parade rest as she straightened. ""And we need to talk, pilot.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Considering that they have made no attempt to flank our own forces, I dare to doubt that the defenders have anyone in place to take a shot at us.""</strong> Amara jumped down from her cockpit, settling into parade rest as she straightened. <strong>""And we need to talk, pilot.""</strong></p>

""Didn't get anything through from heavy or the marines... just hears white noise on their channels... guess my receiver on the helmet ain't cut for their frequency. Still... can't be to careful in such situations..."" the girl answered, lowering her gun, letting it hang loose in one hand. 

After a last look towards the entrances, she turned around, facing Amara. Despite her armor, the woman towered about a head over her so she took a slow step back as to not to have to look up too obviously. 

""What ya wanna talk about boss?"" Jessa asked in a quite innocent and still way too happy voice. ""No harm done... don't hold it against you that you... well maybe i hold it a little against you that you shot me in the ass... then again... didn't communicate the reactor issue clearly enough... so guess my fault too..."" 

Looking around the hangar the girl remarked ""Ya think they got something space worthy around here? while i DO love my Krayt... I love not being boiled by radiation more...and no offense but even if that thing"" she pointed at Amara's bomber ""still had a second seat... i ain't brave enough to fly in that...""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Didn't get anything through from heavy or the marines... just hears white noise on their channels... guess my receiver on the helmet ain't cut for their frequency. Still... can't be to careful in such situations...""</strong> the girl answered, lowering her gun, letting it hang loose in one hand. </p><p>After a last look towards the entrances, she turned around, facing Amara. Despite her armor, the woman towered about a head over her so she took a slow step back as to not to have to look up too obviously. </p><p><strong>""What ya wanna talk about boss?""</strong> Jessa asked in a quite innocent and still way too happy voice. <strong>""No harm done... don't hold it against you that you... well maybe i hold it a little against you that you shot me in the ass... then again... didn't communicate the reactor issue clearly enough... so guess my fault too..."" </strong></p><p>Looking around the hangar the girl remarked <strong>""Ya think they got something space worthy around here? while i DO love my Krayt... I love not being boiled by radiation more...and no offense but even if that thing"" </strong>she pointed at Amara's bomber <strong>""still had a second seat... i ain't brave enough to fly in that...""</strong></p>

Kai was confused, listening to the transmissions: ""Wait... Jessa did what?"" After Jessa said it, he wanted to request a repeat of the message, because he thought he misunderstood... but then Amara confirmed his darkest fears. Jessa killed an Imperial pilot while he was defenceless? That... just... can't be right. She wouldn't. He punched some buttons and reviewed all messages that were sent in the time he was behind the station and didn't recieve them. He sat there and listened to that horror... he closed his eyes and his face showed only resentment and disgust. He turned it off and sat silently for a few moments.

""Why?!"" The disappointement and pain in his voice were palpable. ""Why would you do that, Jessa?"" He put his faith in that girl, knowing that she was troubled... but taking her as his fellow pilot and trusting her with his life. But the cheerful tone of voice when she bragged about murdering a guy... she broke that trust. 

He didn't expected an anwer... in fact... he didn't want to hear Jessa's voice at that moment. He switched his comms: ""Apex Heavy, this is Apex Three. I am at disposal for the close support to the marines if they need it. Will position myself near to the station to be able to react to their call. Apex Three over.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Kai was confused, listening to the transmissions: <strong>""Wait... Jessa did <em>what</em>?"" </strong>After Jessa said it, he wanted to request a repeat of the message, because he thought he misunderstood... but then Amara confirmed his darkest fears. <em>Jessa killed an Imperial pilot while he was defenceless? That... just... can't be right. She wouldn't.</em> He punched some buttons and reviewed all messages that were sent in the time he was behind the station and didn't recieve them. He sat there and listened to that horror... he closed his eyes and his face showed only resentment and disgust. He turned it off and sat silently for a few moments.</p><p><strong>""Why?!"" </strong>The disappointement and pain in his voice were palpable. <strong>""Why would you do <em>that</em>, Jessa?""</strong> He put his faith in that girl, knowing that she was troubled... but taking her as his fellow pilot and trusting her with his life. But the cheerful tone of voice when she bragged about murdering a guy... she <em>broke </em>that trust. </p><p>He didn't expected an anwer... in fact... he didn't want to hear Jessa's voice at that moment. He switched his comms: <strong>""<em>Apex Heavy</em>, this is <em>Apex Three</em>. I am at disposal for the close support to the marines if they need it. Will position myself near to the station to be able to react to their call. <em>Apex Three</em> over.""</strong> </p>

Amara cocked a brow, waiting for Jessa to finish her little bout of rambling. 

""You"" she pronounced the word very clearly ""will adress me as Captain, or by rank and name. You will take off your helmet when speaking to a superior officer. You will stay silent unless asked a question, or granted permission to speak.""

She started to circle around the girl with slow, measured steps. 

""You may think you're special, Jessa Daeh of Mandalore. You may think that, because of what you have suffered through, you should be granted special lenience.""

Amara stopped behind Jessa for a moment.

""You are not. We all have our sob stories. Some are worse than others, some aren't. None of them make you special in any way. Because what you are, what you became when you joined us, what you represent every time you fly under our colours, is a Rebel.""

She stopped again in front of Jessa, facing the younger woman. 

""And if I am mistaken about that, then you can hitch a ride in an escape pod full of Imps when we blow this place to hell and back.""

Amara leaned forward a bit.

""Since you are young, and traumatized, I will refrain from pushing for a Court-Martial for this time. I cannot, however, speak for Commander Syrush.

But remember this, Lieutenant Daeh. You are a fighter pilot. First, last, always. If I ever hear about you attacking an ejected pilot again, I will shoot you myself. Is that understood?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Amara cocked a brow, waiting for Jessa to finish her little bout of rambling. </p><p><strong>""You""</strong> she pronounced the word very clearly <strong>""will adress me as Captain, or by rank and name. You will take off your helmet when speaking to a superior officer. You will stay silent unless asked a question, or granted permission to speak.""</strong></p><p>She started to circle around the girl with slow, measured steps. </p><p><strong>""You may think you're special, Jessa Daeh of Mandalore. You may think that, because of what you have suffered through, you should be granted special lenience.""</strong></p><p>Amara stopped behind Jessa for a moment.</p><p><strong>""You are not. We all have our sob stories. Some are worse than others, some aren't. None of them make you special in any way. Because what you are, what you became when you joined us, what you represent every time you fly under our colours, is a Rebel.""</strong></p><p>She stopped again in front of Jessa, facing the younger woman. </p><p><strong>""And if I am mistaken about that, then you can hitch a ride in an escape pod full of Imps when we blow this place to hell and back.""</strong></p><p>Amara leaned forward a bit.</p><p><strong>""Since you are young, and traumatized, I will refrain from pushing for a Court-Martial for this time. I cannot, however, speak for Commander Syrush.</strong></p><p><strong>But remember this, Lieutenant Daeh. You are a fighter pilot. First, last, always. If I ever hear about you attacking an ejected pilot again, I will shoot you myself. Is that understood?""</strong></p>

Taking off her helmet, Jessa remained silent during Amara's speech. While she listened to every word, she had a hard time not interrupting her superior or simply shooting the woman for speaking that way with her. ""Would be all too easy... enemy trooper comes... takes a crackshot... poor captain gets hit in the face..."" she thought for a moment but suppressed the urge. Nevertheless the rage was clearly visible in the girls eyes and her grip around her blaster clearly tightened. 

""Flying in one of your fighters makes me as little a Rebel as sitting your ass in a fang would make you mandalorian... captain..."" the girl answered slowly. ""If it satisfies your morals to court-marshal me feel free to do so. As you just said, I am in no way special so why make exceptions.""

Jessa took a deep breath to steady her voice before continuing ""You rebels feel so morally superior to the empire but when it comes down to practicality you also do not shy away from mass murder... how many people were on the death star? Bit over a million souls? Surely not every single one of them loved the emperor, was knowing what was going on or even was a combatant... how many janitors, cooks, mechanics and medics did that farmer boy kill that day? He got a fucking medal for it as far as i have heard... Rebels kill imperials... that is how it is... this is a war, not a bloody pillow-fight... When I was running with these corelian smugglers I saw first hand the type of morals some rebels are using... an important imperial officer aboard a prison barge? Blow the whole ship... Imperials holding a village? poison the water... The rebels are in part as bad as the empire... the only reason i fight with you is because the empire had wronged me more..."" the mandalorian tried to keep her voice down but her calm was gone by this point so much so that he could not prevent herself from uttering the last words before falling silent again ""All I did out there was doing my job... killing imperials... and if you think... captain... that I will let you shoot me a second time... you will find out the hard way why it took the Jedi to take the Mandalorians down..."" 
With this the girl put on her helmet again and remarked ""Now get out of my way so I can find myself a new fighter... You can rely on one thing: I do not shoot allies... and you will need every last pilot to get back home safely... do what you want when we are back on base... put me in the brig, court-martial me, send me away to fend for myself... I will deal with that when the time comes... NOW let me do my bloody job..."" 

While the urge was big to simply walk away from her Captain, Jessa at this point did not trust Amara not to simply shoot her in the back. Waiting for her reply, the girl innerly prepared to defend herself if the need should arise.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Taking off her helmet, Jessa remained silent during Amara's speech. While she listened to every word, she had a hard time not interrupting her superior or simply shooting the woman for speaking that way with her. <em>""Would be all too easy... enemy trooper comes... takes a crackshot... poor captain gets hit in the face...""</em> she thought for a moment but suppressed the urge. Nevertheless the rage was clearly visible in the girls eyes and her grip around her blaster clearly tightened. </p><p><strong>""Flying in one of your fighters makes me as little a Rebel as sitting your ass in a fang would make you mandalorian... captain...""</strong> the girl answered slowly. <strong>""If it satisfies your morals to court-marshal me feel free to do so. The rebels are in part as bad as the empire... the only reason i fight with you is because the empire had wronged me more...""</strong> the mandalorian tried to keep her voice down but her calm was gone by this point so much so that he could not prevent herself from uttering the last words before falling silent again <strong>""All I did out there was doing my job... killing imperials... and if you think... captain... that I will let you shoot me a second time... you will find out the hard way why it took the Jedi to take the Mandalorians down...""</strong> <br>With this the girl put on her helmet again and remarked <strong>""Now get out of my way so I can find myself a new fighter... You can rely on one thing: I do not shoot allies... and you will need every last pilot to get back home safely... do what you want when we are back on base... put me in the brig, court-martial me, send me away to fend for myself... I will deal with that when the time comes... NOW let me do my bloody job...""</strong> </p><p>While the urge was big to simply walk away from her Captain, Jessa at this point did not trust Amara not to simply shoot her in the back. Waiting for her reply, the girl innerly prepared to defend herself if the need should arise.</p>

""I have not dismissed you, Lieutenant!"" If Amara felt threatened, she didn't show it. 

""Let me educate you on the difference between you and that farmboy. What he did was destroying an enemy that was still in the fight. What you did was to murder a defenseless POW. I don't care how many TIEs you shoot down, how many ships you blow up. If it can fight back, it's a valid target. 

But it is because we claim to be morally superior to the Empire that we must act like it. If we don't we are nothing short of the hypocritic terrorists they claim we are.

Now. You can make that choice, right here. Either you can play by our rules, or you can't. If you can't, find your own exit. Simple as that.""

She started to turn, but then stopped. ""Oh, and one more thing.

The people that raped you? They were animals. And they did what they did because they thought they could break you, destroy you, and reduce you to the same thing - an animal. A broken, mewling thing, afraid of her own shadow, unable to function like a normal human being. Mistaking cowardice for courage, and bloodlust for strength. And the question, Jessa, you need to ask yourself, is:""

She leaned forward, got right into the girls face.

""Do you want to prove them right?""

Amara cocked a brow, then straightened again.

""That would be all, Lieutenant. Let me know of your answer once you have tought it over.""

With that, she turned, and started to climb back into her cockpit.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""I have <em>not</em> dismissed you, Lieutenant!"" </strong>If Amara felt threatened, she didn't show it. </p><p><strong>""Let me educate you on the difference between you and that farmboy. What he did was destroying an enemy that was still in the fight. What you did was to murder a defenseless POW. I don't care how many TIEs you shoot down, how many ships you blow up. If it can fight back, it's a valid target. </strong></p><p><strong>But it is because we claim to be morally superior to the Empire that we must act like it. And the question, Jessa, you need to ask yourself, is:""</strong></p><p>She leaned forward, got right into the girls face.</p><p><strong>""Do you want to prove them right?""</strong></p><p>Amara cocked a brow, then straightened again.</p><p><strong>""That would be all, Lieutenant. Let me know of your answer once you have tought it over.""</strong></p><p>With that, she turned, and started to climb back into her cockpit.</p>

The woman's words hit Jessa like nothing she had felt before. She had steeled herself against potential violence, anger, disappointment... but nothing in her 18 years of life had prepared her for the gut-wrenching truth Amara had just presented her. She.Was.Right....

""Captain..."" Jessa began but cut herself off , looking down at her own feet. she did not feel pain, regret, fear... right now she felt nothing. a deep void had filled her where there was resolve before. Her picture of herself and of the world around her was shattered as violently and as unexpectedly as the imperial station she had referenced just moments before. She had, by her own doing become what she had hated. Turned into a savage beast, only yearning for blood, not caring for the feelings of others or the consequences of her actions. And just like that, a flood of guilt washed over her. 

""I know I am in no position to ask for anything... but I would like to.... ask for your permission to retrieve the body of the pilot I killed... he floats too close to the station and the imperials surely wont find him afterwards... I want to give the man a proper burial...""

The girl waited for a reply from her Captain, after which she turned herself to leave as well.

While turning herself away from her superior however she added ""Thank you for your honesty....Amara...""

The young Mandalorian then proceeded towards the exit of the hangar, blaster at the ready. She was going to find a new craft and then start the probably long if at all possible way of regaining her comrades trust.

Her picture of herself and of the world around her was shattered as violently and as unexpectedly as the imperial station she had referenced just moments before. She had, by her own doing become what she had hated. Turned into a savage beast, only yearning for blood, not caring for the feelings of others or the consequences of her actions. And just like that, a flood of guilt washed over her. </p><p><strong>""I know I am in no position to ask for anything... but I would like to.... ask for your permission to retrieve the body of the pilot I killed... he floats too close to the station and the imperials surely wont find him afterwards... I want to give the man a proper burial...""</strong></p><p>The girl waited for a reply from her Captain, after which she turned herself to leave as well.</p><p>While turning herself away from her superior however she added <strong>""Thank you for your honesty....Amara...""</strong></p><p>The young Mandalorian then proceeded towards the exit of the hangar, blaster at the ready. She was going to find a new craft and then start the probably long if at all possible way of regaining her comrades trust.</p>

Amara was already  flicking switches when Jessa spoke up.She said nothing for a moment, then nodded. ""That seems only proper. Be careful, Lieutenant."" She kept herself disant as she spoke, but when she looked after the departing girl again there was a twitch at the corner of her mouth that might have been the beginning of a smile.

""Apex Leader, this is Apex Two. Taking off from the station and standing by for further orders.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Amara was already  flicking switches when Jessa spoke up.She said nothing for a moment, then nodded. <strong>""That seems only proper. Be careful, Lieutenant.""</strong> She kept herself disant as she spoke, but when she looked after the departing girl again there was a twitch at the corner of her mouth that might have been the beginning of a smile.</p><p><strong>""Apex Leader, this is Apex Two. Taking off from the station and standing by for further orders.""</strong></p>

Blobs of blood were catapulted out from shaking body into open space bounding off thee mandalorian battle armor. Barons eyes were widely open.

""What the..."" He could not understand mere brutality of this action. Vernon was raised in the world of pride and nobility. World where knights benevolently forgive their enemies and help them on their feet before they are brought to the law. Even mandalorians are in his memories honourable enemies, that will fight you head to head. This, this wasn't human, this was animal.

Vernon needed some time to think what to do in this situation. Apex two landed on the station. Two small figures had argument in the bay.

""B4 relay message to headquarters. This is Apex leader, we have misbehaving pilot that gone rogue. Please prepare for Apex six return with security force. Have weapons armed. Subject may be aggressive. Bring her to my office. End of transmission.""

Then Baron activated his communication: ""Apex two, what the hell is going on, return to formation! Apex six, report to major Lomax, he will take care of you until you get back home. You are in bad trouble now, get back in line!""

He still did not know what should he report back home. As officer he knew that this was unacceptable. It was murder, without reason, just for killing, she should never see more than a janitor equipment and prisoner outfit. But he was also commander he knew, that situation of the fleet was dread. They did not had enough pilots to field single elite squadron. Every single one of them will count in the events that will follow. Maybe... It was just accient. He set his thrusters to cruising speed, flying directly to the murdered pilot.

""Major Lomax, this is apex leader. Apex six will report to your unit, get her home, her reckless behaviour cost us valuable alliance equipment.""

Dead body impacted golden x-wing, torn apart by huge force of fighter. It was just sad accident.

""This is Apex leader for everybody, regroup and wait till Apex heavy is loaded and let's go home.""

Hearing Apex Leader's orders, Jessa ordered her R5 to yet again boost her signal ""This is Six reporting in. Currently hunting for a new fighter to replace the damaged T-65. Think I might have something here... bit bigger that what I am used to and not yet sure if space worthy but I am standing in front of what seems to be a decommissioned A/SF-01 B-wing. My Astro thinks he can get her running with enough time. Request permission to salvage her and rejoin formation. Have not seen the Major yet but assume he has his hands full with the prisoners and sporadic resistance"" 

After a brief pause she added ""Got permission by Apex Two to retrieve the body of the man I murdered in order to give him a proper burial back home. Would join the formation after that if that is acceptable to you, Leader.""


Until she hears back from Apex Leader to hear otherwise, Jessa will attempt to salvage the A/SF-01

""Report: Running level one diagnostic on craft. Structural integrity nominal, weapon systems nominal, engine systems nominal, hyper-drive systems nominal, reactor offline. Initiating restart sequence. Estimated time to reactivation 5 minutes."" Rowdy informed his Master. 

""Send that report to Apex leader and Apex two. I want them to know whats going on down here. No more unexplained behavior... I have been shot over a misunderstanding once today already..."" the Mandalorian remarked. 

""This is R5-OD on Apex squadron priority channel one, hailing Apex Leader and Apex two. My master... Apex Six, requested me to provide you with the current status of her new craft. prepare to receive data."" with this, the droid sent a data-stream with the current status of the vessel to both fighters.

Parts of body hit by x-wing were floating in the space, no traces of murder to be found.

""Get in that craft, apex six, and report. Forget the body, it is unrecoverable. You will need to remove shame from name of your house the hard way.""

""Warning: Reactor unstable. Emergency shutdown in effect. Report: Master, it seems the reactor of this craft is the reason it was grounded here. I am unable to rectify this without maintenance mechanics and a replacement reactor. "" Rowdy informed Jessa.

The girl kicked the landing gear of the b-wing and cursed. 

""Apex leader be advised. B-wing not space-worthy. Will search for an alternative. Request Apex heavy to pick up both the fighter and my astro on its way out. Six over and out"" she radioed.

After a while, the Commander went active finally. His arguments are interesting enough and the Quarren is pleased to hear the dryskin including in his arguments the concept of honor. 

Not being pure in which ways the Mandalorian's honor differs from the Baron's - dryskins are a variable lot - he makes himself a mental note about researching the theoretical concepts of honor for humans, which seems to differ even on the same planets, being dependent of subculture more than of environment. 

He knows the code of the human marines, the human soldiers, too; some parts are similar to his own, others differential, further ones make no sense to him. Funny thought alongside, are there even humans from a sole planetary origin or are they already mixed up completely?

Moving as ordered, Borun tilts the nose of his craft slightly outwards for better sensor reception and a shorter reaction time; with only five fighters left and both the best shots the most unreliable ones, one of them out, it's going to be a hard swim back into safety. Hopefully, she would hold herself back in the transport, but that's the responsibility of other people.

Last but not least, Apex heavy wouldn't be the best in maneuverability; the Quarren had a saying about a pregnant whaladon in a swirl...

Her astromech suddenly chirped, prompting Amara to look down on her instruments to read its message, a readback of the message Apex Leader had just sent to HQ. She ground her teeth for a second. ""Thank you, Zee. Relay HQ: 'Belay those orders. Checker Leader, End of Transmission.'""

Then she opened the squadron channel. ""Belay those orders, Major Lomax. Six is attempting to acquire a replacement craft at the moment. Stand by for updates as the situation develops.
Apex Leader, this is Two. Be advised that the situation has been resolved for the time being, and that I will impose further consequences as necessary. Two out.""

Amara was no more happy about what happened than the Commander. But while Jessa clearly did not put much stock in the whole chain-of-command thing she had the feeling that she had reached the girl where it mattered. The last thing she needed now was for a relative stranger, and a man, to bluster in and re-ignite the girls temper.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Her astromech suddenly chirped, prompting Amara to look down on her instruments to read its message, a readback of the message Apex Leader had just sent to HQ. She ground her teeth for a second. <strong>""Thank you, Zee. Relay HQ: 'Belay those orders. Checker Leader, End of Transmission.'""</strong></p><p>Then she opened the squadron channel. <strong>""Belay those orders, Major Lomax. Six is attempting to acquire a replacement craft at the moment. Stand by for updates as the situation develops.<br>Apex Leader, this is Two. Be advised that the situation has been resolved for the time being, and that I will impose further consequences as necessary. Two out.""</strong></p><p>Amara was no more happy about what happened than the Commander. But while Jessa clearly did not put much stock in the whole chain-of-command thing she had the feeling that she had reached the girl where it mattered. The last thing she needed now was for a relative stranger, and a <em>man</em>, to bluster in and re-ignite the girls temper.</p>

Amara's order had reached Major Lomax right on time, as there currently were several rebel guns aimed at the young Mandalorian. 

Jessa had run into the marines while searching for a new ship and was held at gunpoint under the Baron's orders. 

Lowering his gun and ordering his team to do the same the replied ""Roger that, order belayed. Mam i hope that decision is final for now, the imperials have barricaded themselves in the reactor control room and me and my boys are kind-of busy trying to flush them out. Salvage operations are running, the station is mostly secured. Will advise on progress as soon as the situation changes. Ground-team out.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Amara's order had reached Major Lomax right on time, as there currently were several rebel guns aimed at the young Mandalorian. </p><p>Jessa had run into the marines while searching for a new ship and was held at gunpoint under the Baron's orders. </p><p>Lowering his gun and ordering his team to do the same the replied <span style=""color: rgb(54, 96, 146);""><strong>""Roger that, order belayed. Mam i hope that decision is final for now, the imperials have barricaded themselves in the reactor control room and me and my boys are kind-of busy trying to flush them out. Salvage operations are running, the station is mostly secured. Will advise on progress as soon as the situation changes. Ground-team out.""</strong></span></p><p><span style=""color: rgb(54, 96, 146);""><strong><br></strong></span></p>

""Apex Leader, Apex Two, this is Apex Six how copy?"" the girl asked, unsure if the handheld radio that the marines had left her was getting through or not. Due to the relative proximity to the shielded compartments of the station, Jessa was getting a lot of interference. 

""Got handheld rad.....Marines....Found a hangar with......s... will.... Marines told..... soon ready.... pull back from blast zone....""

Jessa was sure that at least some of her message got through but had no way of knowing which part and how much until she was out of the shielded area. Seeing several oxygen tanks at the side of the room she currently was in, an understandably proper place to store them, given her location, she decided to refill her armors O² reserve before continuing her efforts to rejoin her comrades.

Marines told..... soon ready.... pull back from blast zone....""</strong></p><p>Jessa was sure that at least some of her message got through but had no way of knowing which part and how much until she was out of the shielded area. Seeing several oxygen tanks at the side of the room she currently was in, an understandably proper place to store them, given her location, she decided to refill her armors O² reserve before continuing her efforts to rejoin her comrades. </p>

column2: As the raid was still in progress, their sensors have reported two hyperspace jumps in their vicinity. Apex squadron could see a Vigil-class corvette emerging, oddly familiar to some of them. But then again, the Empire uses standardized equipment, therefore almost all the ships can look familiar. After a while, they’ve noticed the source of the second hyperspace jump. A small fighter, which shape could be recognized probably only by their commander.

Captain Verenz looked over the opposing forces with a visible disgust. This is what they’ve been sent for? Only few of those have been able to take over the maintenance station? Although they might have looked more like a bunch of entertainers rather than a fighting force, as he looked over their very diverse crafts, he wasn’t the type to make such a grave mistake as to underestimate them.

It was a shame what has the Empire come to. Defeated by a handful of barely trained, understaffed and even less funded bunch of criminals. However, he wasn’t here to enjoy the view - and didn’t wait too long before giving orders:

“Release the rest of the Scourge squadron,” he commanded as he walked over the bridge. He turned towards one of his men: “Lieutenant, start the electronic interference to impair the functionality of their targetting computers.”

“But sir! For that we would have to reroute too much energy, and we wouldn’t be able to maintain our weapons powered!”, the lieutenant tried to protest, but the captain stopped, looking directly on him:
“I’m well aware, lieutenant. Do as I ordered.”
The lieutenant has made series of commands in the console, until The Huntress started releasing waves, impairing their targetting computers.
(this causes -1 to shooting for every Rebel as long as the effect lasts)

The TIE advanced has waited. Scourge Leader wasn’t a fool - encountering the Rebels on his own would be a suicide. But as soon as the rest of his squadron was released from the hangar, he headed towards the Rebel forces, backed by a bunch of TIE Interceptors.

“Rebel filth, this is Scourge Leader speaking. You are outnumbered, outgunned and you have no chance of victory. Blah, blah, I’m sure you heard it before. I’d recommend your surrender, but we both know you won’t, so I don’t really care. And it’s okay, I wouldn’t have it any other way.”

(higher resolution)
Antharon, roll on a soldier for initiative.

Kai turned off the proximity alarm and studied his sensors quickly.

7 TIEs and Vigil-class Corvette against their 5 Starfighters and unarmed transport ship.

Well, shit.

DON'T shoot me... again... Didn't have any paint to mark the craft so... make sure it ain't me you are obliterating."" 

The girl grinned and initiated the startup sequence ""Holy hell guys... not only smells like new fighter in here this thing is MODERN as all hell! I am looking forward to this!""

""Apex Six, would you do us all a favour and shut the hell up? Your incessant jabbering is distracting us from a very real threat that we have in front of us, so unless you have something to say that directly relates to combat maneuvers keep your radio off you Ch'itrt'seco en'tisan'sasi!""

Neve's patience just ran out and he got so annoyed and upset at the little brat constantly distracting everyone that he didn't even notice that he slipped a few insults at her in Cheunh.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""Apex Six, would you do us all a favour and shut the hell up? Your incessant jabbering is distracting us from a very real threat that we have in front of us, so unless you have something to say that directly relates to combat maneuvers keep your radio off you </strong><i style=""font-weight: bold;"">Ch'itrt'seco en'tisan'sasi</i><strong>!""</strong></p><p>Neve's patience just ran out and he got so annoyed and upset at the little brat constantly distracting everyone that he didn't even notice that he slipped a few insults at her in Cheunh.</p>

""Aw pucker up you blue chiss basdard... if you would sit in an enemy ship you would want your pals to know that too!"" Jessa shot back and then turned her radio to receive only. 

Knowing that the lack of radio discipline might get her into even more trouble as she already was, she decided to at least try and play by the rules but while she had no idea what exactly Neve had called her, his tone was more than enough to tick her off.

[OOC note: Since Jessa spent most of her life on Mandalore, she only ever heard of one blue skinned race from her father, making her assume Neve's race]

As Jessa was broadcasting on open frequency, not only the Rebels could hear her. Mante Binting patiently listened to her announcement and raised an eyebrow when he heard her plea to not shoot her AGAIN. Did they just shoot one of their own? That could make a whole thing a lot easier.

column2:
And he was surprised even more when he heard her being so rudely interrupted by one of their own. He grinned, as the Rebel communication was simply entertaining. And he was looking forward to sow even more chaos in their ranks… however the message hinted it could be the other way around.

“Scourge Leader to Scourge squadron. There are more rebels incoming from the station, possibly in kidnapped imperial craft. Shoot down anything which starts from that base. Scourge Leader, over.”

However, it wasn’t the Scourge Leader who was properly appreciating the discord in the Rebel ranks. Aeron Verenz might have seemed calm and determined in their victory, but inside he was quite tense. He wasn’t the type to underestimate their enemy - these freaks have managed to take the whole station - and it took him not only a lot of convincing, but also funding to create the Scourge squadron, eventhough still incomplete.

He didn’t have to be a genius to realize where the weakness of the Empire is - the Flight Academy might produce good cadets, but they rarely stayed alive long enough to actually gain some experience, unlike the Rebels in their sturdier crafts.

He wouldn’t want to lose the Scourge squadron right away like this - not after the whole ordeal it took to convince Mante Binting on his side to lead it. He needed to deliver results.

1ST ROUND (GALACTIC EMPIRE)

Scourge Leader is firing on Apex Leader:
Scourge Two attempts to tail Apex Four:
Scourge Three attempts to tail Apex Two:
Scourge Four is shooting on Apex Three:
Roll 3d6 + 4 (shooting) + 1 (TIE) + 3 (wingman) = 21! Apex Three’s shields Flickered and went down.
Scourge Five is a wingman to Scourge Four.
Scourge Six is gaining an advantage.

Scourge Seven is gaining an advantage.

There are more rebels incoming from the station, possibly in kidnapped imperial craft. Shoot down anything which starts from that base. Scourge Leader, over.”</strong></p><hr><p>However, it wasn’t the Scourge Leader who was properly appreciating the discord in the Rebel ranks. <em>Aeron Verenz</em> might have seemed calm and determined in their victory, but inside he was quite tense. He wasn’t the type to underestimate their enemy - these freaks have managed to take the whole station - and it took him not only a lot of convincing, but also funding to create the Scourge squadron, eventhough still incomplete.</p><p>

He didn’t have to be a genius to realize where the weakness of the Empire is - the Flight Academy might produce good cadets, but they rarely stayed alive long enough to actually gain some experience, unlike the Rebels in their sturdier crafts.</p><p>

He wouldn’t want to lose the Scourge squadron right away like this - not after the whole ordeal it took to convince Mante Binting on his side to lead it. <em>He needed to deliver results.</em></p><hr><p><strong>1ST ROUND (GALACTIC EMPIRE)</strong></p><hr><p><strong>Scourge Leader</strong> is firing on <strong>Apex Leader:</strong></p><p>
Scourge Two</strong> attempts to tail <strong>Apex Four:</strong></p><p>
Scourge Three</strong> attempts to tail <strong>Apex Two:</strong></p><p>
Scourge Four</strong> is shooting on <strong>Apex Three:</strong></p><p>
Roll 3d6 + 4 (shooting) + 1 (TIE) + 3 (wingman) = 21! <em>Apex Three’s shields Flickered and went down.</em></p><p><strong>

And the Imp managed to cling to her. Not that surprising, honestly, given the craft involved, but still, ""Bugger.""

Well, they had bigger problems. ""A'ight Zee. Buckle up back there and have the super glue ready. This is probably gonna hurt like a bitch."" Amara gunned her engines for what the could give, and raced for the corvette. Whatever it did with that signal, it likely wasn't good.

Also, it would tear their transport apart in a flash, which also wasn't good.

Also also, she owed it to a dear friend to seriously fuck up their day.

""Two here, gonna try and deal with that Vigil. Help's appreciated, but don't get dead on my account.""

Seeing the ship looming closer and closer, Amara squared her shoulders and hunkered down in her cockpit as if she was willing her ship to be a smaller target.

""Right. Zee, show me the bridge on that thing and - "" She trailed off, squinting at the vessel. ""The guns. They ain't firing."" After a second, she shrugged. ""Well, that makes my job easier.""

He is a part of this squadron, too.

The leader's craft is damaged already after the first attack; the captain is moving against the interferencing ship, towing her mate with her. This leaves the blue hot-shot, the girly hot-shot and himself against double the number of capable enemies.

Let the lava burn, brightly and strong.

Going on sending broadband, Borun makes his move:

""Scourge Leader, this is Kokad Borun Berir. You got a sturdier craft than mine, but I doubt you are a match against me, despite your technical support.

I swim behind you. Do you think you can afford being tailed by a Quarren? Do you have it in you to duel one of my kind or will you hide behind technology and comrades?""

Neve was in shock: ""How does that girl know?? No one should know about the existence of our planet let alone that I come from there! Did my slip give me away? Dammit, I should have controlled myself better! You stupid stupid Row'odem'rinu! I need to do something, I need to get rid of her before she goes and tells off other people.""

This ongoing internal breakdown distracted him from what was going on in the battlefield, especially that some squadmates might need help, turning his killer autopilot on.

Lomax bit his lips. He heard the info about enemy reinforcements, but he
received no instructions from Apex Heavy yet. It would take them few
moments to consider what to do, but he might not have those few moments. If he
gets an order too late, he might not have the time to fulfill it and get his
men and women out. <em>We control most of the station and navymen are loading
the supplies. We need few more minutes to take last few holdouts… but… even if
our Starfighters can damage that corvette, the moment they get in range, they
can just blow us to the kingdom come. Time to go. Definitely. It was time to go

column2: : “Landing party, this is major Lomax. The

of the enemies. Seal the doors behind you and fall back to the ship by squads. You
got two minutes. Anyone who stays after that will have to hitchhike. Over.”

machinery behind us remotely. No time to destroy the station. Lomax out.”

Hearing the comm chatter via her handheld radio, Jessa cursed silently at the thought of not being able to fully destroy the station. ""Lucky bastards... but backup was here real quick..."" she thought. 

She had however no time to think more about it and instead had to focus on the unfamiliar cockpit she sat in. 

While her armor allowed for limited interfacing of her HUD, she would need all her piloting skills to pull this one off. 

""All systems nominal. Startup sequence initiated"" flickered over her HUD. 

""This better works..."" she said to herself and grit her teeth while waiting for the boot-up to complete. 

She hated being grounded right now and having her comrades fight without her. She hated herself for getting into this situation. She hated the empire with its shiny factory new toys and she hated men... the latter of which had to wait for the moment however. ""You guys better not die before i come..."" she said, feeling her heart pound and the adrenaline kick in again. She might not be aware of it at the moment but she started to like at least most of her fellow pilots... no matter the gender... 

Amara with her wise words, Kai with his good heart, Borun with his unique point of view on things... even Baron with his strong application of honor... Just Neve could die in a dumpster fire for all she cared... the smug blue bastard really rubbed her the wrong way... still... she would die for any of them... she would prefer not having to die for Neve... or having to die in general but that was in her hands now. 

""Just a moment longer guys...""


[OOC: her radio is on receive only as she doesn't want to distract her comrades with her chatter]

1ST ROUND (REBEL ALLIANCE)

“Apex Leader, this is Apex Heavy. What’s your status and your assessment of the enemy? We’ve started to fall back - that corvette could seriously damage us if it got close, and who knows how many more enemies will be coming. Any orders? I’d recommend to cut our losses and run like hell. Apex Heavy, over.”

column2: In the meantime, on the bridge of The Huntress:
“Sir, they are starting an attack run on us! And we cannot return fire! Shouldn’t I…”

“No, lieutenant. We both know that rerouting the energy takes some time. We would be able to return fire only after the bomb is released. This way we can at least throw off their aim slightly. This corvette can withstand one attack run.”
Scourge Leader attempts to evade tailing from Apex Four:
Scourge Leader effortlessly evaded the tailing attempt, but in his pride, he couldn’t resist replying: “Then show me you have the skill to be worth of my attention, kokad.”

Mante Binting wouldn’t mind trading some insults with the opposing faction, no. Despite the fact this is usually looked down upon by the Imperials - an unnecessary comm chatter. But he knew, that as long as he performs well and delivers results, Verenz will overlook such things.

Although he would like to add something to reply to the Quarren, there was a bigger threat which caught his attention - a bomber making an attack run on The Huntress. That could ruin his standing.

“Cut the chatter,” he heard Verenz in his comm, “and get that bomber.”
Scourge Three maintained his tail, Apex Leader has tailed him automatically.
Scourge Three maintained his tail, Apex Three has tailed him automatically.

Scourge Three has noticed an X-wing on his sensors, but he has maintained his course. It was just one damaged X-wing, he assessed. Not too much of a threat. He almost heard his captain saying that damaged X-wings are all bark and no bite. However, once the second X-wing went behind his back, he was about to break the tailing and evade them both. The Interceptor was fast, and he was confident he can easily shake them.
“Don’t even think about it, Three,” he heard the squadron leader over the comm. “That bomber is making an attack run and you’re in the position. Fire!”

Scourge Three, although feeling everything but safe with two X-wings behind his back, has obeyed the order without a word. That was the Imperial way. And he was member of the elite Scourge squadron… which has valued lives of their pilots a little bit more than the other squadron. And then he heard another voice from the comm, which gave him confidence:
