Baron got into perfect firing position. No need for firing position, this was a sure shot. He was flying straight behind Apex two... He took a deep breath...

""Not so fast arsehole!""

What the hell was this? X-wing flew right into his field of view and started wildly shooting at enemy. Luckily one shot hit the power generator and tie exlopded into million pieces...

""Thanks... a lot... boy... This is apex leader, I have your back apex two, continue attack run...""

B4 sady beeped. Controls were blinking, more or less in red color.

""No, we don't need any exit strategy, push more energy into thrusters and everything will be OK... What? No, not OK as Alderaan, we will get home this time.""

Making wingman to apex two.

Routing power to engines.

He took a deep breath...</p><p><strong><em>""Not so fast arsehole!""</em></strong></p><p><strong></strong>What the hell was this? X-wing flew right into his field of view and started wildly shooting at enemy. Luckily one shot hit the power generator and tie exlopded into million pieces...</p><p><strong>""Thanks... a lot... boy... This is apex leader, I have your back apex two, continue attack run...""</strong></p><p>B4 sady beeped. Controls were blinking, more or less in red color.</p><p>""No, we don't need any exit strategy, push more energy into thrusters and everything will be OK... What? The dim lights of the station hangar faded in a flash as the Tie Interceptor passed through that hangar forcefield

The situation presented to Jessa was chaotic and her first instinct was ""We are fucked all sorts of sideways"" but then her training kicked back in.

Surveying the tangle of fighters, the girl picked out one, punched the acceleration and was pushed hard into her chair.

""WOW this thing MOVES!"" she exclaimed as she was shooting towards the action.

""This is Apex Six calling Apex Squadron, coming in on your six, watch your fire, i am sitting in a shiny Interceptor."" she warned her team via the handheld, as to not draw even more attention to herself  by broadcasting on open channels.

Picking out Scourge Four as her target, Jessa began her attack run, zooming past Borun's A-Wing and the X-Wing of the ""Blue Menace"". 

Apex Six is firing on Scourge Four

glanced behind her as the TIE kept in her rear, despite the two X-Wings that
raced up behind him.<span style="""">  Her astromech let
out a worried series of beeps as she activated her targeting computer.<strong> “I know
he’s back there, Zee. Nothing we can do about that right now. Start calculating

a jump, will you? I get the feeling we won’t stick around for much longer.”

She was
squinting into the computers heads-up display when her fighter suddenly lurched
to one side as laser-fire stripped away her shields. But moments later there
was an explosion behind her, marking the death of the pursuing TIE.<strong> “See, old buddy?

All easy, the rest of the boys got our-“

There was a
warning howl from her droid, and then her ship got slammed side-ways as if
t-boned by a freight train. Apex Two’s Y-Wing went into a lazy roll, trailing
smoke and fire, looking almost graceful as it started to dip too low for a

normal attack run, unresponsive to comm calls.

Inside,
Amara shook her head, trying to get her eyes to focus. Everything was rotating
around her – wait, no. Only the world outside her cockpit was rotating around her.

The cockpit itself just swayed drunkenly all over the place.

Right. What
That sounded like a good idea. Hopefully it would stop her from being sick. She
didn’t want to become the squadrons laughing stock by vomiting all over
herself. Amara grabbed the joystick and stopped her fighters spin.
Something burned in her eye, and she wiped it away. It was blood. And her head
hurt. Her head really hurt. And there was a dent in her helmet. Oh, and there
was like half a dozen warning lights flashing on her instruments.
astromech was screaming at her incoherently. There might have been people on
the comms too, but her droid drowned them out, repeating one message over and
She blinked through her canopy. There was a ship in front of her. Some imperial
corvette. She had been attacking that, hadn’t she? It was getting bigger.
brain lurched back into gear, and her eyes widened as she pulled back hard on
her flight stick. Rosie lurched upward, swaying and unstable, slower than she
was used to. The ship kept getting bigger. “Come on baby girl, up.” She
pleaded, thumbing down on her trigger and hoping the bomb release even still

worked. “Up up up up up!”

They made
it. Just about. Amara was pretty sure she had left some paint behind on the

ships sensor dish. And some bridge officers with brown pants.

column1:
Scourge Three has been destroyed! Roll for save: 6! Pilot has managed to eject and was later picked up!

Scourge Four has been destroyed! Roll for save: 1! Died in explosion!

Scourge Leader attempts to evade tailing from Apex Four:

Roll 10 + 5 (piloting) + 3 (TIE) = 18! Scourge Leader has evaded tailing from Borun's A-wing.

""I've told you to take care of anything which starts from that station!"", Mante yelled though the comm and sighed. That interceptor was certainly quick in shooting and they have been in the heat of the battle, with their hands full. In one moment he's lost two squadron members and the Rebels were still in full force.

Yes, they might have been still alive should they have shields, but as far as he knew, it wasn't as easy to get the Interceptors with shields, although Verenz was doing what he could - or so he said.

""Five, take care of it. I have a corvette to save...""

In the meantime, on the bridge of The Huntress, they've had the moment of their lives. Not like they've never seen a proton bomb to be released at their ship, but that Y-wing wasn't changing course. It still flied directly to the bridge. 

""Lieutenant, power up the weapons NOW!"", Verenz shouted in panic, but he knew it was too late. They should have rerouted the energy a minute ago. He should have listened to his surbordinate, he was right.

""Mante, shoot down that Y-wing before it hits us!"", he said to the comm, not realizing he used his real name in a moment of panic. But it wasn't too hard to guess that if it this them, with all it's bombs, they're goners.

At that moment, as they were closing their eyes before the impact, Amara's Y-wing changed the course and evaded The Huntress very closely.

""Crazy terrorists..."", captain Verenz sighed with relief, as the Y-wing evaded them. Although his men didn't say anything, the relief was easily seen on their faces as well.

""Lieutenant, reroute the energy and power up the weapons. We mustn't repeat such a mistake..."", almost involuntarily admitting he made the mistake. And making mistakes wasn't something that keeps you alive in the Empire for very long...

The Huntress is rerouting their energy from the jammer to power up the weapons. (Neither of them are in effect at the moment).

Roll 13 + 4 (shooting) + 3 (wingman) + 1 (TIE) = 21! Laser shots were accurate and Jessa's TIE Interceptor has exploded!
Jessa, roll for survival, please.
Scourge Six is gaining an advantage.

Amara allowed herself a moment to breathe, patting the instrument panel before her affectionately. ""Atta girl, Rosie. Atta girl.""
That had been way to close.

She looked around to take in the situation, and found Apex Leader still by her side, despite everything. She had to remember to by the man a beer. ""Commander, given that our ships are shot to shit, I suggest we try to support the folks that are still worth a damn. May I suggest helping four with that squirrely bastard in the Whatever-the-Fuck?""

Amara herself fell back and took position behind Kai's X-Wing. ""You take over for a moment, Three. I'm not sure I'm trusting my brain at the moment. I'll be right behind you.""

""Acknowledged, Two. Three taking the lead. Over.""

He checked his situation on sensors and then opened the Rebel comms channel: ""Apex Leader, this is Apex Two. Request permission to withdrawal immediately. Apex Heavy will be ready to retreat presently. We have done a good job of distracting them from the transport so far, but if that Corvette opens fire... we are sitting ducks here. It will take our computers some time to calculate jump... I strongly suggest we shouldn't delay. Three, over.""

He wasn't exagerrating. If anything, he was being overtly optimistic. It was possible that those bloody TIEs would shred them to pieces even before that Corvette manages to get some shots. 

We did our job, lets just get out of here. Come on... come on...

Jessa felt satisfied, seeing her enemy yet again catch fire and disintegrate. The debris of the Interceptor rained on her canopy. ""Another one down!""  she thought. 

There was however no time to celebrate, as moments later her own craft was rocked by impacts. 

The light and nimble craft was torn into pieces by the blaster hits, filling the cockpit with shrapnel and smoke. 

""Fuck fuck fuuuuuuuuck!"" the girl yelled and pulled her eject lever under her seat.

Apex six rolls for save: 1d6

The debris of the Interceptor rained on her canopy. <em>""Another one down!""</em>  she thought. </p><p>There was however no time to celebrate, as moments later her own craft was rocked by impacts. </p><p>The light and nimble craft was torn into pieces by the blaster hits, filling the cockpit with shrapnel and smoke. </p><p><strong>""Fuck fuck fuuuuuuuuck!""</strong> the girl yelled and pulled her eject lever under her seat.</p><p>Apex six rolls for save: 1d6</p>

The ejection mechanism worked as designed and within the blink of an eye the young mandalorian found herself above and behind her quickly disintegrating craft. She could see the Tie that had shot her down, passing below her, veering left before passing through the debris cloud.

""Luubid Kyr'amur...ni cuyanir....ni linibar gaa'taylir...."" she said into her comms, not knowing if anyone heard her

The shock and trauma of ejecting made thinking hard. Jessa felt her concentration slipping and her vision blurring but barely latched on to her consciousness. 

""I need help..."" she finally brought out after a while. 

Lacking any built in thrusters, it was impossible for Jessa to stabilize herself and so she decided to close her eyes and focus on her radio in order not to stress her already churning stomach and sense of balance.

After such a wonderful shot, Neve was sure to have annihilated the TIE. He looked at Jessa's fighter and the sight of it getting destroyed made his heart jump with joy: ""Could I be so lucky that my problem solved by itself?"" However his joy didn't have a long duration as he heard Jessa on the comms asking for help. 

While he was pondering on the possibilities how to get rid of her and make it look like an accident, Scourge Six flew past him with Seven re-positioned behind: ""What? How is it still alive?"" He quickly scanned the ship and noticed that there was no damage on the hull. ""Are they using shields now?? But how? And how come I didn't notice it before? K'pah, this is such a wasted opportunity... but I have to finish what I have started.""

He input the command for a hyperjump and as a bloodlusted hunter he went at his running prey, despite the increased protection, determined not to let it escape.

/reroll shooting debt

column1: aware that the only way he could save her... was to put his own life on the line. Only
part of the X-wing that was shielded enough to protect human beings for the
duration of the hyperspace jump, was the strait cockpit. It was designed for
the single pilot. It was possible to squeeze two, but… the second person had to
be slim and it would be tight. Second problem was how to get Jessa on board. He
had to open the canopy… and expose himself to the vacuum outside. Without his survival
mask. It was broken and mechanics never had the chance to replace it.

column2: <em>This is going to hurt. A lot.</em> Human body

column1: can theoretically withstand the effects of space for a short period of time…
but not for long. They had to work fast.

He switched the channel to broadcast to Jessa: <strong>“<em>Apex Six</em>, this is <em>Apex Two</em>. I am coming to get you. Listen

column1: carefully. I will park next to you and open my canopy. You need to squeeze in

column2: <em>as soon as possible</em>. I repeat, <em>as soon as possible</em>. You probably have

column1: to close the canopy after that, because I will pass out in ten seconds at the
latest. Probably sooner. We probably would not be able to operate the X-wing,
but the R5 is already computing the jump and will get us out. ETA ten seconds.
next to the female pilot floating and spinning in the endless space, he quickly
checked if Amara and baron were covering his six. Both Starfighters were there, loyally screening him from enemy TIEs.
opened and air was sucked out of the cockpit, Kai deeply exhaled. It was counter-intuitive
to do so, because he was about to struggle for every tiny portion of oxygen he
could muster… but if he wouldn’t exhale, that expanding air would rupture his
lungs and release air into the circulatory system.

column2: <em>Stars… what a cold!</em> As he started to lose consciousness, he felt as

column1: his skin and tissue underneath began to swell, as the water in his body started
to vaporize in the absence of atmospheric pressure. The last thing he
remembered was bubbling on his tongue as the moisture on it begun to boil…

Jessa still could not believe the balls on her wingman but pushed all thoughts aside.

""Damn it!"" she cursed as she took another spin around her axis. Kai has parked a bit too far away so the girl had to catch the x-wing with her foot to stop her rotation. The second attempt was a success and the girl's magboots sucked to the hull. ""Quick quick quick"" she told herself as she squeezed into the cockpit, lying sideways next to her rescuer. Pulling the canopy shut above her, the girl jelled ""R5 repressurize!"" but the second the canopy closed Kai's trusty droid began the procedure already.

The position in which the Mandalorian found herself was highly uncomfortable but probably far better than what Kai would feel once he regained consciousness. From his perspective, she was to his right side, half lying on the side console. Her legs pushed against the front glass to stabilize and her body was bent in such a way that she snuggled tight against the man.

Jessa decided that it would be best to keep her helmet on, despite her feeling highly claustrophobic in this position. She dad two reasons for her decision. The first was that she thought it might help the life support of the T-65 to cope with two pilots better, if one was only using up a minimal amount of O2. The second and currently much more serious reason was the fact that her head was right next to Kai's. Without her helmet, not only would he have her breathing down his neck but also see her face that currently she was still too ashamed to show. 

The seconds passed and the pressure within the cabin was nominal again. Jessa carefully studied the pilot next to her in an attempt to see if he was waking up again. Pulling off one of her gloves, she hastily felt for a pulse on his neck, being relieved of finding one.

""R5, patch me into squad frequency"" Jessa ordered the droid. The misgiving peeps made it clear that this R5 was less than happy for his master to have risked his well-being for her. Nevertheless he complied.

""This is Apex Six aboard Apex Three. We are both alive but currently sitting ducks. Three is still unconscious but even awake he would not be able to fly this bird. Be advised, jump calculations are running.""  

""C'mon Three wake up!"" she said after a moment, giving his helm a little bump with her own. ""No time to sleep now! I doubt you can fly with me in here but I would feel worlds better if I could hear your voice right now... you can shout at me all you want... just wake up... k?""

She gently squeezed his arm, noticing that the regular body temperature was beginning to flow back into the outer skin layers. As his arm was floating freely, the girl noticed something peculiar.

""Interesting tattoo..."" she whispered to herself, wondering about its meaning. It was the first time she had seen such a tattoo but her imagination quickly figured out a scenario for which a bar-code would be utilized in this world. 

 ""Guess we have pleanty of time to chat during hyperspace..."" she said, not expecting a reply

column2: Major Lomax rushed to the bridge of transport ship, fresh from battle, his face sooted black from explosions on the station: “What’s the hold-up?! Why the heck are we not gone already?” Captain turned to him, obviously irritated: “Flying through hyperspace is no that simple, soldier. Without precise calculations we could fly right through some star or bounce too close to a supernova! Baking us crispy would end our trip real quick, wouldn’t it?” Lomax was irritated as well and yelled in answer: “We are sitting ducks here!” Captain shrugged: “That can’t be helped. We still need some calculating time, more precisely… specialist?” “One minute and fifty seconds… mark now, sir.” Lomax nodded: “Understood.” He pulled out his comlink and activated it: “Vallis? Are you boys ready?” Answer came immediately: “Yes, sir! All the explosives left at critical machinery parts are armed and ready to blow on your command, sir.” Lomax quickly checked his chrono and then said simply: “Light it up, Vallis.” “Aye aye, sir! With pleasure!”
Apex Heavy is ready to jump away!

At the bridge of the Huntress, indicators on the panel turned green and Lieutenant turned to his Captain with a palpable relief in his voice: “All batteries are powered up and ready, sir!” Verenz smiled coldly: “Open fire, Lieutenant! Stop it from jumping to hyperspace!” “Sir, yes, sir!”

Rebel ship quaked under the Imperial fire. On the bridge, Major Lomax had to hold on the one of control panels and few of the crewmen looked scared, but the Captain of the ship looked unimpressed: “This is all they got? They can’t possibly chew through our shields and armor in the time they got. We can take much more punishment than they can throw in our direction.” He turned to one of the crewmen: “I am going to be in my dayroom, writing After Action Report. Damn doom of this Navy, the paperwork. Send some coffee my way, it will be a long night for me.” He turned and calmly left the bridge, showing nothing but contempt for the Imperial barrage. His unwavering confidence was contagious and Rebels on the bridge started to smile and grin...
Mante quickly punched his controls and turned to face the A-wing. “This is how it is done, you insurgent amateur!”

Amara winced as she saw Syrush's X-Wing burst into flames. She didn't have time to see if the Commander ejected safely. ""Attention all callsigns Apex, we have lost One. I am taking command of the squadron. Abort attacks and pair up in defensive formations around the transport, jump as soon as you are able. My R5 is done, and about to blast me off on his own if I don't comply, so I'll see you all back at base. Don't get dead, or I'll reverse-haunt your ghosts. Two out.""

And with that Apex Two's Y-Wing raced off into hyper-space, leaving behind a few bits of debris and a cloud of freezing smoke.

Relieved at the fact that her savior had regained consciousness, the young girl smiled under her helmet. 

""Yeah you saved my ass! But we are not out of the woods yet! I know you must be hurting but while you were out, we got hit badly... I was afraid i would break the cockpit glass with my boots due to the shocks so i had to... uhm... get a bit closer... sorry..."" she said. ""Shields are down and the alarms you must be hearing tell you that we got another hit in... We wont survive a third but here comes the good news... Jump prep is completed and we are pretty much out of here... if the enemy does not get a shot on us until then!""

She paused and gave Kai a moment to regain his faculties. 

""If you can reach the left front pocket on my chest harness... there is a hypo in there that might help against some of the pain... its a stim that i carry in case of injury... old mandalorian recipe... my last one. Use it and try to make us a harder target to hit if you can."" the girl added with a worried tone in her voice.

Unable to properly look her comrade up and down due to the cramped nature of their situation, Jessa asked ""How... how do you feel? I seriously still cannot believe that you did that... You have a serious set of balls...""

column1:
After repositioning herself to sit on the man's lap, the absurdity of the situation slowly hit the young girl. ""This is all sorts of wrong... I dont want this... but again i cannot change anything...fuck fuck fuck..."" she thought, trying to give Kai as much space to steer the craft as possible. Without her armor she would easily fit on his lap and give him enough of space to see and move...but then again her armor was the only thing that had kept her alive so far... and was the only thing separating her from the man in front of her. 

""Engage magnetic locks"" Jessa muttered and the tiny magnetic clamps in her armor clamped shut. It was a voice imprinted security feature usually only used in battle to prevent an enemy from prying a warrior from his or her armor... but right now Jessa needed this extra layer of protection to keep her sanity. 

""Sorry but I am making myself as small as possible... the armor wont allow for anything else. just tell me where to move and I'll do so."" she informed Kai with a flicker of fear in her voice. 

She then slowly reached for her pocket. The new position she was in allowed her to move a bit better but she still was barely able to get what she wanted. ""C'mon...c'mon..."" Jessa strained herself and finally reached the hypo in her pocket. she popped the protective cap off the instrument and warned Kai ""These things are made for Mandalorians... you aint a Mandalorian... but our physiology should be close enough... just as a warning tho.... this will feel... weird at first... from the point of injection you will feel heat radiating through your body and after some seconds... once it reaches your heart... you will feel like you just had 200 cups of coffee... If we make it... go to the medbay afterwards... would suggest it to you anyways... let them give you some Adrenalin blockers... but for now... get ready for the trip of your life..."" with that the girl jabbed the hypo into Kais neck, injecting the stim cocktail directly into his bloodstream. 

With this issue out of the way, Jessa's mind now raced to figure out the best way of providing space and visibility to her pilot. ""This sucks so bad... fuck... i dont want to... but i also prefer living... fuck..."" the girl thought but forced herself to move closer to Kai, being careful not to hurt him with her movements. She then passed her helmet past the side of his and hugged him. She was now literally lying on him, her feet between his on the pedals and her chest on his with her head next to his., looking like some kind of cliche space lovers. 

""If you ever mention this to somebody... I swear to my ancestors... that this hypo wont be the last thing i stabbed you with... now please... get us home safe.. yeah?"" she said with a trembling voice.

Smoke was quickly leaking into the cockpit. Vernons head was light and everything was turning. B4 was beeping like crazy.

""I hear you... robot... give me some time. Comm... communication is out. Controls out...""

""what is that beep in the background... oh... we are targeted... I should do something...""

He managed to put on breathing apparatus, but gas poisoning was already slowing him down. Apex heavy was close. Maybe catapult could save him...

First laser shots penetrated hull of x-wing. B4 became suddenly silent. Vernon was bleeding from multiple wounds... He pulled catapult lever...
dice roll

column1:
His plan was partly successful. The arrogant fool was finally concentrating his efforts on Borun, but the damage was done. Around him, his comrades in arms are preparing their flight or dying. 

There was nothing to gain in dying, so he tries to excape his enemy and placing a thorn in his side which could fester and weaken him for the next time he flew against rebels.

But first, shaking off the Leader was paramount to any further actions...
dice roll

Shaking the TIE with a minimal twist on the rudder, the A-Wing flies shortly with it, using the solar panels as anchor for a fast spiral around it.

""Seemingly, this was the best you had to offer, tadpole. Taking on weak enemies is easy, you wouldn't have tried to get me tailing if I had shown a better try. In fact, you fell into it without targetting any of my comrades - just like a tadpole.""

Eyeing the progress marker of the claculation, he let a final sentence cross the Outer Sea:

""We have reached our goal, the rest of us is swimming home. You were too late and too weak, tadpole. But be sure the currents will let us meet again and then you'll see what I can do with despite your very best efforts.

Your defeat will be no honor, tadpo-""

His timing almost correct, Borun's sentence was cut short by the jump to fast speed...

Calculate hyperspace jump [2/2]

Mante was listening to Borun's broadcast, as he was trying to keep himself on his tail and anger was rising in him. Cocky bastard! He moved to pursue him, with intention to get on his tail and cut his annoying chatter short by few cluster missiles.

Although he might not have been a typical imperial, he still wasn't the type to interrupt someone when speaking - because that would be uncivilised. However, he didn't get an opportunity to reply anything, as Borun and rest of their enemies have just jumped to hyperspace.

How rude! Coward.

Mante was fuming, but he tried to calm himself down. It was just an annoying fly, nothing else. He wasn't a significant threat during the mission and all enemies have been crippled or destroyed. Don't give into his taunts Mante, you're better than that.

Mission was accomplished, although their enemies have regretfully retreated. They have intercepted the attack and pushed them back before more damage was done and he had to be satisfied with that. His thoughts have, however, still remained with the quarren pilot. He certainly could appreciate someone's skills or attitude, even if he was an enemy - but only thing he managed was pissing him off.

column4: 4 pilots died (from which one was murdered by Jessa after ejecting),

column3: Baron Vernon Syrush - 1 kill this mission (Kappa Eight), 10 kills in total
Amara Kariya - 1 kill this mission (Apex Six), 2.5 kills in total
Kai Acheron - 3 kills this mission (Kappa Three, Kappa Six, Scourge Three), 5.5 kills in total
Borun Berir - 2 kills this mission (Kappa Seven, Kappa Nine), 5.5 kills in total
Neve Kurp - 3.5 kills this mission (Kappa Two, Kappa Ten, Kappa Eleven, Scourge Six’s shields), 7.5 kills in total
Jessa Daeh - 5 kills this mission (Kappa Leader, Kappa Four, Kappa Five, Kappa Twelve, Scourge Four), 8 kills in total

column1: Baron (should he be still alive), Amara, Kai, Borun and Neve can add 1 point to any of their skills. Sorry guys, it seems most of you are half a kill short from another. Jessa can add 3 points to her skills.

column2: Borun Berir, Neve Kurp, Kai Acheron and Jessa Daeh will be awarded Star of Alderaan for their achievements.

Commander Syrush will be awarded posthumous Corellian Cross for his achievements, as he's presumed dead.

It's time for the base phase!

column1:
As the stars stretched into bright lines, Kai let go of the controls and opened his visor to get few centimetres of space more. He was uncomfortably cramped in cockpit with Jessa... and he would prefer to be light years away from her now. He had to save her... because she was his responsibility... but what she did during the mission... how could she? He felt betrayed, ashamed for her actions and limitlessly sad. The girl was natural in cockpit... but how could they keep flying together, when he could not trust her anymore? She had blood on her hands... figuratively and literally... for Force's sake! They sat in silence and helmet that shielded her face provided no answers.

He could not stay silent anymore. He needed to know: ""Why, Jessa? Why would you do that? You killed a pilot who could not fight back... that is not war. That is murder."" There was anguish in his eyes... he hoped... he prayed that she could say something... anything... that would make it better... but he wasn't sure she could...

He needed to know: <strong>""<em>Why</em>, Jessa? Why would you do that? You killed a pilot who could not fight back... that is not war. That is <em>murder</em>.""</strong> There was anguish in his eyes... he hoped... he prayed that she could say something... <em>anything</em>... that would make it better... but he wasn't sure she could...</p>

Kai's reaction was quite different from Amara's, catching the young girl off guard.

""You would not understand even if I tried to explain it.. i'm not even sure i understand it myself... but after the little chat I had with the captain... I do regret my actions..."" the girl said from under her helmet. ""I had planned to give the man a proper burial at least but that plan went out of the window, the second the imperial reinforcements arrived... Did not see his body after I started from the station..."" she added. 

After a silence that seemed to stretch on for what felt like eternity, Jessa took off her helmet, placing it on Kai's lap, as that was the only place with room. Her face was sweaty, grimy and her eyes were red. Had she been crying? She would not tell. 

Mustering all her courage, she looked the man in the eyes and said ""I told the captain already... I do my job, i kill imperials... how or with what i did not care... she was right telling me that my past experience had turned me into nothing more than an animal and that i had to chose if that was what i wanted to be... I do not regret killing a man... or an imperial... i regret that he could not fight back... that will not happen again...I might not fully agree with how you rebels do things but... "" she cut herself off there, taking a deep breath. The air in the cockpit already started to taste stale as the life support struggled to feed enough O² into the cockpit.

""Punish me as you see fit... but don't question my loyalty to my brothers in arms... I would die for any single one of you... tho I would prefer not having to... especially for that blue menace int he boring fighter..."" Jessa said before putting her helmet back on.

""Better air that way"" she noted and remained silent for a while. 

Then out of nowhere she added with a somewhat shy voice that could either be fake or real ""You know... you do look kinda cute when you are angry Kai... and you have real pretty eyes...""

""Why are you all so fucking nice to me..."" Jessa replied, her voice clearly breaking now. ""How can you ever forgive what I did? I know i wont... Maybe it would have been better if you would have left me back there... don't get me wrong Kai... I want to live! I really do... I miss my family and hope to see them again once the time comes but... I feel I need to set things right here first... There are things I need to do and... yes... people to kill... not those who did things to me... but those who would do it to others... What you said reminded me so much of my dad... Be the sword and shield of those too weak to fight... he always... "" at this point a wave of shivers went through the girl as she cried silently under her helmet. 

After swallowing hard she continued ""He always tried protecting others... and well... to fight the biggest, meanest bad-ass in the room... but that was the mandalorian in him..."" she chuckled sadly at the memory before adding with determination in her voice. ""If you land this bird in one piece i will report my transgression to the commodore myself... I do not want the captain or you to get into trouble for me... we all have to write a report and while i can see the quarren to help you... that blue bastard never would, making you complicit... no..."" she shook her head ""I will take what comes my way and fight through whatever comes... I need to do this... otherwise I could never look in a mirror again... not that there are many back at base anyways... kind of a pain to brush your teeth or hair without one... you guys have it easier...""  

Jessa put her hand on Kai's shoulder before saying ""Get us home... yes?""

He smiled: ""If we land safely, you won't stand alone, kid."" He used that ""kid"" part naturally, not realising at first that it was Epp who used to call him that. Loud alarm reminded them that they were about to arrive in the Askella system. Long bright lines shrinked back to the stars: ""Here we go...""

column5: Friday evening - Green Papaya Thai Restaurant near Fawcett City College campus
column6:
Sylvia,

It's ten past seven and Alex is running late. She set this up, asking you to meet her for dinner at the same place where you had your ""first date"". She seemed eager for this, but now, she isn't here. Her shift was supposed to end at five. It's a half hour drive from her place to here. She hasn't responded to your texts.

Was she bringing her son to this, or is it just the two of you?

Do you grab a table or stick around just inside the restaurant or what?

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-325370""><div class=""row"">

Ten past is basically not late in most parts of the world, and Alex has been the Queen of Distracted and Busy, so this hardly registers, except..she did seem pretty invested in this date. It's a return to our first date spot.

And she did offer to bring along Scotty, and I accepted. I mean, why not meet the little man? I'm curious what sort of kid he is so far, and if I want to get serious with Alex, he'll be a part of my life. Plus seeing her with her son is bound to be cute.

I check my watch again. Even allowing for a full 30 min to her home from work and then back here..that's an hour to catch up with her son and change clothes. Usually I can get a short response over text if she's work-busy.

I've grabbed a table, but now I'm scrolling through a few local hashtags on Chirper to see if there's anything big going on in the city. I'm probably just stressing.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Ten past is basically not late in most parts of the world, and Alex has been the Queen of Distracted and Busy, so this hardly registers, except..she did seem pretty <em>invested</em> in this date. It's a return to our first date spot.</p><p>And she <em>did</em> offer to bring along Scotty, and I accepted. I mean, why not meet the little man? I'm curious what sort of kid he is so far, and if I want to get serious with Alex, he'll be a part of my life. Plus seeing her with her son is bound to be cute.</p><p>I check my watch again. Even allowing for a full 30 min to her home from work and then back here..that's an hour to catch up with her son and change clothes. Usually I can get a short response over text if she's work-busy.</p><p>I've grabbed a table, but now I'm scrolling through a few local hashtags on Chirper to see if there's anything big going on in the city. I'm probably just stressing.</p>

Two minutes later and the front door to Green Papaya swings open. In walks Alex in a nice yellow summer dress with spaghetti straps that show off her lovely shoulders and don't hide her cybernetic arm, and cute strappy sandals. You also notice a sizeable dark stain near her right breast, it looks fresh. It's in the shape of a handprint. A small one.

Holding her fleshy hand is a very cute young boy with dark hair like his mother, long with bangs that threaten to hide his bright eyes but doesn't quite. He's ten, and he's adorable in his crisp jeans and his Dragonball Z t-shirt. He looks around the place with wonder in his eyes, seeking out interesting things.

Alex sees you and seems worried about your reaction. She walks quickly over, and Scotty follows. ""Syl, I'm so sorry, we had an emergency thing, and well, I'm here."" Are you a hug-hello couple?

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Two minutes later and the front door to Green Papaya swings open. In walks Alex in a nice yellow summer dress with spaghetti straps that show off her lovely shoulders and don't hide her cybernetic arm, and cute strappy sandals. You also notice a sizeable dark stain near her right breast, it looks fresh. It's in the shape of a handprint. A small one.</p><p>Holding her fleshy hand is a very cute young boy with dark hair like his mother, long with bangs that threaten to hide his bright eyes but doesn't quite. He's ten, and he's adorable in his crisp jeans and his Dragonball Z t-shirt. He looks around the place with wonder in his eyes, seeking out interesting things.</p><p>Alex sees you and seems worried about your reaction. She walks quickly over, and Scotty follows. <strong>""Syl, I'm so sorry, we had an emergency thing, and well, I'm here.""</strong> Are you a hug-hello couple?</p>

Oh hey I forgot to mention I'm wearing a pretty simple ombre-dyed pink dress with iridescent white leggings and a deeper magenta shrug.

I look up from my phone and smile, relieved. ""Alex! Don't worry about it, I was on Brazilian time, so you're basically early."" Sometimes we hug-hello, sometimes we don't. I think this greeting calls for a hug, though, and I give her a good squeeze. ""I'm happy to see you.""

I'll bend down a bit for Scotty's benefit and meet his eyes. ""And you must be Scotty! It's good to finally meet you."" I see he's a discerning martial arts fan already, good, good.

column2: ""Hi there!"" Scotty replies, his voice rising with excitement. ""You're a gymnast? Can you walk on your hands?""
<strong>""Hi there!""</strong> Scotty replies, his voice rising with excitement. <strong>""You're a gymnast? Can you walk on your hands?""</strong>

column1: ""She can't do that here, Scotty."" Alex says with a laugh as she pulls out a chair, ""Come on, big man, have a seat, ok?"" Scotty ambles over to sit in the chair, and she scoots it forward under the table. ""You look great, Syl, I love that dress."" She has a seat across from you, her right arm (her flesh arm) nearest Scotty.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><strong>""She can't do that here, Scotty.""</strong> Alex says with a laugh as she pulls out a chair, <strong>""Come on, big man, have a seat, ok?""</strong> Scotty ambles over to sit in the chair, and she scoots it forward under the table. <strong>""You look great, Syl, I love that dress.""</strong> She has a seat across from you, her right arm (her flesh arm) nearest Scotty.</p>

I give him a big grin. ""I am a gymnast, and I can walk my hands. Maybe I'll show you after dinner."" If I do, I should show him some simple, low-risk stuff he can try, too. Kids like to imitate.

""Thank you, you too. I love the color, and I hardly ever see anyone wear it. Less as well as you do."" I return to my seat and offer to take anything she's carrying and set it next to me on the unused chair.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I give him a big grin. ""<strong>I <em>am</em> a gymnast, and I can walk my hands. Maybe I'll show you after dinner.</strong>"" If I do, I should show him some simple, low-risk stuff he can try, too. Kids like to imitate.</p><p>""<strong>Thank you, you too. I love the color, and I hardly ever see anyone wear it. Less as well as you do.</strong>"" I return to my seat and offer to take anything she's carrying and set it next to me on the unused chair.</p>

Scotty's head swivels up to gape at his mom when she sits down, ""I told you! She can walk on her hands! I WANT TO WALK ON MY HANDS!"" He grabs the base of his seat and bounces a little with excitement, then looks back at you with wide eyes like you're a celebrity.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p><img src=""https://i.imgur.com/LQB47lr.jpg?1"" style='font-family: Verdana, ""Helvetica Neue"", sans-serif; font-size: 13px; width: 100px;'></p><p>Scotty's head swivels up to gape at his mom when she sits down, <strong>""I told you! She can walk on her hands! I WANT TO WALK ON MY HANDS!""</strong> He grabs the base of his seat and bounces a little with excitement, then looks back at you with wide eyes like you're a celebrity.</p>

Alex smiles at your compliment, but her eyes dip down to look at the stain, ""Thanks, Syl, it's one of my favorite dresses."" She grabs a menu, putting it in front of Scotty, ""We'll talk about hand walking later, right now, let's figure out what you want to eat, alright?"" 

You watch as they work through the menu with Scotty asking questions about almost every item, Alex answering patiently and with enthusiasm. She steers him away from ""hot stuff"", and when the waiter comes over, she asks a few questions about items on the blackboard and pulls you into the chatter, ""What are you having, Syl?""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Alex smiles at your compliment, but her eyes dip down to look at the stain, <strong>""Thanks, Syl, it's one of my favorite dresses.""</strong> She grabs a menu, putting it in front of Scotty, <strong>""We'll talk about hand walking later, right now, let's figure out what you want to eat, alright?""</strong> </p><p>You watch as they work through the menu with Scotty asking questions about almost every item, Alex answering patiently and with enthusiasm. She steers him away from ""hot stuff"", and when the waiter comes over, she asks a few questions about items on the blackboard and pulls you into the chatter, <strong>""What are you having, Syl?""</strong></p>

I bite my lip a little at the connection between the ink stain and this being one of her favorite dresses. I don't want to belabor that point, so I move on. Hopefully some oxy will get it out.

Watching them together? I was totally right, it's adorable. ""I'm getting a green curry with chicken, I think. Here they make it with eggplant, carrots, and cauliflower."" I add for Scotty's benefit. ""How about you?""

""That sounds amazing!"" Scotty says excitedly. ""Mom, I want what Syl's eating, okay? Can I have green curries and chickens?""

column2: ""Sure, Scotty, that's fine,"" Alex agrees, adding, ""Curry has a little kick to it. Might make your nose run,"" she warns. Scotty makes a yuck face and puts his hand over his nose as if it might be running right now, but he seems steadfast on having what you're having, Trace.
The waiter comes by to get your order, Alex asks for some Prig Keing, with a mix of chicken and pork.

column1:
After the waiter leaves, you make a little small talk with Alex, she apologizes for being absent lately, explaining that she's working a case related to that downtown bar and Thaddeus Sivana, Jr.

That's when Scotty jumps in like he's missed everything his mom has said, and says to you, ""I googled you! You and some other heroes fought Mister Atom! The-the video didn't show much, did you punch him right in his robot mouth?!?""

You and some other heroes fought Mister Atom! The-the video didn't show much, did you punch him right in his robot mouth?!?""</strong></p>

Good lad, you have to start eating spicy food sometime. The waiter seemed to pick up what Alex was putting down about 'kick', too

""Whoah, there's video? Mister Atom was pretty tough, my teammate Oliver took him out with some help from Dawn. I punched him right in his robot, uh, ankle, I guess?"" I scratch the side of my cheek, a little embarrassed to remember it. I'm pretty sure I know how to make that strike work, it would just take a year of training..

Funny part about sliding from martial arts to super heroics - in the martial arts world, saying that out loud would be an unconscionable boast. People would pick fights with me about it. In super land, people would ask 'why a whole year?'.

""That seems like it'd be a long-burning case, somehow.."" The Sivanas are so connected in Fawcett City, if Alex wants to make an arrest, her case will have to be rock-solid.

Alex sighs and nods, ""My peers are telling me I'm crazy for trying to build it. There are longboxes full of half-done case files in storage. None of them go to trial. This city needs someone to take them down.""

column1: ""Haha, I think your mom's a better fit for that fight, Scotty. These guys usually don't tear up downtown in big robots. But if she needs some extra help, I'm ready for a team-up anytime."" That's about the best I can do for talking about the realities of the crimes of the powerful with a 10 year old on no notice.

But if she needs some <em>extra help</em>, I'm ready for a team-up anytime.</strong>"" That's about the best I can do for talking about the realities of the crimes of the powerful with a 10 year old on no notice.</p>

""If they used giant robots, it would be much easier to arrest them."" Alex says. Then she thinks better of it, ""Or, well, it would be easier for Trace to punch them in their mouth, and I'd arrest them when they're knocked out. We'd be a great team, wouldn't we?""

""Yes you would! Trace and mom!"" He throws his fist in the air, some people nearby look over, curious what's going on. Alex looks at you with a wistful smile for just a moment before she settles back into her Gotham ""mask"".

I let out a chuckle and smile. ""We should work on that."" I give Alex a sneaky wink.

""But, you know, most of what I'm doing right now is school stuff. Classes, teaching assistance, and training at Five Fires."" I scratch the back of my head a little. ""And my friend Oliver is working on a new costume for me."" Which means the patrols I go on until he's done are gonna be kinda awkward.

""Oh, the old one is toast, and I thiiiink my biggest fans are pretty harmless.."" I'm not gonna name names..

Scotty's description brings to mind some kind of hachimaki-wearing yankee girl-ganger version of myself and it's very amusing.

""You can draw one, but no skulls. I like rabbits and butterflies."" I ignore the tattoos comment for now because if I even faked some, my mom and my Grandma Nakano would immediately be up my nose about it. Like they'll probably be in private if they ever meet Alex. Well..mom is loose enough to understand that it means something different for Alex, but o-ba-san is not.

""For le parkour, I like to wear something baggy over something tight - that way when I land in motion, I don't get burned by the fabric. Kneepads are good protection, too. Do you play any sports, Scotty?""

He's still working through the idea when you ask him about sports that he plays. He brightens, ""I love soccer! And baseball, too. And-and basketball. There's a court near our house, but lots of big kids play there and I never get any time. And I had to leave my teams in Gotham. I was on the Robins soccer team and we were the best! And our baseball team was the Ace Chemical Reds, we had a really cool uniform, and our coach bought us hoodies!""

""Nice, I like soccer, too."" I smile and listen to his story of his teams back home. Soccer didn't turn out to be 'my sport', but hey, I found other stuff to do somehow. I tuck into my curry, quiet for a minute or two myself.

""Mm, very good. How's yours, Alex? Scotty?""

They both look up from their plates to look at you and agree with twin enthusiastic nods. Scotty quickly ducks back down to eat, but pauses for a huge drink of water, sniffling at the heat that's made his nose run. Alex grabs her napkin and dabs at his nose, which makes him more than a little embarrassed, but he keeps eating.

I have another bite and make a big shrug motion, swallow. ""Whenever it's ready. Oliver's got classes and things so I'm not going to hurry him. I might make do with some old tights and training clothes until then. We've got some team org stuff to keep us at least a little busy until we're on the streets again.""

I soak some rice in the curry sauce and then have a bite of it.

As you're chewing the spicy deliciousness, Alex takes a sip of her drink, then asks, ""Have you considered armor? More than kneepads, some flexible kevlar or reactive cloth? You're really putting yourself at risk out there, Syl."" 

There's the sound of a police siren just outside, like a patrol car just now turned it on. You see the car speed past, and Alex's eyes widen, immediately slipping into ""work mode"" as she pulls out her phone to check for what might be happening.

What do you do?

After a quick swallow and a dab at my mouth with my napkin, I start to answer Alex. ""Ehh, the best defense is not getting hit, but I get where you're coming from..a big barrier is that stuff is expensive, and then I have to train in it..""

I trail off as the noise and the police car zooms past the restaurant. After a moment of watching Alex shift from 'here' to 'not-here'. I reach out and put a hand on her arm and say, gently but firmly. ""Let them handle it for at least ten minutes. Your department has your number.""

Stops moving for a moment, then she clicks the button on the side of her phone to put it back to sleep, and sits back. ""Right. Ten minutes."" She nods, it's such a reflex for her, to put everything aside for ""the job"", this is foreign territory. ""I'm sure they've got it...""

Scotty beams, the comment is perfect to take the wind out of his sails and bring him to this moment. For a moment, at least. He makes a face, then whispers, ""Mom, don't let Abuela hear you say that!""

I scratch my cheek a bit and grin, looking back into Alex's eyes. ""You're amazing, so let some other people make a few arrests, too."" Aaaaaa I'm a favorite people.

I'm about to be the spitting image of my mom, ready to tell Scotty 'Once it's in your mouth I don't want to see that food again', but his Abuela whispering throws me off. ""Ahh, you know..people can surprise you. My O-ba-san Nakano back in Japan has a little rainbow flag she keeps by my picture, and my Grandpa Hawthorne back in Houston pretends I've never had anybody special in my life."" I shrug a little.

""If he doesn't want to meet my favorite people, his loss.""

Alex's expression shifts from amused at the thought of other cops making arrests and your compliment that seems to touch her deeply, to a soft happiness at your O-ba-san's flag, to a tight, disappointed look about your grandpa. She slips a hand to touch yours in sympathy.

Scott tilts his head to the side when you talk about your Grandpa Hawthorne and Houston pretending you have nobody special, like the explanation is all wrong, or confusing or something. He shakes his head, ""Abuela knows Mom likes girls, Trace. She'll be mad if she hears Mom calling me and you her favorites... and not saying she is, too!"" He grins, ""She's really picky about that stuff."" 

After a moment of consideration, he leans really far over the table to put his hand over his mother's, the one that's on yours. ""You can be a favorite, though. I'll tell her it's okay."" 

Take Influence over Scotty (as if there was any doubt).

I'm melting! Oh what a world, what a world, my heart is melting. Ahem, okay. I give Alex's hand a squeeze and smile.

""Haha, okay, I'll try to remember that she's particular about it.""

The meal continues a little longer before Alex checks her phone. Evidently, her peers were able to take care of the issue because she relaxes and puts her phone away. Scotty starts telling you about his school, in excruciating detail. The meal ends with Scotty telling you the Marvel Elementary School song, which he seems reluctant to actually sing.

When Alex takes the check, do you let her?

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>The meal continues a little longer before Alex checks her phone. Evidently, her peers were able to take care of the issue because she relaxes and puts her phone away. Scotty starts telling you about his school, in excruciating detail. The meal ends with Scotty telling you the Marvel Elementary School song, which he seems reluctant to actually sing.</p><p>When Alex takes the check, do you let her?</p>

I'm sporting about Scotty's school stories, even if they're boring at their core to me. I try to flip it around a little for myself and think about where his perspective comes from and it's a little more interesting to listen to, and I don't force him to sing the school song, by any means.

When Alex takes the check, I raise a brow with a quick ""Okay, but the next one is mine.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>I'm sporting about Scotty's school stories, even if they're boring at their core to me. I try to flip it around a little for myself and think about where his perspective comes from and it's a little more interesting to listen to, and I <em>don't</em> force him to sing the school song, by any means.</p><p>When Alex takes the check, I raise a brow with a quick ""<strong>Okay, but the next one is mine.</strong>""</p>

Alex gives you a grin and nods agreement. When you all get up from the table, Scotty grabs his mom's hand, and they walk towards the exit. When Scotty comes by you, Trace, he reaches out and snags your hand with his free one, tugging at you to come along with them.

End Scene

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Alex gives you a grin and nods agreement. When you all get up from the table, Scotty grabs his mom's hand, and they walk towards the exit. When Scotty comes by you, Trace, he reaches out and snags your hand with his free one, tugging at you to come along with them.</p><p>End Scene</p>
Back to Top

column3: DDAL05-01 Treasure of the Broken Hoard Mission 3. Against the Frost

column1:
One of the most famous treasure hunters in the Realms, Veradda Stoor, has put out a call for assistance in tracking down caches of treasure hidden by the now-defunct Cult of the Dragon in the Greypeak Mountains. Through luck, skill, and the intervention of your faction, you have been chosen to assist her. You were told to meet her in a clearing along the Black Road, east of the village of Parnast. 

Your trip along the Black Road showed signs of goblin presence, but has otherwise been uneventful. Other travelers you met claimed to have seen evidence of giant activity: runecovered boulders, huge footprints, and missing livestock. You saw none of that evidence, however. Maybe it was just the overactive imagination of scared farmers and merchants?

When you reach the rendezvous point, Veradda Stoor is nowhere to be found. Countless footprints of various sizes, and lots of bloodstains, mar the ground. A search of the area ultimately turns up the body of your would-be employer, several-hours dead from a variety of wounds. What is left of her equipment is scattered around the clearing. A large tome holding her notes is open on the ground near her body. The last several pages have been torn out. Still you are able to piece together this information: 

The First Cache

    The first treasure cache was hidden by the Cult of the Dragon in an abandoned cave at the base at of the southernmost mountain in the Greypeak range. While it was thought to be the smallest of the caches, it is also not thought to be protected by any traps or magic. The caves and tunnels of the complex, according to my sources, are not very structurally sound. Goblins are known to inhabit the area.

    The Second Cache

    My sources confirmed that one cache was buried beneath a unique structure: a pyramid of stone resting on a flat field of stone in the middle section of the Greypeaks, directly between the two highest mountains of that section of the range. The area was once rent with volcanic activity, making the flat stone field difficult to navigate. My sources could not tell me who or what built the boulder pyramid.

    The Third Cache

    The source I questioned about this cache said that it was carefully hidden behind a secret entrance in the wall of a green-sided mountain. There is only one of those in the Greypeak range, according to my research. The source also said that the cultist who hid the treasure was an expert in magical curses.

    The Fourth Cache

    This cache was secured in an abandoned dwarven outpost used for treating ore that was being prepared for use in weapon-smithing. My sources implied that the place had been overrun by something terrible and immortal, causing the dwarves to leave it centuries ago. Subterranean volcanic activity has been reported in the area regularly over the years.

    The Fifth Cache

    At the top of the tallest summit of the Greypeaks, one contact told me that there is an abandoned shrine once revered by giants. Dragons used the area as a perch since then, and a cache is going to be hidden there. Someone also told me that occasionally, when the wind is blowing in just the right direction, a pealing of loud bell can be heard from there.

Veradda Stoor’s notes lead you to a narrow path halfway up a mountain in the northern Greypeaks. You stand on the path, looking down over a cliff to your right, the sheer wall of the mountain to your left. There is no obvious opening in the wall.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Veradda Stoor’s notes lead you to a narrow path halfway up a mountain in the northern Greypeaks. You stand on the path, looking down over a cliff to your right, the sheer wall of the mountain to your left. There is no obvious opening in the wall.</p>

Maple looked out over the view, her back to the sheer cliff. She hoped her companions for this part of the task, would be the others she had recently worked with. They were all quite talented, and did not seem to mind that she preferred to use her strength and sword over uselessly searching for clues.
dice roll

On the far side of the room is a three-foot-tall pedestal, and atop the pedestal rests a giant diamond. The diamond gleams with an inner light that is definitely supernatural.

column4:
Aszhe is tired and already hungry as she leads the covered wagon away from the camp and into the dark. A stab of pain to her  bicep brings a rush of adrenaline and then the message delivered through the bee sting slowly unravels in her mind:

Azshara Sylris,

We have not formally met, but I’ve heard a great deal about you from my brother, Axion 
Quellyn, who was quite fond of you. My hope is that we can meet as I could benefit from your
wisdom, and perhaps your devotion to the god of the sea and wind Njord, to help solve an

column1: enigma we are experiencing in the Iron Sea.  After working for the Queen in Drakkenhall, my
belief is that this enigma may be related to my diplomatic work in that city.

At this time, I am in New Port and heading down to Santa Cora, as I have heard that that is 
where your ship the Larkspur is currently docked.  I realize that my missive might be 
considered a bit inappropriate, but I fear that if I hesitate the Queendom may be in jeopardy.  I 
look forward to meeting you in person so that we may have a more detailed conversation.  I 
shall be in Santa Cora soon and will be staying at The Glen, an inn often frequented by those 
from the Wood. 

Yours humbly,
Elias Quelynn

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-331783""><div class=""row"">

As soon as she feels the sting, Azsh quickly and gently plucks the bee out of the air and mutters a quick heal to restore its stinger and keep it from dying. A little side project she and Yonur had explored during cleric training involved rescuing and reusing messenger bees. While they had become pretty skilled at catching and healing the bees, composing replies was still a...work in progress.

Azsh concentrated on the bee and attempted to magically impart a short message.

""C U @ Outpt Omega or Sta Cora!""

She knew it was rudimentary but hoped it was enough to get the message across without Elias thinking her a total idiot. Once composed, she gently blew on the bee, and it shook itself and flew out of her hand.

column3: [Celeste] W1N4 Trouble on the Homefront

column4: Celeste is back in her penthouse in Downtown Minneapolis.  Henrietta and a few ghouls seem to be around.  There appears to be a dead body, you recognize it as one of your ghouls.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-325386""><div class=""row"">
""Princess, we have a problem..."", says Henrietta.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Princess, we have a problem..."", says Henrietta.</p>
""It wasn't me this time, I swear!"", says Vandal.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""It wasn't me this time, I swear!"", says Vandal.</p>
""Looks like I get to play cop again..."", says Patricia.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Looks like I get to play cop again..."", says Patricia.</p>
""I want to be the one to tell the Princess this time!"", says Horatio.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I want to be the one to tell the Princess this time!"", says Horatio.</p>
""I am feeling like I need to see the Princess too!  I am not feeling so good."", says Carol looking woozy.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""I am feeling like I need to see the Princess too!  I am not feeling so good."", says Carol looking woozy.</p>
""Enough out of all of you!!!  I can't have you bothering the Princess all the time."", says Henrietta.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Enough out of all of you!!!  I can't have you bothering the Princess all the time."", says Henrietta.</p>

""Hello, slaves,"" was all Celeste had said upon entering, her tone exceptionally upbeat and energetic, at odds with the connotations of the statement itself.

Standing over the corpse, hands on her hips, she shakes her head. Her ambrosial locks sway back and forth.

""Dear oh dear,"" she comments, still very chipper, ""What a waste. I suppose I haven't been training any of you properly. But it's very sweet that you will kill each other for my attention."" So very much sunshine drips out of her voice, it's a wonder she doesn't burst into flames.

Taking a seat in one of the plush armchairs, she crosses her legs at the ankles and puts her hands behind her head.

Conversationally, ""Now, you all need to listen to Henrietta and obey her. She's better than you. You all know that."" She's playfully teasing Henrietta, her favorite. Celeste would, and has, literally torn someone's head off for hurting Henrietta. Then she sucked all the blood out of the stump and threw the body off a skyscraper. One gets to do those kinds of things when one is Queen.

On the other hand, her statement is true, to a certain degree. Henrietta is better than most humans at most things. Moral worth is another question, and it seriously rubs Celeste the wrong way that her ghouls had murdered one of their own. She can't let that show, though, not yet. Killing a chicken to scare the monkeys will have to wait.

""Now do tell me. Who's dead? And why?"" She holds up her index finger for precisely one second. ""One at a time please.""

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Hello, slaves,"" was all Celeste had said upon entering, her tone exceptionally upbeat and energetic, at odds with the connotations of the statement itself.</p><p>Standing over the corpse, hands on her hips, she shakes her head. Her ambrosial locks sway back and forth.</p><p>""Dear oh dear,"" she comments, still very chipper, ""What a waste. I suppose I haven't been training any of you properly. But it's very sweet that you will kill each other for my attention."" So very much sunshine drips out of her voice, it's a wonder she doesn't burst into flames.</p><p>Taking a seat in one of the plush armchairs, she crosses her legs at the ankles and puts her hands behind her head.</p><p>Conversationally, ""Now, you all need to listen to Henrietta and obey her. She's better than you. You all know that."" She's playfully teasing Henrietta, her favorite. Celeste would, and has, literally torn someone's head off for hurting Henrietta. Then she sucked all the blood out of the stump and threw the body off a skyscraper. One gets to do those kinds of things when one is Queen.</p><p>On the other hand, her statement is true, to a certain degree. Henrietta <em>is</em> better than most humans at most things. Moral worth is another question, and it seriously rubs Celeste the wrong way that her ghouls had murdered one of their own. She can't let that show, though, not yet. Killing a chicken to scare the monkeys will have to wait.</p><p>""Now do tell me. Who's dead? And why?"" She holds up her index finger for precisely one second. ""One at a time please.""</p>

""Now Princess, why don't you let me handle this?"", asks Henrietta.

Celeste wants to, needs to, HAS to listen to Henrietta.  The Captivating Curse is strong.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Now Princess, why don't you let me handle this?"", asks Henrietta.</p><p>Celeste wants to, needs to, HAS to listen to Henrietta.  The Captivating Curse is strong.</p>

""Alright, I admit it.  Gloria was to be your cupbearer, but I am always the cupbearer.  Why was I scorned?  Why was I punished?  What had I done?"", cries out Vandal.

Vandal buries his head in his arms and sobs.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Alright, I admit it.  Gloria was to be your cupbearer, but I am always the cupbearer.  Why was I scorned?  Why was I punished?  What had I done?"", cries out Vandal.</p><p>Vandal buries his head in his arms and sobs.</p>
""Please let me do it - I've wanted to put this mad dog down for a long time."", says Horatio.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Please let me do it - I've wanted to put this mad dog down for a long time."", says Horatio.</p>

""Hey, I have a gun."", hints Patricia.

Patricia puts the gun to Vandal's head.

""Say the word Princess, I'll waste him right now."", says Patricia.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Hey, I have a gun."", hints Patricia.</p><p>Patricia puts the gun to Vandal's head.</p><p>""Say the word Princess, I'll waste him right now."", says Patricia.</p>
While Vandal continues to sob the rest of the ghouls are all looking in great anticipation at Vandal's imminent punishment.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>While Vandal continues to sob the rest of the ghouls are all looking in great anticipation at Vandal's imminent punishment.</p>

""Wow, Vandy, you could have just asked or something."" Celeste had a strong urge to tear half of Vandal's spine out through his stomach and beat his head in with it. She wouldn't actually do such a thing, but the vampiric imagination could be quite vivid where violence was concerned.

Cupbearer is a very high, honored position in mortal courts. The cupbearer, among other things, drinks from every vessel before the sovereign does, just in case it's poisoned. If he's trustworthy, he might die; if he's not, then the sovereign is an idiot. Kindred, though, it's not that important for.

She snaps her fingers at Patricia and makes a snkt sound by blowing air through her teeth. ""Down girl.""

Lounging backward like a cat and looking upside-down at Henrietta. ""What do you think?""

Favorite she might be, but Henrietta was not Celeste's executioner. Celeste didn't have one; when Kindred needed decapitating, Celeste did it herself. With that actually-made-in-the-1500s longsword on the wall in fact. It sat horizontally in a protective, decorated sheath, and below it was the massive, also authentic battleaxe she executed troublesome ghouls with. Nobles get the sword, peasants get the axe; that's the rule.

Executions are one of her choice public events: they display power and also entertain. Mortals enjoy watching the condemned being killed; Kindred enjoy it even more.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Wow, Vandy, you could have just asked or something."" Nobles get the sword, peasants get the axe; that's the rule.</p><p>Executions are one of her choice public events: they display power and also entertain. Mortals enjoy watching the condemned being killed; Kindred enjoy it even more.</p>
Patricia holsters her weapon and steps back.
<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>Patricia holsters her weapon and steps back.</p>
""Princess!  I'm sorry to interrupt, but Princess, I am not feeling so good.  I need just a small sip please!"", Carol looks like she is about to fall over.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Princess!  I'm sorry to interrupt, but Princess, I am not feeling so good.  I need just a small sip please!"", Carol looks like she is about to fall over.</p>
""Princess, it is her own fault.  She's wasting the blood - don't give that bitch anything special.  If she can't conserve like the rest of us than she doesn't deserve to be blessed."", says Oma.

<textarea class=""message-content-editor""><p>""Princess, it is her own fault.  She's wasting the blood - don't give that bitch anything special.  If she can't conserve like the rest of us than she doesn't deserve to be blessed."", says Oma.</p>
""Well some of us do more than others.  A lot more.  Those who do more, should receive more."", says Horatio.

The axe with the blue handle and the strange inscriptions is a master crafted weapon of power whose mysteries have yet to be plumbed. The one power that Holli has been able to identify is its craving for vengeance:

Vengeance (melee weapon): When you hit with this weapon while you are staggered, deal +1d6 (champion: +2d6; epic: +3d6) damage to that enemy.

""There is a vote coming up and I need your support.  I am calling a vote for a new Prefect, for me to be Prefect.  You are new to the Carthians, true, but having you support me would mean a lot.  My platform is that, yes the Princess is cruel, but we aren't strong enough to challenge the Invictus yet.  The rumors I've heard are most alarming.  We aren't ready yet, so we need less reckless leadership.

Will you support me?"", asks Carmilla.

""i think I have a better idea. Why don't you and the current prefect share the power for now? In another circustance I would support you,but if I do there might be a divide between our covenant. I just think beating  the Invictus is the priority. After that,who knows?

column3: Following the Cruise Missile attack on Spinward Knights Group Rifflandia Training Facility

column4: Cruise Missiles struck the Spinward Knights Group Training Facility on Rifflandia the night prior, it is the following morning and the extent of the damage is being surveyed, and interactions happen with the Goren World Services news crew.

column3: Jump to last post

column1: <div id=""messages-region"" class=""roleplay-messages span_12""><div><div class=""message-list""><div class=""message"" id=""message-326118""><div class=""row"">
“I am deeply saddened by the attack on the Spinward Knights
Group’s Rifflandia training facility last night.” Isha Carradine says in a
statement to the Goren Worlds Service news crew, “A group of armed militant
terrorists launched a surprise missile attack in the wee hours of the night,
specifically targeting our staffed medical facility, causing several injuries
to our non-combatant and medical personnel while simultaneously exposing the
clinic to the unforgiving cold and atmosphere of Efate.”
“The incendiary properties of the missile they fired caught our medical clinic
on fire, trapping the injured inside and slowing down any rescue and emergency
services from responding thanks to the high tech gravitic mines the attackers
deployed surrounding the Hospital facilities. The quick thinking and daring
actions of our staff helped minimize the casualties, and I am grateful to say
“I have only been on Efate for a short while but have found
the Efatean culture one of noble character, virtue, and a sense of personal responsibility
that I have come to admire greatly, and I would implore any of you. If you have
any information on the identity of these terrorists that would so callously,
and viciously launch an attack on a place of healing, to contact the Spinward
Knights Group, and your local nobility so these criminals can be brought to
